Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: paddyh117
Reviews.Content: This was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there 3 times so was expecting it to be good and was not disappointed. The hotel is 10 minutes from the city centre on the Metro, which is outside the door - so close in fact you can hear the trains pass underneath, however they really won't keep you awake especially if you do lots of walking like we did The rooms were spacious for Paris, clean, and the bathrooms were fine. staff were very friendly, and breakfast was typical European - just about enough to not complain about In Summary, I would recommend this without question - especially if you want to be near the Metro

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in January 2012. Having read reviews on here we decided it was the place for us, and we were not disappointed. Although not being in the centre of Paris, we seen this as a positive as it had a great community feel about the area, and the metro is only a few feet away taking you to anywhere in the city within minutes. The hotel itself was excellent and the staff were very friendly, taking there time to give us directions and recommendations on attractions. We were not affected by the noise of the metro line below and found it really convenient. The beds were the comfiest we'd ever slept in, including our own. We dined at local restaurants three times during our visit at Les Cascades and another round the corner from the hotel. Les Cascades was excellent and just opposite the hotel. The staff were very friendly even though there was a language barrier. The jugs of wine were cheap and very tasty and it was only a short drunken stagger back to our room! Although the breakfast wasn't to our taste, it was very well presented and the staff were very attentive. If we were to go back to Paris we would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BabsJC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely - rooms are very nice and clean. Only downside is the distance from the centre - but not a problem if you are happy taking the metro or bus - there are stops just outside. No restaurant in the evening. There is a breakfast room. It has a tiny lift - fun to try and squeeze everything in! The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, charming hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ron O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It is convient to the Metro and has a remarkable staff that will help you enjoy Paris to its fullest. Breakfast was a delicious way to start the day in the world's most beautiful city. Comfortable, immaculate, and small enough to feel at home. The value is beyond expectations. I can not recommend Hotel de la Porte Doree more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: TravelGleek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice this past summer, once in a group and again as a solo female traveler. Our first room was quiet and clean. The staff were very helpful. The staff were very kind when dealing with my attempts at speaking French but also were perfect at speaking English. The metro is a stone throw away, make sure you exit on the right side (just follow their directions) because you could get turned around your first time. Its very simple though. The area is fine but I didn't spend a whole lot time in it. There were really only two complaints I had. One was the WIFI was slow and sometimes not working, but it did storm and we were informed it was to be fixed. The second is that the single rooms are right next to the lift and the door on the lift slammed loudly. I mentioned this and was moved to a different room and was fine. I don't know if this is something they have fixed or not but I wouldn't let it distract you from a brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: Idlean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2012 - sorry for the delay in writing the review. I'd booked the hotel through their own website after looking around and reading earlier reviews on here. I also thought that it looked easy to find and get to and what looked like very comfortable and beautifully decorated rooms - especially for the price which I thought really reasonable. We were definitely not disappointed in any way. Our room was spotless and very comfortable, although we were aware of the metro line I have to say it didn't bother us. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel but did regularly get a coffee to go from the restaurant area before heading across the road to the fantastic bakery - a definite place to visit while you're here! The staff at all times were helpful and friendly, even when I was trying to use my very basic french! Overall a really great place to stay and we will certainly be back, hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolas414
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel located in the 12th arrondissement. Atmosphere, decoration and furnitures are really charming. Staff is very helpful. We had a standard room which was big enough. Ensuite bathroom was small but brand new. The room was furnished with old and nice furnitures. Breakfast buffet is small but includes all is needed (cooked eggs, ham, cheese, butter and jam, cereals, bread/croissants, fresh fruits and tea/coffee/fruit juices). Free wifi (weak network in the room) and TV Canal+. Location is not the best (not in the very center of Paris) but the hotel is located in front of a subway station. Finally, value for money is really really good for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week at Hotel de la Porte Doree”
Reviews.Author: Chelsey C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for about a week during our spring break in March. Based on our price point and the reviews of the hotel, we chose Hotel de la Porte Doree, and we were not disappointed. The hotel was gorgeous, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and they even had free wifi! It was so charming and lovely, it really brought it home for me that I was in Paris. Although it was very affordable, the hotel felt luxurious. The whole staff was friendly, and most of the desk clerks spoke great english. We opted not to go for the inclusive breakfast option, so I can't speak to that, but we really enjoyed the croissants we got every morning at the boulangerie across the street (and I've heard that those are the same croissants they use at breakfast). I wouldn't say there was a lot to do in the immediate area entertainment-wise, although there is a precious park just a few blocks away. We would have loved to rent a canoe there and take it out on the lake, but felt it was too cold. It was also super convenient to have a pharmacy and grocery store close to the hotel. I appreciated that we were in a part of Paris that wasn't too touristy. The metro is literally in front of the hotel, and although we could hear the trains when they passed by under us, they stop running at 1am and we never found the noise to be an issue, but it may bother a super-light sleeper. To get there from Charles de Gaulle, I would suggest a taxi. It only cost us about 40EUR, and we really appreciated the convenience with all the luggage we were hauling around (we chose to take a taxi on the way back). We took the metro from CDG on the way there and found it to be long and very difficult to maneuver (with luggage). As far as restaurants go, we tried both Les Cascades and Bistrot de la Porte Doree. We enjoyed the food at both, but found Les Cascades to have a more comfortable atmosphere. Les Cascades was also cheaper, so if you're looking to not go far from the hotel for dinner, either of those options would be good. Overall we had a great time and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanya s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The room was clean and very cute; we even had a little table outside. Although it is a little far from the center of Paris the metro is right there and there are several nice places to eat in the general area. I loved the suggestions put together by the hotel, we had a great meal at a bistro right around the corner. We paid a little extra for a larger bed and it was worth the money...very comfortable with nice bedding. I have stayed in some pretty crappy hotels in Paris for MORE money, the porte d'oree was by far the nicest I've stayed for the price range. As other reviewers have suggested, don't miss the boulangerie next door!

Reviews.Title: “Very Parisian - comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Dobsessed
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this brilliant hotel. The bakery directly across the road from this hotel has the BEST, literally the BEST Mille Feuille I've ever had in my life. Further down the road, there's the great restaurant - can't remember the name though, I'm sorry. Beds were very comfortable and free wifi that was quick.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our first visit so much we are returning for our second visit.”
Reviews.Author: kalena64
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Parisian hotel, We were there in Sept 2010 and will be there again in Sept 2012. The Owners are very fluent in English which helps alot and they made us feel so welcome. Very nice, clean rooms, comfy beds.The breakfast is wonderful as well. Lots to choose from. Metro is very close by. Looking forward to our visit and will be so much the better knowing we will be staying at your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Sabine6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and wonderully furnished. I felt like in a Agatha Christie novel. Rooms are very nice, clean and a real blanket, not just a linen. Breakfast is good, just the workers a little slow to see and fill empty baskets. This hotel is definitely not for sensitive ears because the Metro is right under the hotel building. Every 5 Minutes the Metro noises are too hear. Don´t take a room on 1st floor, you can´t sleep! The receptionist was so nice to give us another room on a upper floor. Still to hear, but a little less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mojo1107
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and kids for 3 nights ending our European vacation. The location of the hotel was great, 2 metro stations a few feet away made for quick and easy access to any attraction. Great café a few doors down for the petit dejeuner, and a wonderful bakery across the street got pack a nice lunch for later. The rooms we had were amazing, we had booked a quad expecting a room with 2 double beds, but ended up having 2 connecting rooms. After touring Europe for 3 weeks, it was pretty nice having the kids in a separate room. Rooms were very clean and air conditioned, beds were very comfortable. We had no problems whatsoever with the service. I doubt you could find a better value... Félicitation à l'équipe du Porte Dorée, vraiment un boulot exceptionnel, Merci.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Paris...”
Reviews.Author: jarheadz
Reviews.Content: We took a group of students here for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. First, the room is a combination of modern where it matters (updated bathrooms, clean and comfortable beds) while maintaining the charm of a Parisian hotel. The students absolutely loved how easy it was to run across the street for exceptional breakfast from the nearby bakery. There is food in each direction and you're a ten minute walk from other establishments. The decor is wonderful and most importantly, it's right next to a tube stop. We've stayed in Paris twice. The first time we were in the heart of the city and this time was far superior. What you lose in 20 minutes of commuting, you definitely make up for with a relaxing night of sleep in a comfortable/safe location. After spending so many nights in economical hotels, this was the perfect blend of financially reasonable yet feeling like you were at a fancy boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointing”
Reviews.Author: yvesvk_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March 2012 and we were rather disappointed after having read all the good reviews on this hotel. Location is very good: yes, it's a bit away of the major city highlights, but being on top of a metro stop with good and frequent connections, that doesn't bother at all. Is it value for money? Not in my opinion. To Parisian standards, 95 EUR a night may be a bargain, but does that mean that it takes you away the right to have hot water in the shower? Or that the dustbin in the (very small) bathroom may be stuck? When we told the reception we had no hot water, they told us (quote) this is normal, because a lot of people take their shower at this time of the day (end quote). They offered us the key to another room of someone who had just left, but that wasn't cleaned yet. We politely turned down the offer :-). We paid a few euros extra for a superior room to have a larger bed. Well, don't. The bed, which is comfortable, was no larger than 140cm, although they did promise otherwise on the booking site. Rooms are noisy, as you can hear the first metro depart in the morning, but that we knew, so it didn't bother us. If you're a light sleeper, you should consider ear plugs or simply staying at another hotel (which I would recommend anyway). The hotel is clean, nothing to say about that. Rooms are very small, but hey, this is Paris! Breakfast doesn't blow your head off, but there are plenty of bakeries around to spend your 10 EUR/person. Our expectations were much higher than what they could offer and that's a pity. Will look for something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel de la Porte Doree!!!”
Reviews.Author: XoMtz
Reviews.Content: My experience with Hotel de la Porte Dorée began even before I arrived, I emailed the hotel with a few questions and I always received a super friendly response almost immediately. I emailed several times trying to get info on a specific room I had read about, I knew they only had one in the hotel that had a terrace, so I wanted to make sure I got it when I made the reservation. Everyone was so polite over email I could not wait to get to the hotel and see if all the great reviews I had read were true . . . They are!!! First, we arrived very early in the morning, around 9am, hotel check in is much later but the lovely lady at the front desk made sure that our room was set up and perfect within an hour of our arrival, which gave us some time to explore around the area. The area is very nice, some say a bit far from all the tourist sites, but with the Metro station so close we didn't mind at all, we got everywhere within 20 - 25 mins. There is a pharmacy and a supermarket very close by, for a quick bite there is a Subway, Quick, McDonalds, we never ate in one of these fast food places, but is great that the McDonald's there is open until 1am, since I was always after coffee at all hours of the day and those were the biggest coffees we could find, other than Starbucks. There is also a wonderful place right across the street that sells paninis, pizzas and sandwiches that we absolutely adored and was always open, even at 3am! Very good food, even better prices :) I was so looking forward to try the bakery across the street that I read so much about, unfortunately it was closed during the time of our visit. But more about the hotel, they gave us the room around 10am, we get in and it is so nice, clean, beautifully decorated. It is the first hotel that I visit where the website photos actually match the place! The bed was so comfortable, the pillows, the duvet were dreamy. Considering standard Europe hotel rooms, our room was very spacious. The free Wi-Fi was awesome! It helped so much that we could use it every night to plan our next day and to keep in touch with our families. Also I was amazed at how many electrical outlets we had in our room, never seen that in European hotels I've stayed before, we had all our gadgets hooked up with no issues and even had a couple of outlets to spare! We had an iPod dock station so we could listen to our music, huge plasma TV mostly French channels, but we loved it! They were so nice to us and so considerate, it was wonderful, since we stayed up really late every night, they made sure we were not disturbed in the morning so we could sleep in! How nice is that! I can't say enough about the wonderful people at the front desk, they all went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect! We can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LEKBOCO
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a great value. The breakfast is fantastic and we were very comfortable. Don't miss the bakery across the street. We were disappointed that they forgot to clean our room and give us clean towels one day (after not changing our towels on request the 2 days before, so we were ready). However the manager was apologetic and and gave us free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Visitor from Finland”
Reviews.Author: Qelly
Reviews.Content: +big rooms, good bathroom, separated toilet. Very clean, renovated. Big wall-tv. Good wifi. Every morning somebody clean the rooms. I was in Paris 4-th time and this hotel is best of them. Other hotel didn`t clean rooms. +very good Patisserie accross the street. There is really fresh and warm pastrys. Best of all. I visit it every morning ;). +metro station is front of the door. +Subway and Mcdonaalds are near of the hotel if somebody need fast food. +Market/shop across the street near the Patisserie. + on tuesday or wednesday front of the hotel is outyard markets. -a bit far from Paris center like Champs Elysee and Louvre Rivoli. You must be change metro line but it is not big deficiency because comfort is important. -metro under the hotel ( not good for 1-st floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again! Charming and delighful hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: citycrush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel again in February after staying in May 2011. The hotel is still great value, with lovely and helpful staff that are a credit to the hotel. The hotel is located in a really nice area with a Metro stop seconds away, great bakeries and local restaurants and supermarkets nearby. Although the hotel is only 3 stars, everything is well thought out. The bedding is super comfortable, the decoration is lovely, there are iPod docks in the room, you can request wine glasses, coffees etc and the breakfast available was really good value at 10 euros. The computer room and the many books available are great touches that make the stay extra special. The only few downsides are that the hotel is quite noisy as it's an old building, but not enough to bother us at all and the bathrooms are tiny with fairly poor water pressure. But again, for a short stay of 3 nights, this was not an issue. The location is not an issue as you save so much on the price and really it's only a 30 min Metro ride to the main sites. I fully recommend this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat. It's great value for Paris and we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: GiggleLondon
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant long weekend at the Hotel de la Porte Doree! The staff were really attentive and able to answer all our questions We stayed in room 5 which was clean, spacious & very pretty- I really liked the decor, the room was stylish, the beds comfy and we both slept really well. The hotel is less than 2 minutes away from the metro and there is a bus stop is outside the door- easy access to all areas. Great value for money- I would recommend this hotel & I hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect”
Reviews.Author: liamshelley
Reviews.Content: + Great location just a few minutes from tube + Very convenient for central Paris + Lovely village atmosphere outside the door including great restaurants/boullangeries + Spotlessly clean hotel + Extremely comfortable beds + Fairly priced for city centre So many positives were spoilt by a freezing cold room. Rooms have their own temperature control but heating was totally inadequate. Went to reception twice to ask if I could have a heater and was told no. Must admit, it did ruin the whole experience on a freezing cold weekend. Not good business sense to loose a customer for a few euros.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Modern Competively priced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jt1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 44 The hotel Which was a large room 42" wall mounted colour tv,ipod docking station clean hotel throughout double sink in bathroom. Free fast wifi which saves you a bomb when abroad.helpful staff 24 hr reception right outside a metro stop probably the best value for money hotel in the whole of paris! Would definately recommend this hotel to somebody else and would stay again ideal for a romantic break modern, clean ,fresh throughout

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelwise07
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel de la Porte Doree for 5 nights (solo traveler) in January 2012. This is a fantastic 2 star hotel. Small, intimate, well decorated, bathrooms are updated with nice fixtures. It was renovated a few years ago. My single room was typically small, had a desk, newly painted, a window which opened, plus it was on a courtyard and very quiet. The bathroom was very nice albeit small. On the second floor, where my room was, was a small room with a computer for use by guests. The staff is very nice and helpful. The breakfast for 10 Euro is more than adequate. But it is because of its fantastic location that makes this hotel an even better find. The hotel is right in front of you as you ascend from exit 2 of the Doree Metro station on line 8. Line 8 is a very good line to be on because it is the line of Opera, Invalides, Bastille, Concorde. The Opera stop is where you catch the Roissy bus to CDG. Bastille is a great stop for restaurants and museums. This hotel is in a nice neighborhood with lots of boulangeries and shops, even a supermarket is 2 blocks away. You can hear the metro below while in your room but you do get used to it, no vibration, just the hum of the metro. If that is a drawback, so be it, the price of the rooms are definitely a great value and I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: JMMScotland
Reviews.Content: Only stayed there one night - I was catching a train next morning to Avignon - but I would have been happy to stay there for longer. Very pleasant, friendly staff. Spotlessly clean and well equipped room. The surrounding area is a pleasant place to wander about and Metro almost on your doorstep. Some very nice restaurants nearby. For some people the faint rumbling of the Metro underneath might be a problem but it didn't bother me. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect abode from which to explore and savor Paris”
Reviews.Author: chinabased
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfortable and easy hotel to stay in. I enjoyed its location, only 20 minutes from central Paris via metro (there's a convenient metro stop right outside the door), and also in a real neighborhood. I enjoyed observing Parisian life around the hotel as much as an tourist attraction. There is a fabulous patisserie across the street for easy and delicious croissant breakfasts, and several good cafes in the area. The day after I arrived, a pleasant street market appeared with all kinds of produce, pots and pans, and flowers, and cheeses. The street in front of the hotel is very good for walking, and if you have the energy you can walk to central Paris in about 40 minutes. The hotel itself was quaint, with great reception and service. Staff greet travelers warmly and are willing to help with requests from directions to understanding French directions for a local SIM card, to running across the traffic circle to find the taxi that had been ordered to get to the airport. They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and supported, from arrival through checkout and departure. The hotel contained the smallest elevator I have ever seen, but fit my medium size rolling luggage along with myself. My room was clean and comfortable, and designed to use each inch of space efficiently. I enjoyed the large window overlooking the street, crown molding, and tapestry linens, which all gave a sense of authenticity to the hotel. While small, the bathroom was newly renovated with rainforest shower head and outfitted with quality and clean towels, and good toiletry products. The one complaint with the bathroom is that the water pressure was set too high to for the mini size of the sink, often ricocheting off the edge of the ceramic bowl to the floor below, leaving puddles. The bed was quite comfortable and I enjoyed being able to view various cable channels on the flat screen TV and listen to my own music on the iPod radio provided in the room. The hotel has some noise from outside traffic, but this dies down at night. Being situated above a subway station means an occasional rumble from below, but nothing that disturbs sleep, and I'm quite a light sleeper. If I return to Paris, I would definitely stay here again. It's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Mini break in Paris, handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicheleH85
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris with my boyfriend for a mini-break. Booked this little boutique hotel, it was 2 mins for the metro stop. Was approximately a 20min trip into the centre and we were on the right side of Paris to go to Disneyland. The hotel itself was lovely, quite small but I believe this is typical here. The room was nice, comfy bed. Had a small bathroom and lovely shower. Was really clean! Flat-screen tv on the wall and an ipod dock. The only downside would be that there weren't any nice restaurants beside it (apart from a lovely bakery across the street and a market on Sundays) and the train ran under the hotel. I am a very light sleeper and found this a bit tough. Would recommend this place though, convenient, friendly staff and nice rooms. What more could you want for a city break!

Reviews.Title: “Would I come again? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: chris2k
Reviews.Content: I should have submitted this review much earlier but better late than never. I spent a lot of time choosing hotels in Paris before deciding on this one. It turned out to be an excellent choice indeed, even more so when the metro exit is literally steps from the hotel's entrance. It is located in a very agreeable neighbourhood - Paris 12, and is convenient too as there are many useful shops nearby. ***WHAT'S AROUND?*** Across the road you have Vandermeersch which serves the most divine pastries. Loved the croissants and pain au chocolat. And yes the mille feuille is to die for. Next to is is a supermarket which is great, you can buy mineral water here in a multipack which saves a lot of money compared to the nosebleed prices elsewhere. There's a small stationery shop too and for some convenient eats you have Subway, Quick and Mc Donalds. A self service launderette is a couple minutes walk away, on the same road as the Ibis if I'm not mistaken. If you need an even larger supermarket there's a Monoprix which is about a 5-10 minute stroll up ave Daumesnil or you could take the metro there. ***THE ROOM*** Back to the room, it was a single room, petite as communicated beforehand, nevertheless tastefully and charmingly decorated just like the rest of the hotel. It was clean and like others have mentioned the bed is comfortable. Getting the shower to be at the right temperature was a bit of a game though - it can be temperamental. But after a couple of days I managed to tame it and everything was fine after that. I really liked the fragrance of the shower gel/ shampoo provided. It may be a bit of a distance to the center of Paris, close to the Peripherique but with the Metro it's hardly an issue. By the way I have no idea why some reviews mentioned issues with the night porter, there was no surliness or anything of that sort. I even got smiles. And as for the Metro rumble I can be a light sleeper but it didn't bother me at all. All in all I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “FAB FAB FAB !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wisteriagirl
Reviews.Content: What a find !! I was already excited when I discovered this hotel and booked it, but I was really one of the best hotel I have ever came across. I absolutely adore the classical decore, which is getting more and more difficult to find. It's not at all like off-putting "bourgeois" style like Ritz, but just the right amout of old and new. Very gentle and feminine. I adore the old stove in the room! Madam Figaro Japon by the bed side, was fantastic ! I couldn't sleep, I wanted to read them all! I normally get happy if I'm happy with the interior, but this hotel was so great.... The bed was the most comfy bed I have ever slept, and what a friendly staff they got ! Even the breakfast serving man and cleaners are so friendly! I enjoyed the chat with them... The room was extra clean, I run B&B myself in UK, I know where to check to be fussy and mean, but it was spotless. I know how hard it is to keep up with this cleanliness. They must have a great cleaner with very high standard. And breakfast cereals are very yummy... All organic product make you feel better. Even the soaps in the room was organic, and it was deliciously flavoured and I loved it so much I had to take them home so that I can find where I can get some more of it. ( It was German, you can get imported...) I went to opera bastille on the day one, but it was great to get there so easy from door step, second day, I had to go to teh other side of Vancenne to see my friend, but it was easy and quick from Nation. Day 3 I took Roissy bus from opera, one doesn't have to change from no8 line. The area itself was so good, if I had more time, I should have enjoyed the wed market and park.... I found that this hotel is very child friendly. I reget I left all mine this time... I am definately coming back with my children next time to appeciate this hotel and the area !!! I really really didn't wnat to go home !!!! I could live there quite happily. I almost hesitated to leave the comment here, to keep this place secret .^ ^

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel. comfy beds!!”
Reviews.Author: missjay9
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel just on the outskirts of Paris. Not the nicest part of Paris but most certainly not the worst..... not but a long shot!! Right at the metro station so it makes it easy to get around. The receptionists are all so super nice and friendly, willing to offer any advice you need. There is also a very good, handy map of Paris given on arrival. The subway does run under the hotel and is a little noisy but i didn't find it too bad. My room was right next to the worlds smallest elevator and people were very noisy getting on and off of it at night and in the early morning with all their luggage, my bed was against the wall the elevator was on. I suppose someone has to take the room and the amazing heating and incredibly comfy beds made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely character hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NewtonSolney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the previouse reviews. Our room was on the second floor and wasn't huge but I found it adequate. Lovely period furniture, lovely french windows overlooking the street, bathroom compact but clean and well decorated (corner shower no bath). No problem with water temp, had a lovely shower each morning. I loved it. For the price I think this is excellent value for Paris. I could feel the underground trains slightly but not a problem, they stop running just after midnight and I wasn't woken in the morning and I am a light sleeper. Double bed was very comfortable. The hotel booklet had excellent recommendations of places to eat and drink and things to do. Receptionist was very helpful, and spoke English. Definately stay here again. Tube journey was c30mins to Hotel de Ville so if you want to spend time on the west side of Paris it will take a little longer than if you stay in St Germain area, but value for money, comfort and character this is recommended. Free internet on the 2nd floor and lots of books to borrow to read.

Reviews.Title: “Too good of a secret to give away.”
Reviews.Author: Nina P
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice stay, and I'm hesitant even to say I had such a nice time at Hotel de la Porte Doree because I want it all to myself! We stayed for two nights on a trip throughout France & Germany. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and they spoke English well. A cute little cafe across the street had a great lunch, and at the Vandermeersch bakery across the street everything was delicious. Vandermeersch was a cheaper alternative to the hotel's breakfast, but the hotel's breakfast had everything, too - cheese, meats, yogurts, breads, croissants, coffee, etc. Our room was a standard size with a very soft bed and newly renovated bathroom. The bathroom was tiny but had enough space, and functioned very well since it was all new. It was obvious the hotel is in an old building - the stairs creek and the walls look like they've been painted over many times. So, the hotel does not look as fresh as it's pictures, but it's still clean, comfortable, and charming. I wouldn't recommend it for a long stay in Paris because we spent a lot of time traveling back and forth from the city center on the metro; that can get tiring. But, for a short stay I'll definitely consider staying there again, or trying to find something just like it!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and welcoming, a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: NotoriousHAG
Reviews.Content: As a surprise gift from my boyfriend for Christmas, my trip to Paris was already steeped in mystery. After a very long journey our ascension from Porte Doree station was welcomed with the pleasant surprise of our hotel directly in front of the number two exit. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly night porter and given our key. The first thing that struck me was the decor- beautifully chic, this boutique hotel has all the attributes expected of a Parisian hotel but with modern amenities- by this I mean censored lighting, climate control for your bedroom, free wi-fi and a thoroughly cleaned room with fresh towels every day. Positioned directly in the epicentre of Porte Doree we were within stumbling distance of two fantastic nrestaurants, a wonderful bakery, supermarket and a fresh fruit street Market on Sunday. Getting around Paris was very easy as we were located directly on line eight which was quick and efficient. The hotel staff were more than happy to call ahead to make reservations at restaurants and help us map out our journeys. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and already have to several friends and family members. Jerome is a fantastic help and we would like to thank him personally for making our stay as perfect as it could be. Top three tips for a weekend in Paris: 1. Get a metro pass for the duration of your stay. 2. Use the free wi-fi to plan your day trips - trip advisor was a saviour! 3. Try eating at 'Chez Francois' in the old Air France/KLM headquarters- *book ahead* wonderful food, beautiful ambiance, very reasonably priced and only a 15 minute walk through the streets of Paris to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: sauraumpfa
Reviews.Content: This little old style hotel is very well located in one of the most expensive avenues in Paris. It is well maintained and has tasteful furnishings. The elevator is extremely small and one can hardly enter with the luggage. Price as compared to other Paris Hotels is very acceptable and location is good - Metro stations are very close within walking distance (5 min). Breakfast comes at an extra charge and offers very little. Coffee alone was 5 € which i find a rip off price especially when it is just normal filter coffee. The rooms are tiny but ok for sleeping only and very clean, the noise level is acceptable when the window is closed - expect substantial noise when you like open windows to sleep (i think it is impossible to sleep with open windows). The Metro may disturb a little but one cannot have everything close and complete tranquility at the same time. In my opinion it is a recommendable hotel for a short stay in Paris especially bcs. it is well located (lot´s of difference shops in Avenue Daumesnil) and close to many tourist sights .

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LePPrince
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel when staying in France. We were very satisfied the first time. The hotel isn't very expensive. The rooms look really nice, and are well decorated! The staff is very kind and helpfull. We were also happy to see that there was and i-pod dock installed in our room. Our only complaint was that the showers are horrible! The water shifts from super hot to super cold all the time. This is very frustrating!! Besides this, a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Adysi
Reviews.Content: Clean, pretty room. Close proximity to the metro. In hotel breakfast or cute bakery across the street for breakfast. Most of the staff spoke English and offered very helpful tourist information. They saved us hours in visiting Versailles and even let us print tickets in advance on their computer. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and perfect at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Kate E
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent Christmas in Paris and chose this hotel to stay at based on the reviews on trip advisor. We could not have made a better choice! The staff was helpful, friendly, and organised; they always greeted us with a smile. The hotel itself has so much character and is exquisitely clean. We got an upgrade to the Double Superior as they had overbooked the Double rooms. Especially considering the notorious small size of hotel rooms in Paris, the room was spacious and we never felt cramped. A huge plus -- the bed was extremely comfortable! There is a shop on the corner nearby where we were able to buy wine and snacks when returning to the room for the night which was always nice and the metro stop is literally in front of the hotel. As someone who is used to using the London tubes daily, travel was a piece of cake. Getting to the 7eme arrondissement took no more than 15 minutes and only requires changing metro lines once. We only encountered one issue in our stay and that was that the wifi was virtually unusable in the room. However, if we sat right by the door or in the hallway it worked flawlessly. Overall it was a wonderful experience and I highly recommend it to anyone, especially those travelling on a budget who still want high quality service and atmosphere. (The picture of the room really does not do it justice!)

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: trojansoldier
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 5 nights mid-September, split between two visits. First time, we were given a room on the 4th floor (room #42, if I remember right). It helped that they had an elevator which could just about fit one of us and our two suitcases. Room size was on the smaller end, but very clean with hardly any noise from the streets or the metro. One complaint though is that for whatever reason, the bathtub did not have a shower curtain. So it kind of got messy after took a shower but nothing terrible. We never complained but it probably will still be a good idea to check with the reception in case you are allotted room 42. On our second stay, we were given a room on the second floor, which had a nice shower cubicle. The room otherwise was quite comparable to the first one. We hardly felt the rumbling noise from the metro. In fact, if anything, it felt so convenient to have the metro station literally at the doorsteps of the hotel. On our second stay, we had breakfast included with the package. Breakfast was quite good though I probably would not pay 10Euro for it, instead would go over to the wonderful bakery across the street. Overall, I would recommend Hotel Porte Doree; it is good value for money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: CasandraDiaz
Reviews.Content: Little hotel w character, not centric ( need to take subway, right across st). Lovely neighborhood. V attentive service. Bakery across the st was out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a real bargain”
Reviews.Author: Placervilletourist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 4 nights in early September. We paid $79 per night on the 3 night package and $88 for the 4th night. Our room was small but very attractive. The hotel has been remodeled w/ attractive, modern bathrooms and good quality furniture and double paned windows. The continental breakfast was excellent. In addition to the standard breakfast fare of fresh fruit, cereal, and yoghurt, they served fresh daily croissants from the delicious bakery across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Although the hotel in located away from the tourist center of Paris, it is a few steps away from a subway line. It was a 15 minute subway ride from town center. Without question we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable abode”
Reviews.Author: crabbyhavoker
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay with great service. The staff were helpful and it made the stay an incredible experience. We missed booking one night and although they did not have the same rooms, they were very helpful in trying to accomodate us. So we stayed 2 nights in a twin room and 1 night in a deluxe. They helped to shift our luggage for us while we went sightseeing so that we did not have to wait while our new room was being cleaned and prepared for us. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “As charming as the little girl who showed you around in the video”
Reviews.Author: barbalicia
Reviews.Content: Could it be as wonderful as the "video tour" (with the little girl in the red cape) on the site suggested? And at such a reasonable price? It was that and more. Our room was a small one but perfect. The whole hotel was tastefully done. And VERY Clean!. Staff was VERY helpful and very pleasant (and always available). Never have to worry about loosing your key either. Easy easy access to the metro. Speaking of the metro - we heard it from our front first floor room but it was not a problem perhaps because the bed was extremely comfortable and it stopped after a certain hour. I liked that it was an environmentally thoughtful/benevolent hotel. We did not try the breakfast but will upon return - I think I heard mention of some organic ingredients. We did eat at a wonderful restaurant/bistro just around the corner and had delicious pastries from across the street. I would recommend this hotel highly and we have actually booked it for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pity about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: TSDUB
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful. The hotel is very nicely decorated and maintained. The locaton whilst a little outside of the centre is still within Zone 1 and very convenient to the metro. Our original room was tiny despite being a superior. We requested a change to the back of the hotel away from the main road and they kindly agreed. The second room was a twin and they put the bed together for us. This room was very spacious for Parisien standards and nicely decorated. However, the noise problems really affected our stay. The metro runs underneath and is quite loud. If you are staying try to get a room on the top floor. If it wasnt for the issue with the metro noise I would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Paris getaway”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend (Sat-Mon) and i can't fault the hotel whatsoever, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were furnished to a high standard and very spacious, the beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was lovely, in the rooms they had all the information you needed in a guidebook (very handy) the location was great, even though you are out of the centre it is quite nice staying in a different part of Paris that isn;t built for Tourists as such, plus there is the metro at the foot of the hotel, it is roughly 13 stops to the Eiffel Tower (which includes a line change) For food in the area i recommend the Italian which is a couple of doors down from the hotel, very reasonable, delicious food and the staff were lovely. All in all a great weekend and will definatley be returning and recommending to friends Oh and one last thing to add, we were located on the first floow so yes we could here the metro but it really is not a problem, it is't loud enough to stop you sleeping and i felt the rumbling sound weirdly comforting!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Edo_Zamboni
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the 12th district, a nice neighbourhood with quite a local feel, away from the hustle and bustle of more central districts. Friendly staff, all very clean, simple and pleasant buffet breakfast, attention to detail, a quirky tiny lift, the metro station just a few metres away and the really nice boulangerie Vandermeersch (http://www.boulangerie-patisserie-vandermeersch.com/) just opposite -amazing kouglofs there!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: Metro Rumblings that make guest's sleep tremble”
Reviews.Author: diana c
Reviews.Content: Although, Hotel de la Porte Doree is quite cute, guests are woken up by the constant rumblings of the metro underground, the neighborhoods that surround it are questionable and there is a construction mess that makes it hard to get to. More importantly, tourists will be charged a month later if the hotel RECEPTIONIST makes mistakes on payments. Sorry, we would have loved to recommend your place. BUT, the service was unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice inn-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mgoldstn
Reviews.Content: Very clean, inn-like hotel with a very friendly staff. I found it after much searching for a decent priced place to stay that was clean and in a good location. This met all my criteria and I recommend it for those looking for the same.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and updated.”
Reviews.Author: truewallace
Reviews.Content: Since this was my first trip to Paris/France I had nothing to relate the hotel to, by french standards. However, having traveled throughout europe I found this hotel to be clean and quaint, with surprisingly spacious rooms. The weekend hostess, Lucy, at the front desk was a jewel. She made our stay at the Porte Doree very enjoyable and was most helpful in giving directions and setting up tours. The 10 euro continental breakfast was adequate and the coffee divine. We wound up eating most every morning in the breakfast room as it was a nice and relaxing way to start the day. This hotel is literally steps from the Porte Doree metro stop which was remarkably convenient. Also, Pizza Cosi across the street makes pizzas to give any in Italy a run for the money. Although the hotel is a little farther out from the main tourist attractions (Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Eiffel tower, Champs Elyesee, etc) the proximity to the metro stop makes it bearable. Our room was on the 4th floor and overlooked the street. It was large by european standards and very clean. The flatscreen tv was HUGE. We had two lovely windows for when it got a little warm. I loved that the toilet was separate from the rest of the bathroom. I was traveling with my elderly mother and we both felt very safe and secure in this hotel and the neighborhood overall. One major tip: If you are a light sleeper you may want to consider a different hotel. The proximity to the metro is lovely in the morning when you are trying to get around, however at night when you are trying to get to sleep it's a bit bothersome as it rattles the whole property. I probably wouldn't have noticed but I was already having sleep issues due to my mother's snorring.

Reviews.Title: “DEvans”
Reviews.Author: Derek E
Reviews.Content: I honestly would have nothing bad to say about this hotel, everything was first class. Whilst not in the centre of Paris all the major attractions are only 20 minutes on the Metro which is much easier than a 300 euro a night hotel. Superb place, great atmosphere in it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great staff, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: riba26
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews on TA, I decided to book this hotel for our 3-night stay.. and I don't regret it at all because it was an absolutely wonderful experience. The room was very clean, had a nice Parisian feel to it, and the beds were veeeeerrrry comfortable. When we got there, the lady at the desk gave us a free upgrade since they had available rooms, so we were thankful for that! I read that some people could hear the metro - we couldn't at all. Slept like babies (on the 3rd floor). Breakfast was very good - had everything from croissants and baguettes to several different kinds of fruit, yogurt, drinks, etc. The location was excellent - literally a couple steps from the metro! Yes, it is a little outside of Paris, but this didnt bother my husband and me at all. You have to ride the metro if you want to get anywhere in Paris anyway, so what's an extra 5-10 min? The hotel also has free internet, and if the wifi on your phone isn't working (like ours wasn't), the hotel provides a free computer to use on the 2nd floor. This was a big plus. Overall, we had a very positive experience and will definitely be back! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: Mariano N
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews about this place and it really stands to it's fame. The decoration of the place is awesome and the receptionist are really kind and helpful. Our room was a small but very comfortable, specially the bed. It's a few steps away from the metro station so you can travel to all the city in a few minutes. The area is also great, with lots of bars and places to hang out. We really recommend this hotel and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel with Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Morgo50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way but for the price it is a great value, The best thing about this hotel is the front desk staff! Lucie was especially wonderful! The rooms are small but feel very french and the metro is literally outside the front door and will take you anywhere you need to go in a short amount of time. The only negative is that the metro does run under the hotel and if you are a light sleeper, like my husband, it can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girly break in the heart of France”
Reviews.Author: thebaberanch
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel from outside were not the best, however as soon as I stepped in the door the magic began. The staff are extremely welcoming (especially Jodie at reception who helped us greatly throughout our stay). The rooms are not the biggest but are typically French in character. The beds are really comfy with duvets and pillows you can just sink into. The bathroom is spotless and the towels changed everyday as well as any toiletries replenished. Sleep quality was good, although at times you could hear a distant rumbling of the metro- it is so easy to sleep. We booked a triple room & it took the form of 1 double & 1 single. It was a great price for 3 nights it worked out to be 114 euro each inclusive of breakfast. Breakfast is continental in style & consists of croissants, baguettes, lots of other breads, cereals, fresh fruit juice, tea, coffee, hot choc, & fresh fruit. The location is excellent being only a few meters away from the metro. 10 one way tickets cost 12.50 euro so it works out only as 2.50 return into the heart of Paris. Also the surrounding area is lovely, full of character & lots of eateries & bakeries & if you like walking shops further on down into the town. However, one night we ventured into the pizza place just 2 doors down from the hotel & it was horrible- full of grease! If you travel about 2 metro stops down (about 10mins walk) you will come across far nicer places to eat! On check out we were able to book at taxi back to the airport which cost 51 euro between 3 of us to Charles de Gaulle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, although small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mickymc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the metro and so is very convenient for getting into central Paris, so do not worry about the hotel being a little further out than others may be. The metro is a good service. The rooms were very beautiful and clean, although they were tiny. The breakfast was fine. Then staff were very friendly. Overall i would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPBB
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel. The rooms are not so big, but they are clean and the bed is very confortable. The Staff is kind. For me the drawback was the localization. It is very close to a metro station, but is far from the center of the city and the main touristic places. Because of this, it took a long time to come back to hotel everytime we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: monivros
Reviews.Content: Close to metro which is convenient Clean, beautifully decorated room with framed paintings and red curtains Friendly multilingual staff but receptionist got too busy and forgot to book our morning taxi for the airport trip. Great buffet breakfast. Tiniest lift in the world. Can hear the metro and ambulance on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: May333
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with a friend for three nights in this hotel. Maybe I raised my expectations a bit too much because of all the really good reviews but this hotel was only average. Why the rooms were very, very nice and very clean our room was obviously freshly painted and smelt badly of paint the whole time. In fact when we first arrived a painter walked into our room before apologising and leaving so I don't think that they were quite finished. The smell really irritated us especially as it's so easy to prevent the smell of wet paint. Also the room actually rumbled every time a train went past, while I'm a heavy sleeper and this didn't bother me at all my friend had trouble sleeping. Everything else about this hotel was great, it wasn't too far on the metro to get anywhere, which is what I was worried about. The bathroom was clean (and very small) with the toilet in a separate room to the rest of the bathroom which I really liked. We didn't have any problems with the wifi but there was someone else in the hotel who kept using their laptop while sitting n the stairs because they couldn't get a connection in their room. Food wise a lot of the restaurants near the hotel are quite pricey. And the hotel's breakfast was overpriced for what you got and they were quite disorganised. Over all I think I would stay here again but I wouldn’t pay full price, it just wasn’t worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmin D
Reviews.Content: great character, great price, great location. Rooms are pretty and clean and our room (at the front) overlooked the bakery and street. Staff were friendly and helpful. All in all 10/10. many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: mcwee
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in this hotel. Still the same pleasant experience. However, seems that I been having problem to get connected with wifi using my IPad. I would recommend anyone from Gare du Nord or traveling to Gare du Nord from this hotel to take bus instead of metro if you are carrying big luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Small but by clean”
Reviews.Author: mtallyca
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with three adults. Room was small but very clean. Very reasonable price for three adults. The hotel came with free wifi. The staff speaks english and are very helpful. The hotel is next to a metro station. The good, you catch the metro very quickly. The bad, you can hear the metro station late at night. Lots of restaurants to choose from. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice about booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iona T
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Porte Doree for two nights in mid August of this year, which was my first time in France, let alone Paris. I am a 17 year old student so I am used to staying in basic hotels, and from the price my friend and I paid I was not expecting anything special. How surprised we were! The hotel decor is beautiful: authentic, detailed, and really cute in a French way! The rooms are very large with lovely en-suites and extremely comfy beds. We had a twin room which had doors opening onto a mini-balcony and a great view of the street below. Even though Porte Doree is not in the centre of Paris the hotel is very close to the metro station (we couldn't hear the trains so I don't know what other people are complaining about) which is why it is so cheap. The staff are also very friendly and helpful and speak perfect English. All in all, a GREAT find! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Right choise”
Reviews.Author: NicoloPavia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situeted quite out of the city-centre in a really paeceful neighborhood, not far from the Tusseau Pediatric Hospital so the most of the people are pregnant ladies or kids; it's extremely near of the metro station ( porte d'oree) on the 8th line, well linked with the most used 1st line that connect all the major point of interest in the city. The inside of the hotel is in a historical-art design and the rooms ,which aren't small at all, are clean and comfortable, like the bathroom. The personal of the hotel is really friendly and able to speak different languages... to conclude it's the right choice to stay for visit Paris in a lovely way!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, convenient and affordable boutique hôtel.”
Reviews.Author: Amelie F
Reviews.Content: I work in a 5 star hôtel in Montréal and I enjoyed my stay at l'Hôtel de la porte dorée. My dad and I travelled to Paris in October 2011. We stayed in a roon with 2 twin beds for 118 Euros/night. -Metro station at the doorstep of the hôtel. -Eco friendly hôtel. -Free Wi-Fi and computer room. -Quality bedding and bathroom products. -Courtious and informed staff. -Breakfast room with lots of choices for 10 Euros per day. Ham slices, turkey slices, cheeses, oeufs à la coq (Hard boiled eggs), bread, cereals, yogurts, croissants and chocolate croissants, coffee, tea and many kind of organic and fair trade juices. -Steps away from the hôtel: Supermarket, Bistro, bakery, 2 fast food restaurants. The only concern I had was security: Like in the old days, you need to leave your room key at the front desk whenever you come and go.The only information the front desk staff asks for when you want your key, is your room number. So,if anyone with wrong intentions hears you, they can easily find a way to access your room. Tip: If you have heavy or many suitcases, don't take the metro from the airport to the hôtel, take a taxi. I landed at Charles de Gaulle airport and tought it would be a good way to save money to take the metro to get to the hotel. But, after having to change metro lines 3 times and having to go up hundreds of steps to get from one metro station to the other, it was definitly not woth it. Overall, very pleasant stay.Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Off-the-beaten track”
Reviews.Author: michaelgreen13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de la Porte Doree is located just inside the Peripherique a short walk from the Bois de Vincennes, a large park with paths ideal for running. It is on a 5 block modestly upscale strip of Daumesnil with nice shops, cafes, boulangeries and restaurants. When we visited in September, there was a large farmer's market on the street on Friday. It will take 20-30 minutes on the metro to get to the major tourist sites. The rooms are very pleasant, well-maintained and well-equipped, and offer very good value. The 10 euro breakfast, if you are so inclined, is substantial and of good quality. The vibe is a quaint mixture of the traditional (keys to the rooms are handed in and picked up from the concierge when going and coming from the hotel) to the hip (an emphasis on local and organic food at the breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel, needs sound proofing!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly7612
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel del la Porte Doree for 8 days, long enough to have several loud neighbors to know it's a hotel problem, not a specific neighbor problem. We really liked our room, it looked exactly as shown on their website - perhaps a bit smaller but it was what I expected for a European hotel. The shower functioned fine. We had a problem with all of the noise. The cleaning staff start early and they want you up and out early. They make enough noise to wake the dead and even came into our room at 9:00am to clean, I was still sleeping. There is a lot of noise that comes from the room above because of the laminate floors, we hear our upstairs neighbors every night. They also need to address the noise that comes from the adjoining rooms, we had very "affectionate" neighbors on several nights - I don't want to hear that!! And more than once was too much for us. And finally the metro noise and vibrations, every time the train goes under the hotel you hear it and feel it and we were on the 4th floor, I can't imagine the noise on the 1st floor. There was one quite aggressive woman on the front desk, she had a short temper and wasn't interested in providing information. We just left her alone after our first encounter and dealt with the other staff. Our stay was good, not great. We loved Paris and we'll be back but probably to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In a quiet corner of Paris that feels authentic”
Reviews.Author: BeachvsMountains
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Decent price and good value for city hotel In a quiet corner of Paris that feels authentic Close to parks and greenery of Promenade Plantee Computer and internet access for guests Charming staircase with books/nice architecture Located near a metro station While rooms are small they were very clean and hotel is in safe area Across the street from a great boulangerie Most days (Oct 14-17) a charming girl at reception always greeting us with a smile and help The Cons: While close to the metro, the ride to some Paris sights can take a long time - over 30 minutes with transfers Even on the 4th floor you hear the subway rumbling; Strong enough to really shake the building. Not a big deal to most city folk but worth a mention to light sleepers No complimentary coffee or tea On our last day, Tuesday Oct 18, different lady working reception was far less helpful than her colleague working the previous days A few points that address other peoples posts: The Italian place a few doors down is not that good. Their pizza is nasty. Too soft and chewy, not enough sauce. Also, the hotel is no greener than the next. Going green is nothing new, it does not mean saving energy only by not washing towels everyday and asking guests to turn off the water when brushing their teeth. That's 1980's green. 2010+ green is finding ways to use renewable energy, recycle smarter and exclusively utilize local resources. As for the elevator, sure its tiny, but this is Europe and at least they have one. Anyway, I digress...Overall, an excellent hotel choice that I would recommend to any traveler staying in Paris for more than 3 nights. Although with 2 nights/less time or a business trip you would be better staying closer to the city center. For a hotel in a major city, the price is a good value given that the pros outweigh the very few negative points.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SLL_11
Reviews.Content: We booked a really good weekend deal and decided to try this hotel, despite it being a little out of the main centre of Paris. We need not have worried - the metro is just outside and in 10-15 mins, you are in the very centre of the city. The area is fairly quiet but there are some lovely restaurants - the pizzeria three doors down is pretty good and the Bistro de la Porte Doree just round the corner is excellent and does a brlliant menu deal with great French cooking available. The hotel is small and basic in terms of amenities but spotless and staff were friendly and helpful. The nearby train line did reverberate a bit through the night but it wasn't dreadful and was part and parcel of the experience! We booked a superior double and I would recommend that as we were advised the standard double was smaller - the superior certainly wasn't huge although it was enough for what we needed and the bathroom was a decent size. Again, the room was spotless and the hotel is one of only four environmentally accredited 'green' hotels in Paris - something they are very proud of and work hard at maintaining. We had no problems at all with the hotel - one tip, probably don't book the breakfast as, at ten euros, you can buy coffee and croissants cheaper out and about but they were very flexible with our departure - we couldn't retain the room beyond checkout but they stored our luggage, free of charge, into the early evening on our last day so that we gained a full extra day of sightseeing without the hassle of carrying bags etc. I would really recommend it as a great base for a short break and we will certainly be returning next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raeberlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel de la Porte Doree for a week in September after reading about it on Trip Advisor. It was an excellent stay and I can also recommend this hotel. Although located outside the center, the Metro stop is right in front of the hotel and takes you directly to the Bastille, Opera and Concorde stops. The rooms were charming and exceptionally clean. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The area was safe, residential and close to the Bois de Vincennes. I travel frequently to Paris and will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain with style”
Reviews.Author: Kultur42
Reviews.Content: I'm a 60 something traveller who has visited Paris many times through the years. Hotel de la Porte Doree shows that even the well worn travel dog can find a new experience. My wife and I decided to walk the elevated garden path that runs nearby the hotel up to the viaduct of the artistes.....beautiful....peaceful......quiet and very much Paris. Nearby Bercy Village which we learned had been the warehouse area for wines being sent by barge from Burgundy was another surprise with shops, hip housing, and yet another beautiful garden. There are some nice, reasonably priced restaurants in the neighborhood....great experience. Do be mindful of the fact that rooms are small, but quite stylish and that the Metro will be a necessity for most people trying to reach the popularly visited areas of the city. The staff is extremely helpful and professional and the overall decor is "upscale".

Reviews.Title: “Two Stars is Fine for Me”
Reviews.Author: bovine44
Reviews.Content: I just completed a stay at this hotel - first for a few days with a friend in a room with two twin beds and for the second part of the trip, I had a single room. I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel de la Porte Doree. For those who need more amenities, space, etc, I would suggest a three or four star hotel with the resulting increase in rates. My rooms were clean. While, indeed there was only one electrical outlet - with a little bit of organization, all your droids, pods, pads and cameras can be easily recharged. I had a minor problem with a sink leak that was fixed by the time I returned to the hotel at the end of the day. I had all the hot water I needed. The breakfast for 10 euros was enormous and a good value. The Vandermersch bakery across the street is an added benefit as it is rated as one of the finer patisseries in Paris. A previous poster reported waiting 10 minutes for a Metro transfer, but in nine days the most I waited was five minutes - there is nothing like a Metro trip for learning about the citizens of Paris and reading up on your next visit to a monument or a museum. After awhile, the rumble of the metro under my third floor room became slightly comforting - odd, but true (I grant that a first floor experience might be different!). All staff were helpful, kept my cheese in the fridge until my departure, and gave me helpful advise about the neighborhood. I will return -

Reviews.Title: “A bargin in Paris but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: paw0105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in late September. For the price it is hard to complain but I do wish that we had paid more and stayed closer to city center. The Metro does run under the hotel (which you can constantly hear running) but the train rides were long and took up over an 1 & 1/2 hours everyday of our stay. Besides the noise and the long train rides our room had a fowl smell and the showers ran from ice cold to very hot many times during a shower. This hotel does not provide coffee makers in the rooms and we found myself paying over $10/day for coffee. We were also charged 5 euro per day for some service charge fee at the end of our stay that we didn't see coming. Start adding it all up and paying more for a hotel in a more central location would have been a better choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic price.”
Reviews.Author: notimpressed4894
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Porte Doree in August and we were astounded by the quality of the hotel- I've stayed in 5 star hotels that haven't been decorated as nicely as this one. We arrived quite late and the man on reception was helpful and explained everything- our room was on the third floor and was spacious and impeccably clean. It had two large windows which opened out onto the street and was really nice for looking out onto the street into the morning. The hotel's really easy to get to (although we got a bit lost because we forgot our directions) and we found it just as convenient as staying in the very centre because the metro runs until at least midnight and our all day pass covered out to the hotel too. It's also nice to be out of the touristy bits and have a bit of quiet. The best bit was the price; £60 a night for a twin in such an expensive city is a real bargain- 100% recommended. .

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Nice staff, EXCELLENT bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ido K
Reviews.Content: Great value. although the elevator is sometimes not available and is pretty small. sometimes you hear the subway, but it's not something that will wake you up or annoy you really. The bed is the BEST THING that happens after a long day at paris, it's one of the most comfortable beds I ever slept on. the metro (Port doree, line 8) is just 5 steps from the hotel entrance, although it takes like 15 minutes to get to center of Paris. the staff were really friendly, most of them speak English fluently (especially one receptionist, who was extremely helpful and nice) they were open to solve any problem for us. we were spontaneous so the price was not so cheap, booking in advance will save you money. also, the room is pretty small, but I actually think it was really sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel80
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for three nights in No. 7 in august of 2010. We loved our stay here! The owners were so helpful with directions and suggestions for sightseeing and shopping. Our room was lovely and clean and the air conditioning was an extra bonus. The metro was only a few steps away as well as several good restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caitparedes
Reviews.Content: We loved the style and atmosphere of the hotel and the rooms. Was a little far from most attractions but close to the metro station. Very nice staff. Our room was immaculate all wooden floors which i love since i have bad allergys. We stayed for two nights. I would reccomend to anyone coming to paris

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rpapic
Reviews.Content: Great value right by subway (subway stop is 20m away from hotel front door). Only complaint is that the comforter we had was stained. Sheets were clean however.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Rafael_RLDB
Reviews.Content: We got the least expensitve room. In general, the hotel is good and I would recommend it. The Good: a) Staff was always kind and almost all of them speak very good english. This was very handy, since we didn't speak french at all. b) Rooms are very, very clean. c) Bed is quite comfortable. d) Shower is great e) There is a delicious boulangerie (bakery) right accross the street f) Subway station is 20 steps from the hotel door. g) Restaurants and 2 supermarkets nearby The bad: a) There is no small refrigerator on the room, even though there is an ice machine at the ground floor. b) Rooms are small for Brazilian/American standards. If your weight is more than 250lb or if you are more than 6 feet tall, you won't fit on the shower and it will be a little hard to walk inside the room. Maybe on more expensive rooms you will get more space. c) Subway line is the 8. To move around the main touristic sites, you will have to spend at least 10 minutes inside the subway just to reach the first connection line. d) There are only 4 TV channels. But, since we didn't speak french, that didn't make any difference e) Since the hotel is small and all floors were made by wood, it was a bit noisy. So, you get a good benefit for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and wonderful breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: L_J_G_Perth
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately when we first arrived at the hotel the room that we had booked was being repaired due to a leaking shower. The staff were very professional, giving us a couple of options of what we may like to do, and keeping us informed until we could be put in the room type that we had initially booked. The breakfasts at the hotel were lovely and fresh The room was sufficient and nicely furnished, it wasn't huge, but certainly big enough if you're using is just as somewhere to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Tripadvisor, Hotel Porte Doree Can Not Be Wrong.”
Reviews.Author: yklimSingapore
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Europe, thanks to tripadvisor, we choose a great hotel in Paris regardless of their outskirt location. We are quite satisfied the 6 nights from 23-26 Aug and 29 Aug to 1 Sept with the different rooms during our stay. Our only complaint may be our second stay in room #28 was a bit of disturbing sound from the underground and red rashes caused by the bed sheet or insects bite. Nathalie and the other young lady are very friendly and helpful but the guy is not. We enjoyed the fresh bakery from Boulangerie opposite the hotel and the wonderful coffee from the other end of the road, forgotten the shop name but ending with Marie. My advise to travellers in Paris, be aware of pickpocket especially in Metro or train, I became their victim and lost over S$2k and it really spoil my holiday mood. I will definitely be back to this hotel and hope that their Government will look into the crimes situation with best solution.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: apitijack
Reviews.Content: People staying at this hotel are discerning travelers familiar with Tripadvisor reviews, they know how to make good choices. We were attracted by a/c, price and location. Unexpectedly, our 7 year-old granddaughter came too, staff provided an extra bed for a modest charge. Within walking distance there was the best aquarium we've ever seen, an extremely large park with row boats, ponies, a temple, bird-life etc. It was a great place for little ones to explore in safety. The area around the hotel is safe and friendly. Just down the road was a supermarket (with a smaller one immediately across the road), and nearby were bakeries and a Subway (as well as other fast food outlets) close by. Staff were well informed of routes and attractions. The rooms was spotless and extremely comfortable. The No. 46 bus travels directly to and from from Gare du Nord , or take exit No. 2 from Port Doree Metro which emerges almost at the hotel doorway. We plan to return one day and explore some more.

Reviews.Title: “Have already recommended it to family and they have booked.....”
Reviews.Author: PCfirefighter
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Hotel de la Porte Doree, it was ranked #165. As it steadily moved up in the rankings to #116, I knew we had made the right choice. This hotel was exactly what we wanted for the price we paid. If money is no object, stay in the 1st or 2nd arrondisements and walk out of the hotel and into the Louvre entrance. But for the budget minded traveller- this fit the bill. Quick and easy metro access. Good breakfast for 10 euro. Friendly staff- especially liked Jodi- always helpful and going the extra mile to assist with shuttle, advice, etc. The rooms are a little small but cozy and have all the room you need unless you are throwing a party in your room. We had the smallest room in the hotel ( or so it appeared after peeking into other empty rooms) and we were fine with it. Soft beds, great towels, good linen, wake up calls on time, and a double window that let in the night air if we were tired of the A/C which was nice also. The Metro is a great people watching affair. We enjoyed our Metro time and it gave us time to talk, plan our day or rest our sore feet. There were convenient bakeries all up and down the street in front of the hotel and many good restaurants. A bonus was the park with the lake. We LOVED it and it gave us a great place to relax and unwind in the middle of a 10 day trip to regroup and not be in the hustle and bustle of tourism. One of the things that was our favorite tour in Paris was the Chateaux Tour in the Loire Valley. We really liked the old castles and the drive through the French countryside..... the Giverny and Versailles tour was great also. All in all, no complaints with the hotel. The previous reviews were pretty much right on. Doubt we will ever be back to Paris, too many other places in the world to see, but would definitely recommend it to others. Should be a 3 star and not a 2- hope they correct that soon. Merci......

Reviews.Title: “A gem tucked away a few stops from the center”
Reviews.Author: Juantoronto
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is small hotel a few subways stops from Paris major attractions, it is set in a working class area and for what I saw, very safe. The receptionist (i do not remember her name) is a native English speaker and was very pleasant and efficient. The AC really works and can cool, down your room easily (there is a thermostat) breakfast was an excellent deal and the guy who serves it very nice and quiet man. My only beef was with the room was next to the elevator and the door always make some noise, but after walking so much and I did really care. The place is excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: nycrunner2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this charming hotel for 2 nights with my bf and our friend. Our room was cozy, and very clean, and nicely appointed.
