Though we were not smack in the center of town, I actually liked this aspect since the bistros nearby were more "authentic" and not tourist traps. The Porte Doree metro is 2 minutes away from walking and it never took more than 10-15 minutes to go sightseeing. I am a runner, so it was nice to run in Bois De Vincennes, an enormous park nearby (3 blocks away) - It is 3x the size of Central Park. I was pleasantly lost in the park and it was really nice just to run there. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, I think they offer it for 10 Euros. The only complaint I have is that the free wifi is not accessible in the rooms because of the thick walls. We had to open the door and stand in the hallway for wifi. But overall, great value for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jozamani
Reviews.Content: We visited in august for three nights and had a fantastic experience. We travelled with a three year old and were made to feel very welcome. Room was good, clean and very comfortable. Staff are exceptional. There are a number of places to eat locally. Whilst the hotel is a bit out of the centre of town, travelling to attractions was fine. The metro is far superior to the public transport in the uk! If you have small children and worry about taking them to a hotel then this is the hotel for you. We will definitely be returning when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: buwcu
Reviews.Content: I only spent 1 night in Hotel de la Porte Doree for my friend's wedding and loved the hotel. It is nicely and probably recently renovated. The rooms were quite comfortable and clean, however I must say that if you are staying single, the rooms can be a little smaller. The only problems are the air condition, which was central and could not decrease the room temperature immediately, and there was no refrigirator in the rooms. However, the hotel staff was very helpful and kept our cheese in the hotel's main refrigirator. Hotel staff was really helpful and speak english pretty fluent. I also loved the hotel's interior especially the libraries in the staircases. And I must mention the beautiful paintings as well. The most important thing is the price and the hotel's closeness to metro line 2 (2 minute walking). And there is McDonalds and Quick right by the side and a little market where you can buy wine and cheese. I believe the hotel is pretty good considering its price and I definitely would go back and stay there next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sean A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 16 nights and found the rooms very comfortable, well maintained, and clean. Our rooms were cleaned daily. The bathrooms were more than adequate. The breakfast was good. We felt secure at all times and all the staff were friendly and willing to help with any questions we had. Overall the stay was enjoyable and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel on the outskirts of Paris city centre”
Reviews.Author: ShaunW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel de la Porte Doree for three nights in August 2011. The room that we were allocated felt very small at first however I think this is not unusual for Paris. It was very pleasantly decorated and the room and bathroom were very well equipped. Wireless internet access from the room was a bit patchy but we soon worked out where the good spots were. The staff were very helpful in assisting us with the few enquiries that we had. We didn't sample the breakfast at the hotel as we decided to try the boulangerie across the road on our first day and loved it. So instead we bought from there and had a little picnic by the lake in the Bois de Vincennes which is very close by. The hotel is located on the outskirts of central Paris however the Port Doree metro is right outside the hotel and takes you to the centre pretty quickly. There are a few restaurants within a very short walk from the hotel (as well as the fabulous boulangerie) and we found them to be excellent. As mentioned earlier, the Bois de Vincennes is also within a very short walk from the hotel and this was very pleasant to visit on a sunny day. Overall, we were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Little private hotel, not too close and not too far from the center, next to the metro (you can indeed feel the underground while in the room but not too much). Liked the courteous and professional staff. Not any problem at all in communicating in English. Little weird was that they don't have room for ironing, so they install the board next to the reception in little corner, but it was fun and I don't mind. Nice reception area, small cosy rooms (no surprise for Paris). Free internet and computer in little room, OK breakfast for reasonable extra charge: what else can you wish? And the very personal recommendations written by the staff as to where to go for great dinner experience and what to do in the neighborhood: just excellent!

Reviews.Title: “C'est mignon :)”
Reviews.Author: tammyMontreal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nites here. We LOVED it!!!!!!!!!!! When we arrived, we were surprised how beautiful the facade of the building was. The inside was quaint and full of character. Our room was adorable, we had a twin room, larger than the normal rooms, on the 3rd (4th for Americans and Canadians) floor. Everything was sparkling clean! VERY comfortable bed and pillows! Bathroom huge by European standards. Metro is steps away, you can barely hear it. Breakfast was FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!! Delicious (we still dream about the croissants!!) food, coffees, hot chocolates, jams. The gentleman who looks after the dining room is a real sweetie, very helpful!! Our son and daughter-in-law arrived early one morning, the receptionist was nice enough to offer them to go to the dining room and get some fresh expresso, even though the breakfast was finished. All in all, we loved it!!! If ever we get back to Paris, we won't be staying anywhere else!! Parking was the only little difficulty we had. Our car was bigger than most and so we couldn't find a parking spot nearby. We had to park at a Renault, about a 10 mins walk. But normally, most people don't have a car. All who work there are very friendly and helpful. Most of the ones we met spoke English. Free WiFi was great, no problems with using it in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: What a lovely oasis to return to after a day's sightseeing in Paris. The best of a French hotel, full of character, but very clean, with friendly staff and a good price! We stayed two nights, and had a lovely room and en suite. The area wasn;t terribly well served for restaurants, but had a several to choose from at different prices, a good little supermarket, and fabulous boulangerie. Great value, fresh buffet breakfast which we really enjoyed. the staff were really helpful and very informative about Paris and travelling around. Highly recommended for a good priced stay on the outskirts of Paris but within about 20 mins train to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Tres magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: deuxduvalls
Reviews.Content: Although the location was on the outskirts of Paris, a Metro stop is located right outside the hotel door. Buy a metro pass--no problem! The staff are incredibly professional and helpful. Every request was promptly tended to. The most fantastic boulangerie is conveniently located across the street. I recommend eating dinner in town--not many good choices nearby. A farmers market is held 2x week across the street where you can pick up beautiful fresh fruit. Great place and very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Parisian feel but kind of far from city center”
Reviews.Author: sillyolbear
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Porte doree was a nice stay in Paris. It is literally steps away from the metro stop but the stop is somewhat far from the city center. Given that their subway system is quite efficient, this wasn't a huge drawback. Another con was that our room was on the bottom level--right next to the lobby. The tv they provide for waiting guests blared until around midnight and then again in the morning. The shuttle service they provide to the airport (we took one to Orly) was also pretty expensive, €68 for 4 of us. We just didn't want to lug our stuff up and down the many staircases of Paris' metro again. The nice things about this place was that it was clean and pretty comfortable. The beds were a good size, bathrooms were a little small but what you would expect in Europe. The room was kind of dark as well. I also liked that it had a Parisian feel--not just a generic hotel with a poster of Paris on the walls. The fabrics and wallpaper were a deep, rich, red and the hotel itself was in an older building with the shutters in the outside and everything. The checkin and checkout process was easy and everyone at the front desk that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian S
Reviews.Content: We did a one night stop on the way to the south and it was fabulous. Staff very helpful, room very clean as was the rest of the hotel. Location was fantastic, just outside the Metro and into Paris centre within 20 mins. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LePPrince
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 4 nights. The Hotel is incredibly cosy and the staff was very kind to us! The rooms look good and are clean, in an old stylish way. The breakfast was ok, but a little bit expensive we think. A good thing is that you can get it served up in your room! The rooms are not that well isolated, so you can hear people out in the hallway. All in all, an excellent stay, and good value!

Reviews.Title: “HIghly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shixzam
Reviews.Content: We loved that it was close to the Metro, made travel around Paris that much easier. The slight downside to it is that you get a soft rumble but not enough to affect our sleep. We loved the free wi-fi, we loved the rustic charm of the hotel, we loved our rooms - clean white decor. We loved that it was opposite a fresh bakery where we got our breakfasts in the morning plus a halal kebab stall which openend til late for our suppers. Only negative is probably the skinny lifts which we thought were a bit of fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren1401
Reviews.Content: Just home from Hotel de la Porte Doree and I'm glad I picked it for our trip to Paris. The hotel is beautiful and so french! We had a lovely room - it was clean, spacious and had bay windows which opened out. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were changed every day - the decoration was tasteful, although our room was decorated quite modernly, it still managed to keep its' authentic french decor. The bathroom was small but clean and we were provided with clean towels everyday. We had two huge mirrors in our room and plenty of natura light which was great for getting ready. It seems that the walls are quite thin as we could hear other people flushing the toilet etc but it wasn't a problem. We also had an ipod dock in the room and a flatscreen television although the only thing we could watch was CNN as the rest of the channels were all in french :( Overall, the hotel had a very relaxed atmosphere and although we didn't pay for breakfast prior to our stay we decided to have it every morning - I'm a bit of a fussy eater and would have preferred more choice of yogurts and cereals but other than that it was lovely and there was never any rush to get you in and out of the breakfast room. The man that served us breakfast was very helpful and spoke a good bit of english - he always checked if everything was ok. The elevator is really small but it's not an inconvenience as I loved taking the stairs anyway because of the decor. Nathalie on reception was always very helpful with directions and it was nice to have somebody we could ask for help if we needed it. During our stay we came across two other men that were doing reception at various times who didn't seem to be very conversational or approachable so we didn't ask them anything, although Nathalie was there most of the time so it was fine. The books provided in our rooms were very helpful and we would have been lost without them. We ate in Les Cascades on two evenings and had beautiful food - although without the help of the one english speaking waiter I'm not sure this would have been possible. We returned on our last day for some lunch to find no waiters who spoke english and as a result found it an absolute nightmare to order - we had two hamburgers and some chips, one was raw inside and the other just looked like mush and because noone spoke english we couldn't complain so we paid and left hungry. On the two occasions that we had good food there, we found it to be really quick and cheap and we both cleaned our plates, it's just a pity we had to end on a bad note. There are plenty of supermarkets in the area and we went to the aquarium and bois de vicennes on our last day which was beautiful. The hotel also organised for us to get a shuttle for our walk to the airport which arrived efficiently - although I'm not sure I would get it again and I wasn't sure we were going to make it to the airport alive - worst driving I have ever seen! We were so glad to see the airport! The hotel also has a free wifi service was invaluable as using 3g outside of the hotel was a complete no no as it totally wiped all the credit on my phone. The metro runs underneath but didn't affect our sleeping at all, although we were on the 3rd floor - it does take some time to get to where you are going and taking the metro isn't always a pleasant experience but that's to be expected. Generally it is a great little hotel and very well looked after and managed. A mini-fridge in the room would have been really helpful as we often wanted to buy food and make picnics to take with us but we couldn't keep anything fresh. An iron in each room would also have been helpful and perhaps a few english channels on the tv. Other than that, I have no complaints and really loved staying at Hotel de la Porte Doree - maybe we'll be back someday! :)

Reviews.Title: “Le Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: LnD2007
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I were visiting Paris for the first time and were very unsure what was going to meet us once we arrived. After our flight and Metro journey we were delighted that as we came out the hotel was approx 100yards from the station. On seeing the hotel we were a bit dis-appointed expecting more Parisian architectural features, however as soon as we stepped in the door any disappointment quickly disappeared as the recepetion area was everything you would expect from a boutique hotel. The room we booked was a double classic, and for somewhere to sleep and give ourselves some comfort from pounding the streets all day it was perfect. A very comfy bed, controllable air-con, flat screen tv and an I-Pod docking station were very suprising and made our stay even more better. However the best thing about the hotel was the staff at reception. On arrival we were giving a fantastic welcome and then we were provided with fantastic information about the city, i.e some great places to visit, great local knowledge of getting around and advised local shopping in the area. Overall a fantastic hotel, superb for the metro and the park that is 3 minutes walk away is fantastic, especially on a lovely sunny day on the rowing boats - would certainly re-book and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Simmy61
Reviews.Content: Planning an overnight stay in Paris en route to the Dordogne I found this hotel on Google. A little apprehensive about what it would be like a)because of the price and b)because of the location. I feel embarassed now to think I had those thoughts because once we walked into the foyer we just new this place was going to be lovely - and more than lovely in fact. It has a lovely olde worlde charm about it especially the lovely wooden staircase and the landings lined with bookshelves. The bedrooms were very good. Very comfortable beds, air con, great showers and beautiful pre-raphaelite paintings on the walls. A telly in each room and i-pod docks which the teenagers loved. The staff were really nice and very helpful too. The location is absolutely fine - the metro is just outside and my husband walked in the nearby park in the morning. On Sunday morning there was an excellent market outside where we bought breakfast, panama hats and a leather belt (as you do!). They had nice lunches going too. Would highly recommend and will definately go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: neeeeeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February and must say it was a great find. We hunted around for a cheap hotel (they are quite expensive in central Paris) and this one was brought up by hotel comparison prices. It was a bargain price so I was wary of what we might be getting for out money. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is directly under a metro station so travelling into the centre was really easy. I would recommend a travel card as this keeps the costs down. On a positive note, although the hotel is right above the metro station we could not hear any noise from it. It's about a 10/15 minute metro ride into the centre but like all large cities it depends on where you are heading and how many changes you need to make. The hotel itself is small but has a really nice ambiance. The staff were friendly and we had no problems. There is free wifi, you just need a code from the reception. This helps as a visitor as it means its really easy to check up on details for your day ahead. Our room wasn't huge but big enough for what we needed and the bathroom had a shower cubicle and was nicely decorated. There was a safe within the wardrobe which puts your mind at rest in a big city. Like all hotels you can often hear people in other rooms and unforntunately our neighbour (who we names the Moaner Lisa) was rather vocal!!!!! But you have to accept this :-) The hotel offer a breakfast for (I think 10 euro) Its a continetal buffet style which was nice, but there is a mcdonalds just over the road which was much cheaper. While there are not many shops in this area there is a lovely bakery over the road as well as a small supermarket and we found a lovely snack shop with a very friendly owner who sold lovely coffee (although I wouldn;t recommend the criossants from her, go to the bakers they are much nicer!!) The hotel offers a info book in the room with some recommendations for restaurants. The hotel itself does not offer a restuarant and we did not visit in the area so I cannot comment on that. There is, as I said a McDonalds and the french equivilent called Quick but after trying both I would say that Quick is more expensive and not as good as McDonalds. Most people would probably cringe at the thought of travelling to Paris and eating fast food. Just be prepared to pay extortionate prices in the city centre. Drinks are very expensive and as I quickly realised Fanta and Coke are the same from any place but some cafes were charging up to 5 euros for a small glass of coke so McDonalds was a cheaper option. I was extremely happy with the hotel and would recommend this to anybody who wants a nice hotel at great value. It's obviosuly not as central as some of the other hotels but by no means difficult to get to. I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: BluePeppers
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with lots of character, Hotel de la Porte Doree is certainly a different experience. The room was small but reasonable. It was still quite noisy although I had a room on the high floor but it's Paris. It's bound to be noisy everywhere. The hotel is just outside the metro which is a major plus. There's a lovely bakery just across the street as well as convenient stores. What I really disliked was the toiletries. They were used by a previous tenant and instead of replacing the toiletries they were refilled daily which is quite unhygienic and disgusting (especially for body lotions)! Hope the management will look into that. Overall the room was clean and bed was reasonably comfortable. We did not get a bath tub which was quite disappointing, so I would suggest you make a request or get the room type right before booking. The lifts were old and very narrow and you have to get in sideways which is quite claustrophobic but very common in France. Overall service was more personal as it is a small hotel. I would certainly recommend this hotel for those who would like to have a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterJamesR
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay - great value, lovely rooms and good location. We hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend & Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: cocorotsie
Reviews.Content: Likes Good website Excellent location steps away from Porte Doree Metro station Friendly and helpful staff, multilingual and willing to speak English and give advice & directions Beautiful quaint design and decorated rooms Very high quality beds and linen Cozy temperature during an oddly colder / rainy July Affordable prices for Paris - rooms & breakfast Very good unlimited breakfast: croissants, preserves, coffee juice, ham, fresh fruit, cheese, etc Spacious room 44, 4th floor (there is a lift which is good with luggage) Good hot water & pressure in the bathroom Wifi w the room Dislike Although we booked in February there was a problem with our booking so we moved to a smaller version of the double room options. Thin walls but this is understandable in the old building and there was only a noisy neighbour one of the nights. Neither of the above were a big deal We are reasonably well travelled Canadians in our 30s. We would recommend this lovely little hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great!”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyageBC
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Porte Doree, and I liked it more the second time than I did the first... and I liked it a whole lot the first time around. (See review "believe it!" from years ago for details.) Yes, this is off the beaten track, but in the middle of July that is EXACTLY what one needs in Paris! It was very quiet and pleasant. The metro is close and on a great line, it only takes about 20 minutes to get into the heart of Paris, and there are plenty of resturant choices in the 12th. We ate a couple of lunches at a nearby brasserie (Les Cascades?) and found the service to be very pleasant to non-French speakers.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cbrandsk
Reviews.Content: Myself and girlfriend took to paris for our first time for a long 4 day weekend. This hotel, for the price, was wonderful. Clean room, free fast wifi, comfy large bed and made to feel very welcome. If I was to grumble about anything... the walls were rather thin for travelling noise - but far outweighed by all the benefits of staying here. If you like almonds, get the almond pastry from across the road - its AMAZING. If not, cross the road and walk a little to the right for an amazing butter croissant for just a smidge over 1 euro! Fab hotel! Dont hesitate to book here for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kenbutsu
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this lovely hotel for ten nights. This hotel is close to perfect. The front desk receptionists are incredibly helpful and friendly to guests. The rooms, though small by American standards, were clean and refurbished, and came with an individual A/C unit that you could control yourself (that's luxury in Paris, I hear). Not to mention, the beds were very comfortable, wi-fi was free and reliable, and the bathroom was stocked with quality soaps and shampoos. Location-wise, it's not in the center of the city, which was not that bad considering the neighborhood its in is very safe and quiet...also, the metro stop is literally next door, so it only takes 15 or so minutes to get to the more touristy places. All in all, you cannot find a better place for the price. Heck even some 4 star hotels in the US don't compare to the service and amenities that Porte Doree offers. If we ever come back to Paris we'll definitely be staying here again. Although, with all these great reviews, we may have a hard time getting a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CindyKWarrington
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed her for three nights; then left and traveled to the Loire Valley and Normandy and returned for three more nights. it could not have been nicer. The room was comfortable and clean; the breakfast and the server were wonderful; and the older gentleman at the desk was very helpful. We both hope to return someday. I heartily recommend this hotel for the money. The metro is close and easy to navigate. We left the hotel by 8 each mornind and returned at 9 or later. McDonald's across the street made it easy to grab an ice cream sundae or diet coke at night. The hotel did have a soda machine and even an ice machine- which is rare in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hotel de la Porte Doree, this time as a solo traveller and it is still the same wonderful hotel I remembered from two years ago. I spent three nights in a single room, which to my delight wasn't too small, perfect for the solo traveller and I then moved to a double for the last two nights. Both rooms were lovely - what I love about the hotel is that no room seems the same as the other and both beautifully decorated and well equipped. Staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful, particularly Nathalie who handled my booking. Breakfast was delicious with pastries, meats, cheeses, juices, hot beverages, yoghurts and fruits on offer, for €10 per head it's excellent value and sets you up for a day of sight-seeing and shopping. The only thing I can think of that might bother other travellers is that it's a bit of a journey on the Metro - to me, it was worth it as I really like the area. People have mentioned the noise of the Metro but I've stayed on the 1st floor and heard only faint rumblings - as a light sleeper I wasn't disturbed at all. This hotel is an absolute gem, I've always recommended it to those who are Paris-bound and I will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy hotel in nice, cozy area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ronaldkwok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights during my recent holiday in Paris. We really enjoyed our stay here. All the good things about this hotel mentioned in the other reviews are found to be true - good location (metro and bus stop at the doorstep), friendly staff, variety of food and amenitites available nearby, good breakfast, quiet neighbourhood, free WiFi, etc. I could hear the metro at times but not enough to disturb my sleep, the lift is small but enough to transport my 2 suitcases. I have some photos of the hotel and the neighbourhood in my blog to convey my impressions for those interested. http://paris-france-holiday.blogspot.com/ The only thing missing were English channels on TV, maybe they were there but I could not find them. Otherwise, a perfect hotel for the price. Highly recommended together with the Bistrot de la Porte Doree nearby.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - Hidden Gem, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: bigcdh
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel situated in the 12eme arr. The hotel was beautifully decorated inside and the staff were very warm and exceptionally helpful - even with my attempts at pigeon-french! They all spoke English (although I liked making the effort in French which they seemed to appreciate). The hotel is literally the first thing you see when you exit from the Porte Doree Metro station, there's no long walk to the metro so hopping into the city is a breeze. Its situated on Line 8 of the underground and we got the train from CDG airport no probs (route = RERB to Gare du Nord, then Line 5 to Republique, then Line 8 to Porte Doree) which probably took just less than an hour including changes. We stayed in Room 28 which faces the street, opposite a lovely row of shops including a Boulangerie from which the breakfast food comes from each morning. This was classed as a 'Superior' room, I didnt see the others, but I was impressed with the decor and the bathroom was very smart. The room had a LCD TV, magazines, iPod dock, very very comfy bed, nice ambient lighting, the bathroom as I say was excellent with a great shower - the size of a dinner plate!! The overall size of the room was good, not too small - plenty of space for hanging up clothes and there is a safe in the room also (hidden away, I'll let you find it yourself!). The breakfast was 10 euros each as was nice, it was as described, i.e.a continental and fresh items brought over throughout the morning from the bakery opposite. The coffee was delicious - the only thing I would have liked would have been to sit outside and have breakfast and there wasnt anywhere to do that, but there's plenty of other places in Paris to do so. Dont be put off by other reviews saying the hotel seems a little far out in the sticks - its not. If you're ok with the tube (we bought a "Paris Visite" 5 day pass for about 50 euros each) you are about 20 mins away from the hub of the city and you'll be glad of the relative calm of this hotel. We found it nice before bed to lay with the window open listening to the buzz of the traffic (not busy) going by and the vibes of the underground every now and again. The place is superb, and if you dont want to venture out too far to eat there is a lovely restaurant literally over the road (Les Cascades) or if you're on a budget there's a Subway or McDonalds!!! A small tip also (for what its worth) - we found the price of mineral water quite expensive in most places in the centre of Paris - there's a shop over the road (think its like a kebab shop) that sells bottles of cold mineral water for 1 euro, or better still keep a bottle and the hotel have a water machine in the breakfast room which you can fill up with. It's also worth mentioning the hotel information folder you get in the room - this is jam packed with recommendations - which are honest - about local food and drink. its worth checking out especially if you're running out of ideas of where to go. Overall I cant fault the hotel at all. The staff were a pleasure to deal with (even when we arrived to check in at 23:30 the night staff were still v. pleasant). I read some comments also about them having 'thin walls' etc, rubbish. Throughout our stay the hotel had 'no vacancies' and had kids in the hotel - and we didnt hear a peep at all. Superb stuff, hope you enjoy your trip!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MissKitty680
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd reviewed the Hotel de la Porte Doree before but it seems that though I had intended to, I'd forgotten along the way, and so I must do it now. Why must? Simply because everyone deserves to know how wonderful of a place it really is - 139 on trip advisor just won't do. I have stayed here on several occasions, the first time being 2007. I was looking for a hotel that for one could fit my budget - single 20-something girl who buys too many shoes right here - and also one that felt REAL. A lot of people don't understand what I mean when I say real, after all, isn't anywhere you stay real? But what I mean is somewhere that isn't touristy, isn't all glossed over or the North American version of Paris. I grew up with a European family, my mother from Belgium, my grandparents from France, and their stories of Paris had been what I was looking for. I found part of that at this hotel. The people are wonderful, the rooms charming, and the neighbourhood? It's a real french neighbourhood. This where people live, where they eat and shop in the market and buy pastries from the OMG so wonderful bakery right across the street. Seriously, I would go to Paris just for their passion-fruit tart with raspberries. On my first stay I was so relived when I arrived, I wasn't staying somewhere I was afraid to walk on the street, but also I didn't spot a bunch of tacky tourist shops disguised in the facades of old buildings. And wait... did I see a metro right outside the building? Oh yes, steps away in this case really is steps away. The furnishing in the room weren't brand spanking new, which I liked, they had character and were clean and well taken care of. Painted sometimes, or polished up. it all looked nice. It made for a cute room, smaller, but not super tiny. Don't expect giant rooms in Paris - it doesn't happen often, it's just the way it is. The room I booked had a double bed with a little writing desk and chair and nice linens. It also had those lovely french style windows I got to throw open on a sunny day. Then there was the staff who were always helpful and cheery and put up with me trying to speak my badly spoken french, not because I had to, they all spoke lovely English, but because I was determined to come home and show my family that my second language skills were not a total lost cause. I really don't know if I can say enough to do it justice honestly and I don't know if I have the words to explain. I guess best way to tell you how wonderful this hotel is, is to tell you I went back. I went back in 2008 , taking my mother for her birthday trip, I went back in 2009 on a brief stop before Italy, I sadly missed it in 2010, my vacation occupied with the Vancouver Olympics, but I sent my brother instead. And today I'll be booking my stay for October. The only thing I could could mention as a con is there doesn't seem to be a double room with single person option anymore. I can understand why, but as a person who travels on her own I miss being able to get a room with double bed without having to pay the same price as 2 people. As far as cons go, that's a very small one. I love the Hotel de la Porte Doree and recommend it to anyone who wants a great little place to stay in Paris. <3

Reviews.Title: “Great for family stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Anjellicrew
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel compared to the other my friends stayed in which was a little closer to the city center. Personally, I would not want to stay in the city center with a family having small children. This hotel was in a clean area and only a couple of blocks away from a park with a pond/lake for row boating, duck feeding, and relaxing in the grass. We did not eat breakfast here though the evening guy at the front desk was not willing to offer me any other suggestions than their "fantastic" breakfast--fair enough. There was a little bakery, fresh market, and small grocery shop right across the street. It is also not far from the metro station (only about 25 meters) which was more convenient than a bothersome noise from the trains. The daytime front desk clerk was VERY helpful and printed out a map for me to meet my friends later in the evening. Most people who have children have found themselves in a situation where they realized that not only where their children seemed to be out of place, but sometimes they even seem unwelcome--common is some places in Europe. This hotel really surprised me since there was a box of toys in the closet for my 22 month old to play with. The hotel provided a pack n' play, which I did request in advance. The bathroom was clean and even through the room was a little small, it was large enough to fit a parents bed, single bed, and a pack n' play. They offered free wifi as well as a computer in the hall for their guests to use (a french keyboard, of course). The distance from the city center was a great compromise for safety, COST, cleanliness, and child-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay but a relatively far outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: CHTRAV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de la Porte Doree for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: - Very good value, particularly for Paris - Great breakfast at a reasonable price (10 Euros per person) - Right next to metro and bus stops. - Across the road from vandermeersch bakery (awesome pastries) - Good sized rooms (we stayed on the top floor overlooking the court yard). - Clean room with cute French decoration. - Free wifi - Friendly and helpful (English speaking) staff - Small supermarket across the road (but closes at 8pm) Cons: - Can get a bit noisy. The walls are very thin so you need a bit of luck with your neighbours.... - Metro noises. Whilst these were not very loud you could hear and feel the rumble from the metro from early in the morning to late at night every 10 mins or so. - Whilst the room was reasonably clean, the cleaning was generally a bit rushed. Not everything was done to the same standard every day. - Pretty far from the city centre in our opinion. The metro stop porte doree is right on the edge of zone 1 and zone 2. It takes about 10 minutes to Bastille. But if you want to go other parts you should count on a 30 - 40 minutes metro trip including changes. It's ok but it does require extra effort if you want to come back to the hotel to freshen up and go back out again. - Small lift. It will fit 2 people with a suitcase. Not really a big deal though. - No iron & ironing board. You'll need to bring a travel iron.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: theemster
Reviews.Content: I was a part of three couples that stayed here for 4 nights a few weeks ago. This was my first trip to Paris and I greatly enjoyed it. I had read in previous reviews that it was a bit of a hike to get to many of the sites from the hotel. However it honestly wasn't that bad! We loved the Metro stop literally being right next to the hotel and the travel time was part of the adventure for us! Not to mention, we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a train. The neighborhood the hotel is located in is very nice. The bakery across the street is to die for...we ate breakfast there several mornings and I miss it greatly! The hotel itself is very nice. Our rooms were all very comfortable and accomodating. The room my husband and I stayed in was smaller than the other two couples' rooms, but we made do. We did have a problem with our shower not draining properly, but the hotel staff cleared it up within a day or two and we were good to go! I would stay here again gladly and would recommend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: wheresmycocktail
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give this review because it could make it harder for me to find a room in the future but this hotel is so great they deserve it. I go to Paris regularly on business so it is super important that my hotel be a home away from home. After staying in other hotels i find this one to be the best because it has the four things i can't live without which are 1) wifi in the bedroom 2) clean bathroom 3) comfortable bed with american pillows (not those traditional french log things which are hard to sleep on) and 4) close to the subway (and it's a convenient line too). Speaking of subway, the hotel is literally on top of the subway so you can hear rumbling at night which for me is not a problem since i go to bed long after the trains stop running and it a very light rumble even if you are staying on the 1st floor. Things that i love about this hotel are : Excellent staff- they are multi-lingual and very helpful arranging cars or giving advice on what to do or see (there is even a hotel guide book in each room with local attractions) Hot Water and Thermostats (that work) in the rooms - Believe it or not, I've had trouble getting this in a hotel in a city as modern as Paris, especially at these rates. Park nearby - its a couple blocks away and a great place to get some excersice or just have a picnic Things i don't like: Sometimes i wish it could be closer to the center of the city but in a way it's nice to be far because you avoid stressfull crowds the bathroom sinks: every hotel i have ever stayed at in Paris has tiny sinks so you make a big splashy mess when washing so this one is no different. No biggie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice memories”
Reviews.Author: LuMartini
Reviews.Content: Even we stayed there one year ago, I still have nice memories to this cute hotel. Underground is just few steps from the hotel so you can get everywhere easy and comfortable. It is also nice walk to Bastille it takes only 15 minutes. Rooms were nice, clean only the bathroom was too small. But even that i think it should have 3* not a 2. The niciest part of the hotel was the reception area. But you can see it on the photos - it really look the same. Old books about Paris everywhere, nice atmosphere... We had brakfast just once, I found it too expencive.. When you will cross the street there is a great french bakery so we had our breakfast most of the time there. 100m from the hotel is a supermarket as well. Nice stay there, when we come back to Paris I would like to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tultrip
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite large by Parisian standards and comfortably furnished. Service was very good and everybody spoke english. A great farmers market in the street on the Sunday we were there. A 15-20 minute walk to some very nice shops and restaurants. The Bistrot 102 was very close and we had a nice 3 course meal with house wine for 16E. The only down side is the distance from the center of town. The metro stop is 100 ft from the hotel door, but metro time to Bastille was about 30 min. We saved 100E/room/day over similar rooms in town center and thought it was worth the travel time.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for first timers with aggressive day and night schedule”
Reviews.Author: saikoxpooh
Reviews.Content: We were wowed and taken by the trip advisor reviews. I could see how if I had a family and I was looking for a family friendly environment, I'd like this place, or if you have a more leisurely sightseeing plan. We were on our honeymoon and we stayed for an entire week in this hotel and there were great things about it, some good things about it, and some bad things about it. Great things first: 1) They are indeed across the street from Vandermeersch, a boulangerie known for their kugelhopf (not very French you say? I said that too, actually, while stuffing my face with delicious gooey, sugary, stretchy, ball of heavenly delight... not on the street in public though. I have manners). 2) The Port Doree metro stop is right outside the hotel. Seriously awesome for not having to walk a block or two for a metro stop. 3) The person at the desk always spoke English, if that is important to some of you, especially if you didn't plan your trip that well and have no idea what to do. 4) The park across the street (Bois de Vincennes) is amazing to jog around and chillax in (but if you had the choice of spending a day here, or in front of the Eiffel Tower, which would you choose?) and is really huge and is reminiscent of Central Park, but with less people. Good things: 1) The room, though dormlike, and the smallest of all the rooms we stayed in Europe (We went to Paris, San Sebastian, Barcelona), had a double bed, a tv, internet on the second floor if you didn't bring your own computer, your own bathroom with shower, a closet. The ice machine exists, just in the basement of the hotel, where the soda machine is. Wish they had a fridge in all the rooms to keep some of the delicious things we bought more fresh while we were staying there. 2) Twice a week, there are street markets set up so you can buy fresh food there. You just can't buy for more than one day if things spoil fast because there's no fridge to keep them in. I bought amazing cheese and ham from a man, made a baguette sandwich to take with us to Versailles. It was totally worth it! Bad: These things aren't entirely the fault of the hotel. 1) It's hella far from the city. This might be okay for those who have already been to Paris before and are okay staying away from the tourists and the sightseeing places but if you are there for the first time and you have to take the metro into the heart of the city every day, it takes a good twenty - forty minutes, depending on where you want to go. The worst thing is coming back home, changing, and wanting to go out again. There were many times we wanted to go out and experience the nightlife but the thought of having to come back home first to shower, change, and go out again on the metro wasn't enticing enough, especially knowing that the metro stops running at midnight. We had to weigh whether or not it was worth taking a cab back home, which would cost us anywhere from 18-30 dollars, depending on where we were. 2) A family of 2 or 3 children were staying upstairs or next to us (unsure of where exactly as we only had the shrill sound of muffled kids screaming, waking us up at the crack of dawn to judge their location) for a couple of days. Those rooms are not sound proof, let's just say that. Obviously, this just depends on who stays on your floor when you're there and it's hard to control maniacally screaming kids in any hotel so that's not really their fault but anyway, just know the rooms are not sound proof. 3) Lastly, if you want to eat dinner after 10pm in this area, good luck. The only place that serves dinner that late is Au Metro, and their food is not the best (although apparently their mussels are okay). The takeaway: Good place to stay because it's affordable and if it's not your first time in Paris and you want to avoid all the claustrophobic tourist spots, this might be your spot, especially if you don't mind taking the metro in and out of the city, or you don't have an aggressive or packed schedule where you have to return to your hotel to get something or to change, etc. If you're on your honeymoon, or it's your first time in Paris and you want to see all the sights and you still want to enjoy your nights out on the town and be relatively close so you can come home to relax before going out again, this is not your spot. We desperately wanted to enjoy the neighborhood but most things were closed by the time we got home, which although late (around ten at night), the sun doesn't set in Paris until close to 11pm. We tried eating dinner around here but they all close so early and we had to walk a few blocks to a mediocre restaurant because we didn't want to trek out to the city again on the metro. From the other reviews, it seems like there were more interestingly laid out bedrooms and perhaps if we stayed away from those screaming kids, we would have had more sleep and not as exhausted during the day. Our fault for not complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in a quiet part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ymseller
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write online reviews, but had such a great experience at Hotel de la Porte Doree that I would recommend it to travelers who are looking for a quaint, charming hotel. We stayed in the twin superior room which was perfect for 6 nights. The room is sectionalized into two spaces - there is the main bedroom, and another space for the bathroom, toilet room, and closet. Beautiful antique-style furnishings and paintings, and more than enough space to make yourself at home. As for the location, it's on the edge of the city, but you can't really fault the hotel for being where it is. I found the neighborhood to be lovely - the Metro and the 46 bus to/from Gare du Nord are right in front of the hotel, the Bois de Vincennes is a 5 minute walk away, and a delicious patisserie across the street. During the weekend, market stalls line up across the street, with local vendors selling mouthwatering cheeses, olives, etc. The hotel's location is a quiet respite from the buzzing center, and you're more likely to see 'real Paris and Parisians' here than in most other districts. Noise - you can hear the metro faintly on occasion, but it sounds more like distant thunder than rumbling. Paris is a major metropolitan city, after all, and city noise (police sirens, ambulances, public transportation noise, people on the streets) is inevitable. As the other reviewers have said, the hotel staff is wonderful. Very helpful, patient, and friendly. I would give them more than 5 stars if I could. All in all, a wonderful experience at the Hotel de la Porte Doree. Highly recommended for an affordable and relaxing stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Elias11
Reviews.Content: A nice and clean hotel situated in a safe neighbourhood right by the metro and Noctambus stations. Reception and the rest of the staff are really nice and friendly. Rooms are small, but yet cosy and well maintained. Very small bathrooms, well cleaned daily though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ElindaGj
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Porte Doree was situated next to the metro station Porte Doree and made the access to the centre and to the major attractions very easy and quick. We could go to central Paris in 20 mins maximum. There was also a bus station gust in front of the hotel. The local area of the hotel was peaceful as there was a great park just two minutes on foot from the hotel. You could find anything nearby (bakery, supermarket, cafes, MacDonalds etc). As far as the interior of the hotel is concerned, it was beautifully and romantically decorated and very clean. We loved the staff as they were very friendly and kind (as the most of Parisians!)

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tiziana64
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the hotel. We went there as a present from our daughter for my birthday and she couldn't choose a better place. We don't speak french but the staff was really friendly and helped us all along. The hotel is not in the city centre but conveniently located, very close to the underground station you can reach the centre of Paris really quick. It's very clean and cozy. In the chaotic Paris, this is a great place where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euro1999
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel for a family of five, a twin room and triple room. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. The hotel is some distance from the main attractions of Paris, but if you don't mind a 20 to 30 minute journey on the Metro, which is right outside the hotel then it is not a problem. The Metro runs beneath the hotel and this can be a little noisy at night but when you are walking around Paris during the day and worn out it was not a problem getting to sleep! The continental breakfast was very good and there is no charge for young children which we thought was a big advantage as otherwise it would have been very expensive. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has no car park and local parking is expensive. Overall a good hotel if staying in Paris for one or two days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great area and brilliant value!”
Reviews.Author: citycrush
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were really impressed with the hotel. The staff were friendly and on hand 24 hours a day. It is in a great area with boulangeries, supermarkets, restaurants and shops nearby, and the metro stop is about 5 seconds from the hotel, making the hotel an ideal base to explore Paris. The 12th is a great area to be based. Our room was quite small, but perfectly adequate, well decorated and clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel which was really good for 10 euros, otherwise there are many bakery options nearby! There were only a few points that meant I wouldn't give the hotel 5 star, and they were minor (a few housekeeping issues (dirty glasses left), and the hotel being very noisy in the day with hammering and drilling!). Other than that we loved staying at this hotel and would 100% recommend it to other people- the value is superb. I would rate this hotel 4.5 stars if I could! We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a relaxed visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jaz9475
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very relaxed and accomodating air - the staff were all very friendly and helpful and our room was very pleasant and clean with a view of the amazing bakery across the street! Very helpful when working out your queueing time for breakfast! Our bathroom was small but very nice and more than adequate for our needs. My only (small) gripe would be that there is no kettle (and hence no chance of a decent cup of tea for the length of your stay in France!). The hotel does offer coffee on call for a couple of euros however. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to sample the patisserie delights across the street, although be warned, it is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. The Tramway, a brasserie just up the road, does a very nice breakfast for 7 Eur 50 though. The hotel is just seconds away from the Porte Doree metro, from which you can connect to all the major lines within a couple of stops. A nice alternative to the metro is to walk along the promenade des plantes which takes you up towards Bastille. This is a raised aqueduct that lives up to its name and its popular with strollers and joggers alike. In fact, we ended up walking all the way from the hotel to Sacre Coeur via the promenade des plantes, Bastille, Marais (where we had a very nice falafel in pita for lunch from Chez Marianne), Opera Garnier and Galerie Lafayette! Quite an expedition, especially since we had only planned to check out the local area whilst we waited for our room to become available! I was really impressed with the 12th arrondisement - it has a lovely vibe to it and there are plenty of nice places to eat, with patisseries on every doorstep. There was a lovely market on Sunday morning, starting opposite the hotel, selling fresh fruit, meat, shoes etc and it made for a pleasant amble whilst savouring the delights of the bakery! We also spent an hour or so walking round the lake in the Bois de Vincennes. Again, just a 5 min stroll from the hotel and well worth taking an hour or so out for, especially if you have children with you. There are boats for hire and a fair was being set up to open on 5th June (not sure how long for though). Would make a lovely place for an alfresco breakfast or picnic before setting off into Paris for the day. In all, I would definitely recommend the hotel - from the free wifi to the abundance of reading material, not to mention the pleasant staff and surroundings - it will be the first place I check for availability when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: sixnohit
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that this hotel is cute. It would get a higher rating if it were in a different location. There's really nothing around here. A Mcdonald's across the street and a Subway next door. I don't want either of those back in the states. Best things about the hotel 1. FOUR Metro stops. 2. The boulangerie (when it's open) across the street. And most importantly, VERY helpful front desk. I was afraid I'd get lost heading to the Eiffel tower but the lady gave me the hotel's number and said to call if I got lost. Thankfully I didn't. I would like to address complaints I previously read. Yes, the hotel is small but you're in Paris. How much time will you be spending in your room? Beds are nice and comfy after spending all day touring. I read complaints about it being noisy. Yes, it's noisy when your windows are wide open. I actually took a nap one evening with the window open and a nice breeze coming through. Now onto the metro rumbling. It's not like the building shakes. The noise lasts MAYBE 5 seconds...if that. We had a twin room with a private bathroom. Meaning one room has just the toilet and right across it is your sink/shower. Very good shower with terrific water temp and pressure. As much as I truly liked this hotel, I'm not sure I'd stay here again. Only because it's so far out and there's nothing really around here. The price is right, the people are exceptionally polite and helpful. I'm just not big on the hike to get to "scenic" areas. OH wi-fi is free. You just have to make sure you ask for the passcode. And I highly recommend buying an extension cord with the European adapter. There are only 2 plugs in the twin room. Not fun when trying to charge cell phone, camera batteries and sleep with a CPAP.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem just outside of tourist center.”
Reviews.Author: WKGW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recommendation of friends. Were very pleased with the hotel. Wonderful value in Paris, with clean, comfortable rooms. The subway has an exit right near the hotel entrance, so it was very easy to get to the tourist areas. We grabbed pastries at the boulangerie across the street, got snacks at the grocery store a few minutes down the street, and had some tasty, affordable dinners after spending our days in town. Would definitely recommend the Hotel de la Porte Doree as a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, good value and tho quite far out easy to get in to centre of paris”
Reviews.Author: MillyCat2000
Reviews.Content: this was a cute, very french hotel with small but adequate rooms. quite far out from central paris but easy to get into centre on the metro and also a nice area to explore (forest, lake, park, chateau, bastille opera house) especially in good weather. some good very reasonably priced restaurants close by. breakfast good and reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Charming and romantic”
Reviews.Author: amnagaafar
Reviews.Content: Lovely decorated rooms in great location and very reasonable prices. First time in Paris with my husband and we really enjoyed our stay at Porte Doree. The staff was very helpful and friendly especially Nathalie. Jody was very sweet and the gentleman who worked the night shift. Two minute walk to metro and 20min access to central Paris. Nice grocery store, famous bakery and restaurants all within walking distance. Lovely breakfast, which we had not planned on having every morning until we tried it. Would definitely stay again. Good wifi and computer available. Thank you for making our first time in Paris so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Faniola
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very close to the metro station(15 min to downtown Paris).The staff was very friendly and spoke both English and French.Very clean, quite vacious rooms and excellent breakfast...a little fridge in the rooms would make them excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: richman613
Reviews.Content: This hotel has what we wanted. Location, air conditioning, ice machine. The staff is very nice and speak English. The rooms are clean, well furnished. Good Metro stop at the front door. Great park nearby. Super market, bucherie and pastry within two blocks

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emorton
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Porte Doree is a friendly hotel with helpful staff who speak English and is reasonably priced. Our room was on the second floor. It was tastefully decorated and comfortable. We were aware of the rumble of the metro station close by but it did not disturb us. Our room faced the main street so it was noisey if we left the windows open, but it was interesting watching people go by. There was a good choice in the continental breakfast and the croissants were wonderful. The metro station is just outside the front door and was easy to use to get to the main attractions in the centre of Paris. It took about 35 minutes to get to the Eiffel Tower. There is a lovely park to walk around with a boating lake just five minutes from the hotel . We would recommend La Cascades to eat which is just over the road. We would definitely stay here again if we visited Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely friendly”
Reviews.Author: libertyblue34
Reviews.Content: Every thing is tiny in this hotel except the quality of service! What is unique? The way the rooms have been carved out of larger quarters and decorated. Friendly--the desk personnel can even joke in English, but are very professional in advice on accessing metro, sim cards for phones,all the popular sites, etc. Four of us stayed two nights and would do it all again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Fjellpi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews at Trip Advisor, and because of the low price. We didn't really expect the hotel to be so nice :)) It's a two star hotel, and we were positive surprised when we arrived. The hotel was very clean and the beds had good comfort. The persons at the front desk were very helpful! We though the hotel was closer to the main attractions. When we checked out the map, it looked like the hotel was close to the Bastille, and we thought we could walk "down town". It appears that the Daumesnil Avenue was a bit longer than we expected... But it was really not a big issue. We took the sighseeing bus from Bercy Omnisport, and then we did a "hop on - hop off" around Paris :) We will highly recommend this hotel! The metrostaion was just outside the frontdoor. (We did hear the metro, but it did not disturb us in any way) So for those who like to take the metro, the hotel was close to everything :) Thank you so much for a great stay! We left with the best memories from a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “True gem: fantastic stay for every kind of traveler”
Reviews.Author: rbiemans
Reviews.Content: Not to be mistaken with the Ibis Porte Doree that is just around the corner, this hotel is located in the 12th, south east side of the city, near 2 metro stations and with easy access to the peripherique. Finding a good parking space near the hotel is difficult, but a nearby Renault garage offers private parking. First of all: this hotel is a gem and I would highly recommend it to my friends. The hotel stylish interior and wonderful staff make you feel welcome the moment you step into the hotel. Both staff and owner are incredibly nice people and offer professional and friendly service. As with many Paris hotels, this one also has small rooms, but they are quiet, clean and have airco, good beds, flatscreen TV, mid size safe, shower with soap and shampoo, toilet and hair dryer. Free WiFi access is good, although they have a weird open system on it. Airconditioning is easy to use and it works very well. I would have liked a refrigerator in the room. Windows can be opened for fresh air. The images on the hotel website are as the rooms look like in reality. The metro line is nearby and you can hear and feel it slightly in the hotel, but it isn't annoying. Different than some other Paris hotels, walls/floors are thick enough to not hear any noise inside the hotel. Breakfast is perfect: all fresh (organic/fair trade) and lots of choice. Very good service. Most hotel breakfast prices are too high, but this is well worth it. Alternatively, it's easy enough to cross the street to get groceries. Porte Doree and Michel Bizot metro station are on walking distance. Line 8 takes you to Bastille with its connecting lines to Paris city center in mere minutes. The hotel off-center location is by no means a problem; it's a plus, actually. Brasseries and restaurants nearby are plenty (recommended: Les Cascades and Au Tramway). Quick and McDonalds, a pizzeria and a sandwich/snack place are just around the corner. The park is a 5 minute walk and hosts the Foire du Trône fun fair in April/May/June. Nearby are public parks with playgrounds for children. The zoo is close, as is the aquarium. Plenty to do for kids. Easy to go where you want. I would definitely stay here again and I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LadyDoom
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the best places I have stayed in as recomended by this site. Although the location could be considered a bit of a trek (30 minutes or so from Gare du Nord, around the same to get to the Eiffel Tower and an hour from Versailles) the extremely efficient Metro system made light work of the distance. If arriving via the Metro make sure you exit at number 2 as the hotel is only a few metres away. Reception was always manned by very friendly people who were always helpful. Breakfast was monitored on all but one day of our stay by a very friendly gentleman who was always willing to assit with hot milk/chocolate. Our room was on the second floor and was a perfect size for the two of us (note that we were in a superior double so some rooms may be smaller). The bed was extremely comfy and freshly made every day - though the hotels site does say that as an eco hotel if requested they will not change the sheets/towels every day which is a nice option. The toileties which were provided were all eco friendly - and the breakfast food appeared to be organic and locally sourced. The bread and pastries are bought from a lovely bakery just across the road which is also a perfect place to grab a snack on the way out for the day. The hotel provided free Wi-Fi access which was very quick - they also had a computer for those travelling without but who wanted internet access. A number of corner shops are within a minutes walk and about 5 minutes down the road is a supermarket with all the food you could desire. There are plenty of restaurants nearby - the hotel provides a guide in each room which includes some of thier favourite places to eat. We would recomened La Cascades which is just over the road and the little 'Bistro' down the road towards the supermarket - both provided us with excellent service and were recomended to us by the hotel staff. I would definitely stay here again if I went back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but we learned the problems were our fault !?!”
Reviews.Author: jennydog959
Reviews.Content: Please note: Our rating of Average does not quite fit for us. It was overall Good but not Very Good. After reading many great reviews and the very few poor ones we were quite excited to check into the Port Doree for our last couple of nights in Paris. My husband had been ill the day before and we asked about early check in, they did their best to accommodate. We appreciated that. When we got our room it was much more simple than their web site suggests. That was OK but we noticed that the bedspread was not very clean and there was a very visible, crusty white stain on it. We thought about saying something but we had already asked for early check in and my husband just wanted to get to bed asap so we folded it up and put it in the closet. Next morning showering was a bit of a problem because water pressure was being lost due to a leak at the main join of the hose. OK life is hard, it's a leak, so what. We did not say anything to the front desk. The breakfast was as good as most others have said; fresh, filling, good variety, healthy, great coffee and the first morning a very cordial hard working gentleman kept everything running well. The morning we were going to check out my husband was showering and the hose shot off from it's connection and he had to finish his shower with the 1/2 inch hose running like a garden hose. I went down to the desk to let them know what had happened and that we were not happy and the woman there put up a "cheery" instant brick wall. Had we noticed the leak before? Yes. Well these hoses break quite often because travelers are quite rough with them. However there is nothing they can do about if we don't tell them. (Very true) We suggested that the room staff should also have noticed and reported the leak. The staff don't use the shower full blast like we travelers do and so, no, they would not have noticed. Since we were on the subject of things I should have mentioned I told her about the soiled bedspread but did not bother to suggest that the room staff should have noticed the crusty stain. I want to note that she was NOT wrong; we should have mentioned things we were not satisfied with right away. However I approached the desk in a calm, and I think quite pleasant manner and I didn't like being made to feel we had done something wrong. When all is said and done we are able to recommend the Port Doree and possibly try it again ourselves but we recommend that you report any problems with your room immediately .

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Non-Touristy Tourists”
Reviews.Author: stevielondon76
Reviews.Content: Hotel Porte Doree is probably less central than some might like but if you're looking for something non-mindblowing but cheap and cheerful this would suit you well. Its located in south-eastern sector (12eme) of Paris and despite not really being within walking distance of any of the city's tourist attractions, it is slap bang next to a Metro station (Porte Doree) and in a lovely part of town with nice bistros and brasseries within walking distance. We stayed in a standard room which is perfect if you're not planning on staying in the room (why would you?) and are only going for a weekend. Otherwise, you might find space a challenge with big cases and two people. The hotel is clean and beds are comfortable. The lift is almost comically narrow which meant me and my equally-averagely build partner needing to stand in single file. All fun and charming unless you're disproportionately wide and/or 'well built' which'll mean you're taking the stairs... The staff were good. Ranging from warm and friendly to cordial and dutiful but always professional and willing to help. Our car broke down and the lady on the front desk translated the mechanic's diagnosis! My only criticism would be the ironing facilities. It's fair enough that you don't have one in your room at these prices but if you need something pressed, you need to bring your clothes to the kitchen on the groundfloor rather than them bringing it to your room. Inconvenient but no drama. In summary, if its your first time to Paris and you're keen to walk everywhere and see the famous sights etc, this might not be the one for you due to its location and equally if you're driving from the UK you may choose a place on the other side of the city. But if you're looking for something simple, quiet and welcoming you won't find better value for money. We enjoyed our trip and left raving about things we'd seen rather than the hotel itself which, I believe, is the way it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Quaint but not without some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: robbuaa
Reviews.Content: Since there've been so many reviews already of this place, I'll keep it simple. We were in Room 8, which is on the 1st floor (2nd floor in the US) and had a double bed. PROS Location--it's located on the east end of Paris and in a non-touristy area. Very very close to the metro. Situated across the street from an awesome bakery. There are restaurants, supermarkets, and various stores nearby. We loved taking walks around the neighborhood after dinner. For you Bank of America customers, they have a BNP Paribas ATM nearby, so you can make fee-free cash withdrawals. Cute room--it wasn't very large but was simply decorated. The mattress and pillows were comfy. The window was very nice, but it was a view of the roof next door. I was tempted to jump across and climb on different rooftops but thought better of it. Reception/Staff--friendly and efficient, both night and day. They also speak English if you don't speak French. One night, we just bought a bunch of picnic food to eat in our room--baguette, cheese, meats, etc., and they let us use plates/silverware/glasses. The shampoo/soap was also very nice--organic and citrusy. CONS Facilities--while the room itself was nice, there were some minor issues. The bathroom tiling grout had mildew. The flush button (made of plastic) was cracked and looks like it has been for a while. Also, one of our side shelves fell off from the wall when I put my wallet on it. I brought it down to reception, and they said that it's happened before and told me to bring it again in the morning when they could get the repair person to look at it. It looked like the adhesive they used to reattach to the wall was pretty weak. Also, because they had made the repairs while we were gone, when we returned, our whole room smelled strongly of epoxy, which was unpleasant. If you're on the more horizontally gifted side, fitting into the shower stall will definitely be problematic. I'm only 5'5" and 150 pounds with broader shoulders for my height, and it was tight. Noise--the metro's proximity to the hotel is a double-edged sword. In the mornings, you can hear the rumblings of the trains, so if you're a light-medium sleeper, that may spell trouble. Aircon--you can't control the temperature in your room, so it was a bit on the warm side, which dried out my throat during the night. CONCLUSION: All in all, it was a nice hotel. It had some minor issues. While I personally wouldn't book this hotel again because of the noise, I would probably present it to friends as an option.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT FIND!”
Reviews.Author: MUNKLE1
Reviews.Content: dont be put off by the 'two star' this hotel has, its lovely! Infact it'll save you a few pennies and get more for your money here and also know you're not in a souless corporate hotel room thats the same in every country of the world! It is still very easy to get to all the main attractions in the city if you're happy to use the metro (and you should be - its cheap, easy to navigate around and felt very safe for two girls) real parisian feel about the hotel. Beautifully decorated. Friendly helpful team members. The rooms have all we needed as we wernt planning on doing anything but sleep here as so much to do in Paris - but had we have had to stay in one night, id have felt comfortable. (No english channels on tv though.) Didnt have breakfast at the hotel as there was a great patiserrie opposite selling delicious cakes pastries and fresh bread. Theres some nice little restaurants on the same street - although the area isnt one youd probably want to spend much time in other than for a meal as quite a busy main road. There is however a nice little park 5 mins walk away if you are lucky enough to have good weather and dont want to venture far. Tip: Take a travel iron if you can - they do have one but you have to use it with the board in reception - you cant take it to your room There is also free internet access on 2nd floor which we didnt find out until we were checking out! They serve breakfast here but not dinner. Expensive for what it was - croissant, 1/2 bagette orange juice and cup of coffee = 10 euro - easier to get locally i think Would definately recommend and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great service, truly an unforgettable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Player928
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the metro so you don't need to rent a car. Nathalie, at the front desk, arranged a shuttle to and from the airport, which is the way to go BTW. McDonald's is right across the st should you get homesick for American food. We had the best lasagna ever at the Italian restaurant right next to the hotel. Easy access to grocery stores, restaurants and metro make this hotel a jewel. Jodie & Nathalie, at the front desk, speak English so if you're not quite up to par on you French skills they can help you out.. The rooms were very clean. Staff is wonderful. Can't say enough good about this place. Just stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bandmom14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-November and had a great visit. My husband travels often for business and said this was the best hotel he has stayed at in Paris. Bathroom was small on American standards, but bigger than most in Paris. Hotel is right on metro stop and we were able to get into downtown Paris within 20 minutes. Had the windows open one night and still did not get any noise that interfered with our sleep. Owners were very helpful. Elevator is small, but worked for getting luggage upstairs. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming family friendly hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: suebebe
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on a review from a website specializing in family travel. It fit the bill! Although it is a bit removed from the main attractions, it was easy to get everywhere (metro was steps away). It was quiet - we never heard noise from another room. The beds were extremely comfortable. We had a triple (1 double or queen bed, and 1 single for our daughter). The room was very small (especially with the 2 beds) but was comfortable. When we arrived, they brought up a box of toys for our daughter. We weren't sure we were going to do the breakfast, so we didn't buy it when we booked. It ended up being great. Wonderful pastries but also cereals, fresh fruit, ham and cheeses. Breakfast is from 7am to 10am. It was well attended to during the week, but the one time we went on the weekend, it was sparse when we arrived at 9:45am (a different person working I think). They also have crayons, coloring paper, kids utensils, sippy cups, plates, etc. It was nice to get a full breakfast at the start of the day- and kids eat free! Natalia, who worked reception, during the week was wonderful. Very helpful and nice. The weekend person wasn't quite as helpful. The hotel is 4 stories and there is a small elevator (sadly, our daughter liked do go up the steps each time!). There is a playground not too far away. That (and the elevated gardens) was a nice thing to do the first day when we were very tired. The hotel seemed like a great price (109 Euro for the triple. Probably could have gotten a smaller room since they provide cots, but it was nice to have comfortable beds for everyone). There was free Wifi, and also a computer to use if needed. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy234
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel de la porte doree with my mum for my 18th birthday, and it was absolutely brilliant. We stayed for 2 nights in a beautiful room on the roadside, but the road noise was not a problem - we couldn't hear it! The room was beautifully decorated and it was a good size. There are 2 supermarkets very nearby (one just across the road), plenty of places to eat and a gorgeous boulangerie across the road. The metro station was brilliantly located and the noise if the metro didn't disturb us at all. Overall, the hotel was clean and the staff were so friendly, and I'd definately stay here again and recommend it! Paris is a beautiful city, and I can't wait to come and stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: Brandonong
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially Natalie were very pleasant and helpful. We made a wrong booking but she was able to shift the rooms around so that we had a place. What other reviews don't tell u is that the location is excellent - supermarkets, grocery shops, 24 hr MacDs and Subway all within 20 meters of the front door.
