And the Metro (take exit no 2) is 10 meters from the hotel. I'll recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ladybird0
Reviews.Content: Really pretty hotel with a lot of character and such good value. I found the female staff members really helpful, to be honest the males were not as friendly but in no way rude! Small room and v small bathroom but I don't think this matters when you're there to explore. Nice soaps etc esp for a small hotel. I'm really fussy and noticed a few hairs in the shower and bed. Others prob wouldn't! Decor is lovely and liked the open out windows. Metro handy but little nightlife in Porte doree. Ended up v rainy one night when we were there and we didn't want to go far but didn't have much choice. All in all I would def recommend, I doubt the prices will remain as they are though given costs of everything else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in all of Paris!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: golftippin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought a small group of 19 to this charming hotel during March of 2011. As previously reviewed, this hotel was warm, friendly, and extremely accomodating. The service we received while our group was their was better than any we have experienced during our years of taking groups (this was our 14th trip) to Paris. Even though the hotel is a ways from the main attractions of Paris, the convenient Metro stop (right in front of the hotel) made it easy to get anywhere in Paris our group wanted to go. Their are at least 3 ATMs where one can get Euros, 2 bakeries, 2 small convenience stores, and 1 small grocery store very close to the hotel. A large grocery store (Monoprix) is a very short walk from the hotel. The only downside our group talked about was a lack of nightlife type of establishments close to the hotel. If one truly wants to experience Paris at night, you will have to go into the city. This is not a problem though because of the Metro. Overall, this hotel is the best value my wife and I have ever encountered in Paris. We will plan on using the Hotel Porte Doree when we bring future groups to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel~ :)”
Reviews.Author: irlily
Reviews.Content: The sole reason I chose this hotel even though it was outside of central Paris was due to pricing and all the good reviews on here. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and how close it was to the Metro! (A few steps away.) Positive: The rooms are cozy and quite charming. The staff is extremely helpful and very pleasant to talk to. Very close to Metro and about a 15-20 minute ride to central Paris. They have a farmers market outside every Thursday and Sunday morning. Unfortunately the popular bakery (across the street) in the area was on vacation while we visited. Small grocery store across the street. Restaurants in the area. Plus free Wi-Fi! Negative: Our bathroom kept flooding from the sink. We stayed for 6 nights and by the time we left, it was still flooding... And for some strange reason, my boyfriend and I didn't sleep very well on the beds but it might have just been us. I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Paris! :D

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: tulieguy
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, very helpful, good location, convenient to metro. Quiet rooms available away from street. Our room was a standard double and comfortable though small. Was fine because we were on the go most of the time. Rooms were kept very clean and neat. Restaurants, cafes and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Fine for one night...”
Reviews.Author: jess_2419
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree for one night in November of 2010 and it was alright. A small room, but that's typical of Paris hotels so was not a surprise. The ceiling was pretty bad though - stained and moldy. Might not bother some people, but as someone with asthma it was a bit irritating. I didn't complain though because we were staying there only one night. Our friend's room was fine however. Our bathroom was also fine, but the shower didn't hold water and the bathroom and room floors were completely soaked after two showers. A bit annoying. Other than that it was fine for what we paid. Close to the metro which was nice, but as we drove there really wasn't any good parking around. If going back to Paris, we'd definitely try out some place different.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Susan99577
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation here for 3 nights thinking we would get our bearings in Paris and move to another place once we knew the city a bit better. After 2 nights we asked ourselves why we would decide to go elsewhere and we reserved a room for the next week. We ended up staying in 2 different rooms because of the 2 reservations, one streetside and one in the back, and both were quiet, comfortable and perfectly charming. Very comfortable beds. The staff was very friendly and helpful, even to the point of one woman there lending me her own vase so I could put the flowers my boyfriend bought me in water. There is a street market right out front, a huge park with lakes a couple of blocks away, and a great bakery just up the road at the next subway stop (close to the park). There is a subway station right out the front door and it was a quick ride into the downtown. Couldn't ask for a better location or price.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I wanted for a perfect Parisian stay”
Reviews.Author: blumchen78
Reviews.Content: When I started planning the Paris trip I wanted to escape the chain hotel "you know what to expect" experience. I wanted a boutique hotel with stylish furniture and nice decor, in a place that would not be difficult to get to on metro from the airport - oh, and it was not supposed to cost a fortune. Hotel de la Porte Doree happened to fit my requirements perfectly. It was very easy for us to enjoy our stay there. The staff were very friendly, ready to help with booking our activities in the city. Breakfast is a fairly decent spread and coffe is available at any time of the day. Our room was really cosy and very clean. The hotel is just a few meters from the Porte Doree metro station, which is on line 8 (Balard/Creteil) and will take you directly to Bastille, Opera Garnier, Concorde, Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nicer People”
Reviews.Author: angelagf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the location is very convenient, just meters from the Metro station. Staff is extremely friendly, specially Natalie who help us to sneak a Birthday cake for my brother and serve it at the dining room. Rooms are nice, a triple accommodation room was superior in space and decor than the double. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_World39
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the only down side was the location which is a bit far from the center. We knew about it though, so it wasn't an issue for us. The train station is literally 15 seconds walking from the hotel and the area is full of restaurants and markets. The room and bathroom were cute, the bed was really comfy! There was NO train rumble as we asked for an upper room. The breakfast guy (can't remember his name) was LOVELY and couldn't do enough to help us! Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Da2708
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed here in January 2011 and were thrill how close the hotel is to the metro. The room was spacious and quiet. The hotel even let us leave our luggage in the lobby for a few hours even after we had checked out. There is an excellent bakery just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel/value”
Reviews.Author: JHHouston
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a week in Paris prior to my daughter going on to Rome for school. Stayed 19-23 January, 2011. Chose the hotel based on value (Trip Advisor rated #170 of 2,000+ Paris hotels - said so much @ $89 US/night). Short drive from CDG (20/30 min.). Stayed in Room 216 overlooking Av. Daumensnil. Entered into a pretty little lobby where we were greeted immediately. Had read about the small elevator and actually loved the experience of sending our bags up the lift while we took the stairs. It was big enough for both bags and one of us. Anyone who has a problem with this doesn't appreciate the fact that this convenience has been added to an original building, much the way it's been in the apartment buildings of many Paris neighborhoods. They put them where they can and they are not meant to be impressive but are very functional. Our room was impeccable and smelled heavenly. The decor was beautiful and every attention to detail was noticed. From the wood floors, high ceilings, to the high quality drapery, the unbelievable art, to the molding at the ceiling, to the exquisite and welcoming bedding to the well equipped bath all in a very efficient and spacious Parisian hotel room. I dare you to compare what you get for the price. It cannot be beat! Not to mention that we were literally out the front door and onto the metro entrance, but not before crossing the street to get some of the most heavenly pastries I have ever eaten. The same that are served in the hotel's dining room should you chose to enjoy breakfast there. We had a plan of how we wanted to do the city and leisurely breakfasts were not part of our plan. In the evening we would head back to the 12th and enjoy some of the local places for dinner. Great values can be found - follow the advice given in the in-room guide to the 12th. You can't go wrong, either reading the guide for entertainment or taking the recommendations. (Your hostess has a flare for writing and loves her neighborhood!) The first night we were recovering from our flight from the US. We wanted to celebrate my daughter's 20th birthday so we decided to walk the 10 minutes to the MonoPrix where we purchased wine, cheese and fruit. Stopped at the Boulangerie across the street for a bagette and little pastries for desert and back to our room. Our hostess offered corkscrew, plates, utensils, napkins and wine glasses so we could enjoy our birthday celebration. She so enjoyed her Parisian birthday celebration!!! Though we had brought our own, I noticed that there was an umbrella bucket at the reception area filled with like umbrellas, obviously there in case you'd forgotten to bring one. I have to admit that we did hear the metro rumble - but it "never" interfered with our sleep. I am an extremely light sleeper. I think partially because the trains slow to a snails pace at some point and stop at about 1. Resume early morning but never bothered us. Thoroughly enjoyed the view out the two "huge" windows facing the street in front of the hotel. Open air market one morning. You cannot get a better value unless large reception areas are your thing. Let me mention the Boulangerie across the street one more time!!!! I would stay here every time I went to Paris & not hesitate to recommend it. So much value for the $. The owner treats you like a guest in her home but you have a lock on your door - which we actually forgot to lock on several nights. I think we felt extremely safe here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bee_Good_77
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend and I for a recent 3 night stay based on the great reviews, smart and detailed website and the location - we hadn't stayed in or explored the 12th ar. and wanted something different from the usual experience. We weren't disappointed - first impressions were of a friendly, charming place which was unusually decorated to a high standard with some flair. Compared to what we have paid in the past the hotel is excellent value, and it isn't a problem to travel into the centre of town given there is a metro stop right outside, with one change to/from the Gare du Nord if you're coming on the Eurostar. I'd booked a standard double which was of a fair size, and nicely furnished with great local information provided. The hotel is on a fairly busy road but we had a room at the back of the building, which was quiet - I couldn't say how noisy it would be to stay at the front however so you might need to look to other reviews! Breakfast was 10EUR extra but well worth it (the website doesn't 'enhance' what is provided unlike some hotels!) and deliciously fresh. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel is also a great value!”
Reviews.Author: JennyPilates
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Porte Doree is a charming hotel with wonderful service and lovely accommodations. Located in the 12th, it is a bit far from many of the attractions which people are looking for when they visit Paris (ie: Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame), but I gave it a good rating for location due to its very close proximity to the Metro; this makes it very easy to get any where you would like to go in Paris. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, clean, comfortable hotel with quality food for breakfast, bus / metro at door.”
Reviews.Author: Millphoebe
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel on a fairly wide leafy street that has a reasonable amount of traffic but is not unduly noisy in the day and is quiet at night. While it is some distance from the centre of Paris, it has a metro entrance literally outside the door for a line that goes straight to Concorde. Provided that you are reasonably mobile to cope with the longish metro walks and stairways, all you have to do is to climb the stairways out of the Metro and you emerge only steps from the front door of the hotel. From a transport point of view, Paris is at your feet. We chose the hotel because it had been recommended as being good value and of a quality superior to many that are far more expensive in the city centre. It looked good on its website, also. We received a warm welcome. It is our understanding that the average bedroom size in Paris is much smaller than the norm in other cities in Europe and USA. Our room was small, but perfectly formed, with a high ceiling. It had two tall windows overlooking the trees and the street. We appreciated the simple, restful, clean decor. Wardrobe space was fine for people like us there for a few days who dress simply. We valued the safe in the wardrobe. The bed was comfortable and the bedding spotless white. The bathroom is very small but well lit, clean and had a good shower in the bath, lovely natural toiletries and adequate towels, which included a facecloth. A bonus in that room is that the toilet is separate from the bathroom. I liked the touch of the basket of magazines in the bedroom. There was no television in our room, but given that we were on a break from busy lives, that was a bonus. We liked the breakfast! We are NOT people who like the smell of fried food in the morning so if that is your lifeline to wake up, this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast room is simply and attractively furnished and the food is self service. Choose from whole fresh fruit - bananas, kiwis, oranges were on offer, fruit juice, cereals, milk, lovely choice of excellent breads from the high quality boulangerie across the road, honey, jam, lovely cheeses,yoghurt, cold sliced ham, teas and coffee. All at your own pace. This is not a fancy hotel, it is not in a modern building so if you want acres of tiling, 21st century minimalism, go somewhere else. The orginal simple architectural features of the building remain - stair balustrades with carpeting as it would have been done originally. We really appreciated that we got - for Paris - good value. The metro trip is not more than 20 mins from the city centre and the bus for the Gare du Nore railway station stops right outside the door going to the train station and across the road coming from it. If Charles de Gaulle is your airport, it could not be better as the train from the airport goes to Gare du Nore and the bus station is right beside the train station. We walked over to the boulangerie one day and found high quality food - they take pride in their work and made up a baguette with the fillings we desired. Their pastries are works of art. Sometimes in the mornings there are queues outside the bakery. Strolling around the streets behind the boulangerie admiring the intricate and varied architecture of the apartment buildings was pleasant and there is a large park not too far away. The area gives you the feel of what living in inner suburban Paris is like. The pleasant welcome and friendliness in the hotel added to our positive experience of Paris. If we could have afforded super luxury accommodation right beside the Louvre, we'd have gone there. But this is simple, clean, good quality hospitality that is NOT souless chain, poorly-maintained-because- we-are-selling-ourselves-as-inexpensive rip-off. We enjoyed our short trip to see the sights of Paris and were exhilerated by the simple pleasures of being in a beautiful place together sightseeing and delighting in so much. This hotel met our needs and did not detract in any way from our expereince. Would we go back to it? YES, most definitely. When that will be, is another question. We were a couple, but this would also be a good hotel for a single person on a budget and would be fine for the business person who needs good clean food to set them up for the day, with the certain knowledge of transport with links to everywhere in Paris close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - not your average 2-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmataH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Porte Doree in a single room from 30 December 2010 to 1 January 2011 and was thrilled with my stay. The staff were uniformly friendly, warm and bilingual; very happy to answer any questions and help with local advice. My room was spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable and smartly decorated, with a small writing desk and chair (confirming that it was bigger than the glorified wardrobes you'll find masquerading as single rooms in many Parisian hotels) and fast, free wifi. The room was also fitted with its own airconditioner/heater, meaning that I could control the temperature exactly as I pleased. No, it isn't quite in the heart of Paris, but an easy 20 mins or so on the Metro (the station is a stone's throw from the hotel) will get you most places you want to go. The 4.5km Promenade Plantee - similar to New York's High Line - also begins very near the hotel, offering a lovely scenic walk to the Bastille. My room included a terrific booklet of information on local restaurants, shops and sights, giving residents the opportunity to make the most of the neighbourhood and get off the beaten tourist track. One of those local treasures is the boulangerie across the street; the source of the amazing pastries you'll enjoy as part of a Porte Doree breakfast. In short: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and have already suggested that friends stay here. It is a real find. The only tiny thing I could suggest as an improvement would be the quality of the towels, which were a bit scratchy and institutional. Still, for a two-star hotel, this is absolutely outstanding and charming. Some have commented on noise from the Metro but I could only hear a low rumble on the 3rd floor, and that was nowhere near loud enough to be a bother. Thank you very much for a lovely stay - I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most child friendly city hotels”
Reviews.Author: suita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days 2 nights with our 2 yr old son. The hotel is exactly how it looks in the website, very cosy and clean. The room was very spacious compared to other hotels in Paris. We've stayed in many hotels but this was hands down one of the most child friendly city hotels we've stayed in. They even had a box of toys for our son to take up to the room to play with and crayons and toys in the dining area too. The receptionist, I am not sure of her name, but she was very patient and answered all our questions about travel and places to see etc. The staff in the dining area were friendly too. The hotel is a bit out of the way from the main tourist areas but this is something clearly mentioned in the reviews and the website so we were prepared for that. We've been to Paris before so werent looking to visit all the tourist sights anyway, this gave us the opportunity to stay in this lovely hotel, in a normal Parisien neighbourhood and travel into the city center to visit the xmas markets etc. So all in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel, specially to families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for a Parisian Christmas”
Reviews.Author: HomewardBound85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over Christmas and had a very pleasant stay. The hotel itself is a little bit away from the centre of Paris but is easily reachable through the Paris metro. Our room was extremely nice with very comfortable beds and a decent sized bathroom. Staff were very friendly and gave us plenty of advice on where to eat and what to do while in the area. All in all a great stay...will definitely stay again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Nice neighborhood, out of the rush of central Paris”
Reviews.Author: dlhewitt
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near the metro and local restaurants. The owner is an American and very helpful and friendly. Easy to walk around the neighborhood and see local stores and open air market. Laundromat a block away. Metro is within 100 feet of hotel with easy access to central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel nestled in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gigi017
Reviews.Content: I have just finished staying at the Hotel De La Porte Doree and it was everything it promised! The staff are friendly and speak both french and English and are always willing to assist in anyway they can. The hotel is located in the twenty arrondissement which means it is a little way out of the city BUT the metoe stop is literally right outside and the trip takes a max of twenty minutes and trains leave every two to four minutes. Close by is a fabulous boulangerie where croissants are delicious and only one euro! There is a monoprix supermarket five mins walk away and many bars and restaurants to fulfill even the most picky of gourmets. Free wifi or a computer on the floor which you can use free of charge. Yes you can feel the subway but I did not find it was a problem at all. As a single traveller a rat of 54 euro a night for a comfortable and decent size single room annenauite in Paris was cheap at the price for what I got! I will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: Tianni_10
Reviews.Content: Far away from city centre, sleep quality was compromised by metro which runs nearby. Other than that, a good stay with excellent service and very clean rooms/ bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Requets upper floor room”
Reviews.Author: SimonDallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Subway station. This is definitely a plus. The room rate is also quite reasonable. I stay at the 2nd floor facing street for the first 2 nights. I can feel the room vibrating whenever subway passed. I change to 4th floor, the vibrating is considerable less. Therefore, please request an upper room when you make a reservation. The sleep quality for 2nd floor would be 2/5 and 4th floor would be 3.5/5

Reviews.Title: “100 euro per superior double room is fair”
Reviews.Author: Geelongman
Reviews.Content: 100 euro per superior double room is fair but if i had paid more i would be dissapointed. Hotel is nice and cozy, rooms are clean but honestly, i could not pay more than 100e/night. When you look at the map you can get the impression that hotel is located far from the centre but with brilliant metro system in Paris nothing is far. Paris i beutiful (buildings, etc.) but i must say one thing about French: SMILE COSTS A MILLION THERE. I can say the same about Porte Doree hotel staff as well. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “not a 2* hotel!!!prop 4*!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sakis13
Reviews.Content: what can i say!!! i stayed in this hotel for 6 days. a hotel with perfect staff!!from the very polite person who was responsible for the breakfast area,till the cleaning service and the receptionists!everyone smile persons!everyone willing to help you! the room was superb!with a huge comfortable bed,a bath that was always warm(!!)and a very lovely decoration! by the way!yes,the metro is right outside and u can hear it!but u r in paris!the whole city is a metro!!!and no!it did not bothered me... i will surely reccomend this hotel and i will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer123231230
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Loved it. A beautiful and interesting hotel that will satisfy your spouse who had an idealized mental image of what a Paris hotel should be like. Service was excellent, especially Nathalie at the front desk. Particularly appreciated hotel's willingness to let us leave our luggage early before check-in so that we could sightsee without wondering what to do with our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: lucindaarmour
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 and 9 year old and I recently stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree Paris. We had spent a number of nights in a much more expensive hotel near the Louvre, went off for a few days at Disneyland and then returned to end our time in Paris at the Porte Doree. Its a great hotel for families. We had two rooms with an ajoining door/entrance and both rooms were very beautifully furnished with good bathrooms. Very comfortable with heating you could regulate. They were also on the ground floor which is great with heavy bags. There is a lift in the hotel but I am not sure it would fit more than 1 person and a bag! The stairs are fine. On the 2nd floor is a communal computer which you can use free of charge and my son spent a good amount of time on. Breakfast was included and very lovely with great fresh pastries, breads, spreads, fruits and yoghurts. Hot chocolate was bought to the table. The staff were very kind and helpful to us and allowed us to store our big bags at the hotel on the last day, and then arranged for a taxi for us to Charles De Gaule airport, which was only 30 minutes away. The hotel is right on the doorstep of a metro (in fact you can hear it a little at night zooming past!) and another metro is a 10 minute walk away on another line, if thats easier. The whole area is interestingm very Parisian and less touristy but still with loads of good eating options for families. A very reasonably priced hotel that hits way above its weight. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: danorthshore
Reviews.Content: We can't say anything negative about this hotel. In fact, it was far superior to our expectations. If you want clean, great location, charm&character, and great service - then we highly recommend this hotel. It made our trip to Paris memorable and wanting more... it was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: vivianmelobr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not very close to the the touristic sites but there is a subway station under the hotel - althought I could hear the subway passing during the nights! The room is very small but clean and the bed is great. The bathroom is also small but the shower was good! There is internet free! No breakfast, unless you pay!!! But there is a great Boulangerie across the street where we bought food for breakfast! The staff was very helpful, arranged a cab for us and helped us open a suitcase (that we accindentaly closed with the kee inside)!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginger09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved staying at the Hotel de la Porte Doree. Our room was on the top floor facing the street. We had a seperate bathroom from the toilet. The room was large for Paris standards. I was able to do my yoga every morning before venturing out. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and kind. The housekeeper was wonderful. A very kind woman who always kept our room spotless and well supplied with toiletries. The restaurant accross the street (heading towards the park) was a wonderful place to start the day. The first day there they were helpful but reserved, but on day three we were treated like regulars, and on our, last morning in paris they fixed us a lunch to take on the airplane. I love the being in the center of paris, but I prefer staying near the peripheric(sp) in one of the wonderful neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great value hotel with lots of charm.”
Reviews.Author: Windingspen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a number of times. We prefer a place out of the touristy areas. Porte Doree is near a large park with a lake to walk or jog around. The hotel has modern bathrooms and each room is individually decorated. This is a small, family hotel run by a young couple[he's french, she's american]. It's comfortable, cozy, and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, friendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: aadams90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend and it turned out to be better than we ever expected. The room was comfortable in size with charming antique decoration with a large window that opened up to the street. The bed was noticeably VERY comfortable.. especially compared to what I usually sleep in at hostels. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They recommended a great local restaurant down the street that I highly recommend for anyone hungry and on a budget. (it was called Bistro 102). My only complaints would be that the bathroom was a little small and the water took a longgg time to heat up, but most of all the hotel is about a 20-25 minute metro into the center of Paris which was somewhat inconvenient. Also the metro runs very close to the hotel so you can hear it at night..this didn't bother us but may be a problem for some. But overall, especially for the price, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, well maintained hotel with friendly emplyees”
Reviews.Author: kuroitenpi
Reviews.Content: My new wife and myself stayed at this hotel during our one week vacation in Paris. It was very clean and the employees were pleasant and helpful. As many of the reviewers pointed out, there is the metro station that runs right under the hotel, but after the first night we barely noticed it....it's not so severe that everthing shakes. The rooms are small, but this is just how things are in France in general, not something specific to this hotel. Overall it was a great place to stay especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location, will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Yonyad
Reviews.Content: I thought this place might be too far from Paris' city center but it is SO CLOSE to a metro station (literally 20 feet from the front door to the steps down to the metro stop) that we could hop on the metro and be at the Eiffel Tower in 15 minutes. The metro is so easy to navigate through and you can get dropped off pretty much anywhere in Paris that you would want to go to. The neighborhood is lit with streetlamps and even after dark there were always at least a few people milling around, grabbing a late dinner,etc. There were several eateries nearby (within 2-3 blocks) that we could walk to and were reasonably priced. There were two pharmacies within a couple of blocks that we were (very) grateful for and, during the week there is a bakery right across the street that supplies scrumptious breads to munch on. There was at least one ATM about a block away that I used, and I think I saw a second one about two blocks further on. The front desk staff were GREAT! Two of the young ladies working there answered all of our questions, gave us great advice on what to do, and wrote down important tips on how to get around smartly. And they were both from California so their English was perfect! The hotel itself was adorable!! The front waiting area had an ornate couch, warm lighting, and shelves filled with books. There is an elevator but it is TINY and you can't help but laugh while you're in it! My friend and I could barely fit squeeze in, my backpack barely made it! Follow the tapestry-covered staircase up and you're greeted on every turn with more shelves packed with books, art hanging on the walls, and light sconces warming each level. The halls are made of hardwood floor and covered with rug runners that add to the rich details. Our room came with two twin beds that were the most comfortable out of any of our six other hotels. The mattresses were soft with fluffy comforters and pillows. There wasn't much to see outside our windows but we didn't mind at all since we were always out and about. There was a full bathroom, all of the fixtures worked great, the water was hot, my friend took a hot bath every night in the deep tub. We did have a small, flat-screen tv in the room, a safe, and a writing desk. There was shelving in an alcove between the main room and the bathroom which was great to keep our clothes organized. There was a large window in both the bathroom and the bedroom that we could open and let in the natural light to our room. Overall, we LOVED this place!! I would recommend the Hotel de la Porte Doree to anyone staying in Paris and I will definitely stay here if I ever visit Paris again! The price was VERY reasonable, too, and we stuck to a strict budget when it came to our hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Two-Star Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: basalcell
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel to which we return over and over again--and for good reason. The hotel offers the best value for the money in Paris, which is no small feat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful; like a top boutique hotel at two star prices! Wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir52
Reviews.Content: This is a real find, probably the finest two-star hotel in France, if not the world! Spotlessly clean, the staff are friendly, warm and welcoming. Each room is furnished individually in a tasteful mixture of old and modern, it really does have the feel of a posh boutique hotel. There are some lovely touches all round the hotel, umbrellas to borrow when it's raining, lots of well-chosen books to read should you feel the need and gorgeous natural Body-Shop style toiletries in the bathroom. The ensuite bath and shower rooms are extremely modern and the white towels are pristine clean. The breakfast is delicious and the restaurant manager looks after you like precious friend. There was so much to eat, fruit, yogurts, cheese, pastries, cereals and delicious fresh coffee. The hotel is situated on a lovely wide boulevard, opposite an excellent boulangerie. It is two minutes away from the metro station and five minutes from the gorgeous Bois de Vincennes. One small downside is that it is directly above the metro and there is a bit of a rumble, but this didn't bother us after a while. I recommend this wonderful gem of a hotel in the highest possible terms.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcwee
Reviews.Content: Warm little hotel. Very convenience location; with bakery,laundry shop plenty of eateries nearby etc. The area even has morning market every Thu & Sunday morning. The rumbling sound of the metro is not a problem as we had been tired. The only minus point of the hotel is the lift, is very very small.

Reviews.Title: “The main problem- the noise, otherwise- it’s ok”
Reviews.Author: DAG4
Reviews.Content: The first night was a disaster, we arrived at midnights and plan to sleep late, however at 5 o’clock a lot of noise was coming from m the metro and the reception. After we relocated to an upper floor, the impression was much better- the rooms are clean but very small. Breakfast was nice but minimalist. The service and atmosphere were very nice. The location, a bit far a way from the main attraction of Paris. Still, it might me that for around 100 Euro per night in Paris – the expectation from the hotel level need to be realistic and we can’t expect facilities as in other towns in the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hottodoggu
Reviews.Content: I've been to a couple of hotels in Paris, and I have to say this is one of my favourites. Recently stayed here with my wife (after reading the excellent ratings and reviews it received from other fellow TripAdvisor), and it definitely lived up to its recommendations. We stayed on the second floor, and although some reviews mentioned the noise issue from the underground metro, I personally found it audible, but was not enough a disturbance to my sleep. The hotel is situation is very conveniently situated, (less than 30 sec walk from metro exit 2). Paris metro is fantastic, and probably the best and easiest way to get around town. As long as you know where to change trains, you should have no issues reaching any tourist attractions in less than 20-30 min. It took me just less than 20 min from hotel to the Louvre, door to door. The rooms themselves are very clean, well furnished with traditional french furniture. They are not the most spacious, but hey, almost all Parisian hotels and apartments are tiny. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very warm and welcoming. I have to especially mention the lovely floral fragrance of the air fresheners. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They helped us organise pretty much everything, from trip planning, dining recommendations and our shuttle to the airport. Only thing missing was probably a mini fridge from the rooms, either from that everything is great! Definitely a bargain for its price range, with free wifi and internet access points (if you don't have your own laptop)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff and family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Isabellek
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the staff very friendly. The room was great and spacious even with a crib (that was loaned by the hotel). It is located in a great area of Paris with an amazing bakery right across the street and a park where our toddler could play. If you have a car, you can get on the peripherique easily, and if you don't the Metro is right there and will take you all over Paris. We really enjoyed the great breakfast offerings in the morning and even had a high chair for our kid. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in a Dozen Trips to Paris, Especially Now with Kids...”
Reviews.Author: Seanfromseattle
Reviews.Content: I married a French woman and travel to France every year, sometimes twice a year. We always stay in Paris for a few days before moving on to visit the family, and we have easily stayed in 15+ hotels over the years. Hotel Porte Doree was easily the best, and is probably the only hotel we will ever stay in in Paris now. Located in Paris proper, but in a real neighboorhood that French people actually live in, there is a metro and bus stop right outside the door, resturants, a cafe, a bakery, and most importantly, a park with a playground for the kids to unwind, all basically accross the street. The park was easilly the most important feature of the neighboorhood because it gave my son some space to run, and interact with French kids. A bank with an ATM, a grocery store, and a take-away deli, is a couple of blocks away. Since it is a living French neighboorhood, out of the tourist areas, the area is not overrun by hords of tourists, and the real French hospitality has a chance to come out (meaning you get to meet friendly French people). The staff is great (all bi-lingual), and the hotel is owned by a French & American couple. They have a large breakfast room, internet, and clean bathrooms. My wife went on and on about the soaps and shampoos (Yawn to me...). They are kid friendly, with baskets of toys and portable cribs, but because the public spaces are not tiny, you don't feel the impact of having families stay there if you are not travelling with kids. They even have an elevator which is rare for hotels in this price range. If you want a hotel that lets you unwind after your day, and lets you get a feel for what living in Paris is like, this is the place for you. I send all my friend here. Sean in Seattle. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel de la Porte Doree”
Reviews.Author: SuzieandDon
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel and definitely would stay there again. It is located on a beautiful street, there is a metro stop a half block away, the rooms are beautiful and larger than most 2 star hotels in Paris. The staff employees speak English and are very nice and helpful and the hotel has a better breakfast selection than most hotels. They have free Wi Fi in all rooms and free use of a computer if you don't have your own. My wife loved the bathroom. It was modern and the shower was separated from the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: joanch
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with all comments of the last reviewer. We had 3 rooms in total on both 1st and 2nd floors and experienced minimal disturbance from the metro. There are some road works outside the hotel but I had a front bedroom and was not distubed. Breakfast is a must with fabulous service. After hours of sightseeing the beds are fantastic - comfort of the mattress, pillows and linen could not be better. The transfer on the bus was ideal. When you leave the eurostar train go through security gate and turn left - walk all the way through the station and exit via the lift or escalator which is located at the VERY far end on the left. You can buy your tickets from the RER machines nearer to this exit, it's much quieter than the ones down in the metro. We bought serveral books of tickets - carnets- which can be used on the metro and buses but we did have problems with them not being accepted through the machines. The info desks exchanged them without a problem. You need RER counters or machines for metro and bus tickets. It can be very confusing at the station as there are several 'billet' (ticket) counters for different train companies. If you plan to visit Versaille make sure you visit the 2 smaller palaces and the gardens - Marie Antoinettes village is amazing and you can pay approx 6 euros each way for the little train to take you there and back. We were in Paris from 28th Sept for 2 nights - perfect - no queues for anything (Versaille, the louvre and Eiffel tower,) and weather fabulous. Would definitely stay at this hotel again - it was worth the short metro ride back into the centre and really easy to do. One last thing - we left our cases at Gare du Nord in the morning of our last day so we didn't need to go back to the hotel - Only 7euros for a 2 med cases. This is located near the eurostar trains. Eurostar on your right - walk towards the exit then on the left take escalator down to lugguge store.

Reviews.Title: “Could do a lot, lot worse.......”
Reviews.Author: marlowmsk
Reviews.Content: We foolishly arrived in Paris in the height of fashion week and motorshow, when hotel availability was NIL and all hotels had added at least an extra 100€ to the bill each night. Porte Doree was no different, but as it was the only place available with half decent reviews so we decided to give it a go. Our first two nights in Paris was spent in a hovel of a place in that was charging 400€ a night and we would have had a better nights sleep outside. This may have made me overly appreciative of Porte Doree but even so, it is a very very nicely done hotel. The area of Porte Doree was a lovely surprise, with a beautiful park and lake and, if you like walking, I strongly recommend rambling the length of the Viaduct de Arts to Bastille to wander around the shops or sit in a cafe with a Pastis. Our room was very comfortable, although certainly 'compact' (ie Paris size not American), the decor lovely, cleanliness perfect, toiletries were gorgeous, and a delicious breakfast based on fairtrade and local products. €140 a night was a bit steep considering how far from central Paris is it and how small the room, but then we have aquaintances returning in November paying 80€ a night, and you certainly couldnt complain for that. ps once we hit that comfortable bed, I never heard the metro line once.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Done!”
Reviews.Author: GMoniNYC
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by the smell of scented burning candles at Hotel De La Porte Dorée’s entrance. The colors of the décor (chairs, curtains, art works, furniture and floor) in the room made me feel at ease and relaxed to know that I made the good choice. The hotel’s lobby and reception area are exactly the way it is shown on the website. The receptionist at the front desk was pleasant and greeted me with a warm “Bonjour Madame”. Christina then came out and informed me that my room was ready, which was a pleasant and welcomed surprised to hear since I arrived very early to the hotel. I was given the run down on the amenities (breakfast hours, Champagne flutes are available for use, ice machine, computer room, free internet access, etc.) the hotel offers all with a matter of minutes – “VERY NICE”. I took the elevator to the 3rd floor, my room was number 31. When I made the reservation on the hotel’s website, I requested a twin room on the 2nd or 3rd floor of the hotel. Room 31 was clean, warm, bright and spacious and charmingly decorated. The beautiful hardwood parquet floors were spotless and warm. I basically had four rooms to relax in and enjoy: Large spacious bedroom area (two twin beds with goose-down fill duvet covered comforters, plenty of pillows, telephone, two chairs, wall mounted plasma Cable television, desk areas, large mirror and a large double panned window that opened to the back of the hotel), dressing room (had a place to hang and store folded clothes, store my luggage, and a safe), bathroom with a window that opened (towel warmer that was on and filled with lots of clean towels, a big beautiful clean bath tub, shower, sink, hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and shower gel), and private commode area with scented toilet paper). The comfortable bed was truly a welcome blessing after a day of sightseeing -- "the bed" WoW! The room was serviced and refreshed daily, so I received fresh towels, toiletries were replenished and the bed way made by the time I returned in the evening. The hallways of Hotel De La Porte Dorée are attractively decorated with artwork, flowers and the staircases with filled with bookshelves (reminds me of home I grew up in). The Free Wi-Fi and use of a computer room helped with checking emails and the elevator worked every day while I was there with no problems. The delightful daily breakfast buffet is served on the first floor in the breakfast room. The breakfast includes fresh croissants and French baguette, eggs, ham, fruit, coffee, teas, apple juice, orange juice, yogurt, cereals, homemade jams and several delights I may have missed, is a great bargain (10 Euros) for Paris and a way for you to fuel up for the sightseeing trip ahead. The hotel is located in a safe neighborhood of Paris with inexpensive restaurants, boulangerie (the bakery across the street at 278 avenue Daumesnil is the GREAT ) and boucherie (butcher) shop a few doors down that has succulent rotisserie chicken all make items for a nice lunch or a picnic in the Bois de Vincennes Park (located near the hotel). The Parc Floral (a flower garden) and the Vincennes Zoo are also a few blocks and within walking distance from the hotel. I took several walks to the Bastille from the hotel on numerous evenings after having dinner in the Porte Dorée area and had no problems. A Monoprix grocery store is located nearby for you to pick-up bottled water (for your sightseeing walks), any other toiletries and snacks (the hotel has an ice machine). A self-service laundry facility is also within walking distance of the hotel. Some of the other amenities that Hotel de La Porte Dorée offers are: Business center, bar, and a free books exchange, I donated the book I had completed reading. Every Thursday morning, steps away from the front of the hotel there is a weekly market with vendors selling fruits, vegetables, cheese, meats, fish and clothes that spans a few blocks down Avenue Daumesnil. The market is a great place to purchase fresh fruits, cheeses and other food items to try and enjoy while walking around Paris. To get to Hotel De La Porte Dorée from Gard du nord Station take the Number 46 bus to the Porte Dorée stop or by metro take the 5 Metro line in the direction of Place d'Italie to République, then transfer to the line 8 in the direction Créteil, and get off at the Porte Dorée station. The 46 bus has a better view of Paris, so I opted for the 30 minute bus from Gard du Nord to Hotel De La Porte Dorée. Excellent train service -- the Porte Dorée train stop is a few steps away the front of the hotel, so a quick 15 minutes train ride will take you into the center of Paris and to most major attractions. Oh Yes, while a train does run under the hotel from 5:45am to 12:30am, I was not bothered while I was at the hotel during the day or at night while I slept and I'm a light sleeper. Throughout my stay at Hotel De La Porte Dorée, that staff was professional, courteous, helpful, and friendly, all of the things that make Hotel de la Porte Dorée a wonderful place to stay. I enjoyed my stay at Hotel De La Porte Dorée and was able to easily relax and enjoy my visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RambleOn33
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We will definitely stay here next time we come to Paris and will recommend this charming place to all friends who are traveling to France. The location is very convenient to the Metro and there is a wonderful bakery across the street. We had a classic French dinner right around the corner on our last night there. The room itself is very clean and spacious, with an adorable balcony. The staff are very knowledgeable and answered every question we had. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Donald26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for long weekend. Warm welcome from American lady on the desk. Double Room (superior) was at the front of the hotel and was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Noise of French voices from the street, through our open window, added to the pleasure of the weekend. The breakfast buffet was very good and a preparation for the many miles of walking through the centre of Paris. The Metro noise mentioned in previous reviews was no problem to us and the proximity of the metro station outside the hotel entrance proved a blessing at the end of a tiring day. There were supermarkets and shops nearby for wines and bread / pastries, etc. Would highly recommend Porte Doree Hotel as a comfortable affordable hotel from which to explore the French capital.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a superior room. The room was spaceious clean and comfortable. Plenty of hot water. Staff were polite and helpful. It took us 30 minutes to get to Gard du Nord station(including 1 chnage). McDonalds, bakers and plenty of restaurants within 2 minutes of the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel .. but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Trekkersocal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located literally steps away from the porte doree station (line 8, get out on exit 2 from the station and you will see it as you climb out the steps). Because of its proximity to the metro station, you will hear the building shake and a bit noisy as a result. The hotel is consisted of 4-5 floors, there is a very narrow elevator (lift) which will help you get between the floors if you have luggage. If your luggage is larger than the lift you'll have to hand carry it up the floors. We had a room on the third floor, but noise was still heard from the street and the metro. The metro does stop running after 12:30 at night but restarts again around 5:30 in the morning. If you're a light sleeper, this is a distraction more than anything else. If you have no problems, then it's not an issue. I had to use ear plugs and i was able to sleep. The rooms are appointed with a queen bed, closet with small safe, small 19" TV, work desk and en-suite bathroom. They serve breakfast at 12 euros/person on the downstair floor. They also have a computer and printer on the second floor. Wifi is free and included and is not bad at all, pretty good connection speed. For the price, this is a good deal. The biggest reason besides the noise from the metro for not coming here really is the location .. it is about a 30-35 min. metro ride into most places visitors would want to go to (and that usually involves changing at least once or twice). As we were only planning to spend a day or two in paris and the rest of the time going on day excursions this wasn't bad. The local neighborhood is safe, lots of great restaurants/cafes/shopping areas. The owners of the hotel do a good job with the guide they give you with lots of suggestions and they are very helpful. So, if you want a nicely priced hotel and ok with the metro noise an being a bit far from the center this is for you. if you need something closer to the city, this is not the place as the commute in may be inconvenient, better to pay more for a closer place.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Digger21
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Found the staff helpful and accommodating. The rooms were lovely and clean. We enjoyed the breakfast and the atmosphere. Having the Metro so close was perfect and considering it was our first time in Paris we had no trouble getting around. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a good,clean,great value hotel-this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: Brummiefitzy
Reviews.Content: Myself,my wife and my 7-year-old daughter stayed here for 4 nights,and what a lovely,relaxing stay it was! We were made to feel very welcome by the hotel staff-they were unfailingly friendly and helpful.I have to make a special mention of the Indian man who serves breakfast-I always enjoyed the little chats in the morning.The room in which we stayed was more than adequate for our requirements-very tastefully furnished,lovely comfortable beds,and a very nice bathroom.I have seen other reviews on this site criticising this hotel,so I was unsure about whether to book,but I'm so glad I did.The naysayers must be very hard to please.You will not find better value for money in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish clean friendly hotel just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: DrGladys
Reviews.Content: Wonderful decor, friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean. Lots of helpful emails when booking. check in straightforward and helpful. On road parking was scarce as local roadworks for new tramway. Yes lift was small but Ok as long as you stand sideways...really its most helpful for luggage. Anyway its a joy to walk up the stairs with the beautiful bookcases! Its a modern lift so none of that feeling like you're in a cage...so it was even OK for my claustophobic mother. Yes you can hear the rumble of the trains. Just bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper and dont let it bother you. I was worried before we came that my mother might complain about it..but even she was Ok with it. Ive been woken in a hotel in Covent Garden, London by partygoers at 3am..so I would prefer train rumble any night! its less intrusive than road noise. Breakfast was included as an offer for August and wonderful..from the bakery across the road. A good selection of fruit, cheese, yoghurts etc. Lovely jams. The area...i wouldnt describe it was 'gritty' as one reviewer did...again that worried me but its in a lovely leafy avenue, and even the side streets feel very safe. Much safer than in central Paris. Location. Again some past reviewers have said its out of the way, but it took us less than 30 mins to the Opera door to door. Wherever you stay in Paris you are likely to use the metro so it doesnt make any real difference. Yes its not as central as the Ritz but the local restaurants are better! and its not 500e-10000e a night! I normally manage to find fault with most hotels...before I know it Im scanning the skirting boards for dust...but I couldnt fault this hotel. We had room 36 at the back ground floor with a terrace( superior double) ...godsend to sit out with a bottle of wine when we arrived. We also had 37 at the front with a connecting small corridor which overlooked the street. Both together are the family room. I think room 39 is also at the back and has a bigger terrace so get that one if you can. We also had a single room (classic but still very stylish?) 46 which was great. Another superior twin (with bath) on 4th floor lovely and areary with views over the trees. Very romantic. Hot water and showers no problems at all. Free WiFi. Computer in room on first floor more than adequate. Local information. Again I spend ages on tripadvisor looking at best places to go and eat. You dont need to here. The American owner gives good honest info on everything you need to know. We went to Monoprix supermarket. Turn right out of hotel and 5-10 mins walk along main avenue. Eating. Cascades first night...diagonal across main street. Great service, omlettes for 5 euros, maison hamburger...12e, plat du jours 13e. Villa Romana on 2nd night (turn right out og hotel on main street) . My favorite. Moules 10e, good house rose 9e for 1litre (I think), pizza 8-9euros, good deserts, try the Citroen vodka! Great efficient service, although it has English translation on the menu and the waiter spoke great English (even though we tried our french!) we were the only tourists the rest being busy with locals. Total bill 130euros inc deserts and wines and beers for 7 people. A bargain. Just to put this in context we had a coffee in a cafe near the Opera for 7.50euros..nothing special about the cafe! Activities. Some went to the Le Bougyet Airport to see the concordes. Others, we went on DiscoverWalks Right Bank tour. Brilliant. Very funny and informative...we had a guide who is also an actress and its just like they say on their leaflet. This isnt about reading out from a guide book.......We felt we had seen some of the real Paris. They market it as free and say they then have to work hard at being good so you might give them a tip and the standard tip is 10euros for a 90 minute tour. Worth every cent. So a great way to spend the Bank Holiday weekend. Dont have any doubts about booking this hotel..Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good for young children”
Reviews.Author: zicoian
Reviews.Content: We really loved the rooms that we were given (twin bed and three bed rooms) - they looked just like the ones on the website. The beds, in particular, were among the most comfortable that we've ever slept in. Unlike some other reviewers, we found the front counter staff to be very pleasant and helpful, as were the room cleaners on our (second) floor. There was some noise from the Metro but it didn't put us off our sleep and I didn't find it distracting. We took the hotel breakfast the day that we left and we really enjoyed it. Though it was quite pricy, all the food and drink was high quality. The breakfast room was very pleasant and babies/toddlers were well catered for with the provided high chairs. We particularly enjoyed the freshly made hot chocolate, freetrade juices and jams and the croissants. Unlike some other reviewers (again), we didn't mind the journey into town on the Metro - it only took 15 minutes and was uncrowded until just before the centre of Paris. We would book here again the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My pick for a Good Value Family Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bokx2
Reviews.Content: We we to Paris for a summer trip with my wife and some family. We stayed at the hotel for four nights. We booked two rooms, the Classic Double room for my wife and myself and the Superior Twin room for the our family with an Extra Bed. Reservation/Booking: I reserved through the Hotel website. I couldn't use third party sites like hotel.com, etc since I need one room to fit 3 people and we had 5 people in total. On their reservation site they have some internet deals. I chose the 3 night package price which can be used for a minimum of 3 nights or more. Also on the site you can chose a triple room or you can chose a superior room and book an extra bed. The extra bed is 20 euros a night. Once we arrived the rooms were ready and the extra bed was already in the right room. Location: The hotel is in the 12th Arrondisement which is at the outer edge of main city Paris. The metro stop is Porte Doree on the 8 line. From the metro use Sortie #2 Ave Daumesnil. The hotel is on the same block with the metro. The neighborhood is quiet and residencial. Within a block there is a Boulangerie(bakery), several restaurants, a little convenience store, a McDonalds and a Quick (like a McDonalds). Close by is the Bois de Vincennes (a huge park), Chateau de Vincennes (a palace), and an Aquarium. Currently the block where the hotel is situated has construction (looks like they are laying down fiber or fixing pipe) which makes crossing the street a little inconvenient. The hotel is on top of the metro line. We were on the 4 level(3rd floor) and I could sense it a little bit. If I had not read about it here then I may have not noticed, but it wasn't so bad that it prevented us from sleeping. I cannot say it would be the same if we stayed on the lower levels. If you are worried about this bothering you, maybe just ask for a room on the higher levels. The only metro close by is the Line 8(Lavender). The 8 is a good line since it'll take you to these sites with walking distance: Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, Hotel Invalides, Napoleon's Tomb, Opera, Canal Saint Martin, Opera, Concorde, Musee Grevin. It's also just one transfer to other lines like Line 1 and RER C which will take you to many of the major sites. We never had to wait longer than 5 minutes for the metro to come. The main bus line is 46 which will take you straight to Gare du Nord one way and Chateau de Vincennes the other way. A taxi from the airport will cost less than 50 euros. If you forget the address just tell the driver to go to the metro stop Porte Doree. If you have bulky luggage and don't want to use a taxi I suggest catching the bus 46 from Gare du Nord or Gare d Lest to the hotel. From the Charles de Gaulle you can get to Gare du Nord from the RER B. Otherwise, if you take the metro you will have to take two trains. Rooms: My wife and I stayed in the Classic Double, Room 25. The room had a dresser that had a closet with hangers, a safe, and some shelf space. The room also had a chair, a desk with a mirror and an old heater/fireplace of which I was unsure if it was still functional. The bed was a queen bed. There was enough space to be comfortable with our luggage(2 back packs and two hand carry size rollers but not enough for an extra bed. The bed was comfortable including the pillows and comforters. The toilet was a separate closet from the sink and stand-in shower. There was a hair dryer in the bathroom. They had shampoo, conditioner and body wash by the sink, however, they never provided drinking glasses. There was no fridge or minibar. The TV was a flat screen LCD and it looked like a 22 inch. As far as airconditioning, I couldn't tell. There were vents but I couln't find a thermostat. The weather was unusually cool so I am not sure we needed the AC. We had one big window facing out front. Noise level was not an issue even with the construction, but we were always up before 9am. I did not have any experience with using the WiFi, although it is free. My Nook connected to it but I never used it. It is not secured so you don't need a password. The small computer room with one computer was sufficient for my needs. My family in the other room(room 27) had no complaints. Here are the main differences between the classic room and the superior from my observations: -the room was bigger and the space was more than enough to make it comfortable even with the extra bed -there was a thermostat -the room had a bathtub instead of a stand in shower Staff: The staff was very polite. The people in the front desk were all fluent in English. The hotel still uses the old lock and key for the doors which you have to drop at the front desk before you leave. If you want the hotel to call for a shuttle for you to the airport, I think it was 40 euros as a flat fee. You do have to give a 16 euro deposit to the front desk. I never used this but I was in the lobby when someone needed to be picked up early the next morning. Over all everything was good for the price I paid for four nights and two rooms. If came with a large group I would try this hotel again. However, if it was my wife and I, I wouldn't have a problem with spending slightly more for a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “charming little parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryjeanp71
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with my hubby and 2 preteens girsl, in a 2 double bedrooms, its a very clean and very charming rooms, bed and the duvet was comfy and cozy, good airconditioning. The lady owner was very helpful with directions and tips and she is American by the way which comes very handy with our non existing french ,and since its our first Paris visit. Breakfast is what you expect in France croissants are good but the "hot chocolate" were excellent! my girls love them!! The gentleman who serves breakfast was super kind!!!The location is no problem metro is just few steps away and you got to experience the real Paris without tourist all around, just locals, and the metro network is super easy to navigate, even easier than london tubes! few bistros nearby, Monoprix is just 10 min walk, its heaven sent shops coz we got our delish foods and wines after a long day of exploring! Even Mcdonald is just across the road! One minor details was you can hear the metro trains from underground, if you are not a deep sleeper, but over all it was a very pleasant stay.Merci beaucoup Hotel De La Port Doree, a` bientot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: RWPF
Reviews.Content: Top 10 countdown on reasons not to stay at the Porte Doree 10. the metro and train noise is noticeable 9. there is no room for the suitcases unless you want to step on them because the room is too small 8. the bathrooms need renovating, they are old and dated 7. the staff really wasn't as friendly and helpful as other people say in reviews (hello, goodbye, pay your bill, that is all really) 6. the showers are meant for skinny people under 5ft 6 5. superior double rooms and beds aren't any bigger, just a waste of money 4. the wake up calls were never at the right time (5am instead of 8am) 3. the metro can take up to an hour to get you to the city center 2. the water temperature changed depending on what my neighbor was doing (ie flushing the toilet I would get burned) 1. the cleaning staff left our room unlocked everytime after cleaning (just luck our stuff wasn't stolen) Honestly I really can't understand why this is rated highly, and recommended by Frommers. Horrible experience, would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: MSNY10968
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very inexpensive and it has some charm. However, the neighborhood is out of the way and a little gritty (lots of construction going on on the corner - apparently they are putting in a tramway line - a Midas muffler shop up the street, a car repair place right behind the hotel). It is a residential neighborhood that is quite near the "peripherique" (the highway that surrounds Paris). The air quality in the neighborhood is not at all good. Additionally, the hotel is right above a subway line. While the proximity to the subway station is very convenient, you also feel the hotel rumble every few minutes when the trains go by. In many ways, it's pretty bare bones (not even a box of tissues in the room). It is reasonably clean, although I did find there was a slightly musty sweet odor in the room that I didn't care for. On the other hand, the attitude of the people at the desk ranges mostly from indifference to outright rudeness. Additionally, while they bill themselves as a "green" nop-smoking hotel, the desk people smoke right in front of the open door, allowing smoke to go right into the lobby. Probably the best thing you can say about it is that the building has some charm, the prices are low, and there is no smoking in the actual building. On the other hand, the computer is in a tiny room and hard to see/use (although I do believe it had an American keyboard) and in order to print something you have to email it to the front desk. The restaurant list is so outdated that the closest recommended restaurant turns out to have closed several years ago. The advice of the desk people on basic things is not to be relied upon. There is little effort to manifest any hospitality or to assist travelers. The restaurants in the neighborhood are quite mediocre. And it is a bit of a subway ride to get into the center of town. There is very little of interest nearby (other than an aquarium and the Bois and Chateau de Vincennes).

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Location, Noisy and Terrible Service - Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Angela/Stephen
Reviews.Content: There are a few problems with this place. First and foremost, it is located above the metro line. It is VERY noisy as a result. The entire building rattles and it goes on all the time. Imagine sleeping over a roller coaster or having an earthquake every five minutes and you will have the idea. There are cats in the alleys around the building making a great noise also. Our room was not very clean. This location is far from everything. We wanted this area for the Parc Floral, so it was convenient for us. Otherwise, too far from everything. No good restaurants nearby and no good shopping either. Lastly, the woman who owns this place (short blonde hair) is so rude. She does not offer assistance without a rude and rushed tone. She is American and speaks English, so there was no mistaking her repeatedly awful attitude and manner. She should not be in the service industry. There is an Ibis around the corner, if you must stay in this area, I would recommend looking into that hotel. We would never stay here again, even if we wanted this remote area. The main problem here is the noise, the remote location and the terrible attitude of the not helpful owner. For not many more Euros, you can be much more central and have a much better, cleaner, quieter stay. We travel quite a lot and this is one of the worst ever! The owner will no doubt respond to this review with excuses, but I am always honest with my reviews and this is well below expectations for the money.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing special. The hotel is clean and the front desk staff are nice enough. I paid extra for a superior double room. It was a complete waste of money. The bed really didn't seem any bigger than a normal double (advertised as larger) and the room definitely wasn't any bigger (as advertised as larger). We know for sure the room was small as we looked on the fire escape map and it was one of the smallest rooms. Be prepared for stairs if you stay here. There is an extrememly small elevator to put your luggage in to get it to your room. You will always have to use the stairs. Sure it's a good work out, but after you've been touring Paris all day the last thing you really want to do is climb 3 flights of stairs to get to your room. Like I said above the rooms are small, ours especially. There really wasn't any room to have luggage. It had to be closed and standing all the time to move around the room. If it was open and on the floor (since they had no luggage racks) it would take up all the floor space. The room and bedding appeared to be clean. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were not. The bathroom was extremely dated and not well kept. It was clean enough but the flusher on the toilet was cracked. It usually took a couple tries to get the toilet to flush. The shower also leaked. The shower was extremely tight. I barely fit and I'm average height and a slim build. My husband had to duck to get his head under the shower and he's only 6ft. The water pressure was horrible. I have long hair and it would take me 30 minutes just to get the soap out. The water also seems to be connected to other people's rooms. If you heard a flush next door all of a sudden you would have burning hot water on you. If someone else was showering you couldn't get hot water. In our room we had the big beautiful french window. A complete waste though because they are completely blocked by a giant tree. That's not what I call a good view. Transportation into the city center is easy, but not quick. The metro station is right outside of the hotel. If you manage to get every metro perfectly timed it will take 30 minutes to get to the Arch D' Triomphe. Perfectly timed is NEVER the case. On average we found it took 60 minutes to go anywhere. Be prepared to stand and wait at the Porte Doree Station for 20 minutes before you can catch a train. I am also disappointed in this hotel because they are the only hotel on our trip that did not go above and beyond to make our honeymoon special. I did not expect anything prior to leaving but when every other hotel gave us room upgrades and free meals, and bottles of wine to celebrate it sets the bar at a certain level. This hotel isn't willing to go above and beyond to make a special experience for the traveler. The one good thing about this hotel was the food near by. The bakery across the street had wonderful pastries, and the restaurant on the corner called Le Cascades had great food and wonderful service. Overall I would not stay here again. There are better hotels closer to the city center. They might cost a little more, but it's worth it to not have a 60 minute metro ride. If you do chose to book this hotel please don't pay extra for the superior double, it's all a lie and a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PS79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five days in July, as part of a trip that included other european city. This is the second time I stayed here, as my first experience four years ago was very pleasant. I think the location of the hotel is excellent, the fact that it is so close to the metro gives you lots of access without being in the middle of the touristy more expensive areas. The neighborhood is quiet and there are shops around for anything that you might need. I had fond memories of the patisserie across the street and it was just as I remembered it. If only I could find a way to bring back home some of those croissants aux amandes or the pain aux raisins! There's a corner MacDonald's in case you want something fast and cheap, lots of little grocery shops for a light dinner, a tabac, a drugstore and some restaurants. I like Cafe Les Cascades cause they are open late and the food is good but not too expensive, as well as the corner pizza shop. The hotel is nice and clean and the service is good without being too much. They have a computer with internet access on the second floor that you can use and wireless access but my experience was it only worked well in the lobby/reception area. Overall, I was very satisfied with this hotel and I can't wait to visit Paris and this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Booking online can be glitchy but the stay is worth it”
Reviews.Author: periwinkl
Reviews.Content: Massively convoluted exchange caused by a temporary glitch with their online booking system meant it took me nearly a week to amend, update, and renegotiate the terms of my booking! Very frustrating as each email was answered by a different staff who had no idea of the history and just said different things each time. HOWEVER having said that, the hotel itself is excellent. The breakfast is an absolute delight and probably our favourite meal in Paris, particularly when served by a charming Indian gentleman :) Book ahead, the offers are good value and we took advantage of a triple for 100 euros / night including breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaztic
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with standard room of typical size for Paris. It may seem a little far from the centre of things, but it is within the Peripherique and practically on top of a metro station, which makes all the difference. The neighbourhood is quiet but with sufficient shops and cafes to provide for breakfast and incidental requirements, with a beautiful park close by. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommend it to any traveller”
Reviews.Author: saints58
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed in a triple room at the hotel. The room was a good size, the bathroom even better. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean and quiet at night. The price was good value, and the hotel is situated in a good location, right next to Porte Doree metro station, making access into the centre of Paris a breeze. The bakery across the road was great to grab a quick and cheap breakfast, and there were plenty of dinner options down the street, as well as a Monoprix supermarket. Definitely recommended for any traveller!

Reviews.Title: “cozy and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: JustAn0therTraveller
Reviews.Content: the room I stayed in is very spacious and cozy (triple room), feel very comfortable when I get back to the hotel everyday. Rooms are just like display photos on the website. Staffs are helpful. The breakfast is excellent, I have not had better breakfast anywhere else!!! The location is very conveniently. The price is a bargain. The shower is great but it ll be better if it has a blind. Would definitely stay here if I go to Paris again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Beaver2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in May for 4 days in a single room and there's simply nowhere else in Paris where you can pay under 60 euros per night (they have cheaper rates for longer stays, I think) for a single private room with the amenities that it had (private bathroom,aircon, tv, free wifi, even some toiletries, which I did not expect!). In fact, I anticipated a smaller room (from the pics and from other reviews) than the one I actually got, which was very adequate for one person, very clean, and the bed was nice and comfy. I didn't really use the staff a whole lot, but they're always friendly and are happy to help at any time. As for the metro which I remember reading in other reviews prior to my stay, to be honest, I didn't notice it at all. But, I am a heavy sleeper and wasn't in the room except during late night and early morning, so maybe there were less trains then and I just wasn't bothered by the noise. (I was also not on the ground/first floor, so maybe that helped?) As for the elevator, I never used it (and forgotten to take a look at it), so no idea about the size or functionality. The location is a bit further away from the main city area, but Paris is such an easy city to navigate with the metro that it was definitely worth it in exchange for a room that is very clean and a hotel where you don't have to worry about getting ripped off or have things stolen or something.
