I had a great time in Paris and I'll definitely try and book this hotel on my next visit. Oh, but there is one con - and a strange one at that. In my room, near the window, there was this hole (maybe the size of half an A4 size paper, around waist level. I didn't even see it til the end of my visit because it was blocked by the desk and the curtains) in the wall. It didn't affect my visit since I didn't know it was there, and there wasn't any weird smell or wires or gross things in the hole, and it was far away enough from the bed and closet and my things that I'm not too worried about safety issues, but it was very strange to find just this random hole in the wall. Hope they get that covered up soon! But if that creeps you out, I'd suggest one to really check out the room (so if there is a hole, perhaps you could get a different room or something) when you first check in just to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2* accomodation In Paris”
Reviews.Author: peter023
Reviews.Content: Whilst visiting Disneyland Paris we decided on the spur of the moment to extend our stay by a couple of days by visiting Paris. Finding a Hotel in such short notice was quite problematic and all the hotels i knew in Paris were all fully booked. With the aid of a website i knew little about www.parishotels.com i managed to find a few that looked promising, one of which was Hotel de la Porte Doree. Probably a little further out from Paris than i originally wanted but hey after 2hrs of searching i wasn't going to complain too much. Well here is where I made my first mistake, i phoned the hotel and was quoted a price of 150 euro's...which was within my budget, but closer examination would have made me a realise if i had booked on-line then that price would have been 30 euro's cheaper. The on-line site of this hotel has three different prices, so be aware, if you phone or walk in off the street you will be quoted the public price. All in all i got what i wanted so i can't complain, just noted for future reference. The hotel was easy to find literally steps from the metro entrance in a leafy suburb of Paris. The entrance has a few steps and the lift was comical, we have a small stroller buggy which couldn't fit in, we just put our luggage in and ran up the stairs ( see pic's). The room was small but i knew we had booked the last available room so again no complaints. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable, but i had less than 1ft around the bed, if was to stay longer i would have requested another room and for the price i eventually paid, it didn't feel money for value. But for one night it was more than adequate. Another warning.....when i spoke to reception earlier that day the female i spoke to had excellent English, when i arrived the male receptionist had quite poor English which made communication quite slow and difficult, but hey another minor point and did nothing to detract from our stay. As quoted earlier the metro is steps away and you can hear and feel the rumble of the trains beneath you, so light sleepers be warned, me personally i had no issues. Breakfast cost 12euro's and although i didn't partake it looked very nice, we did have coffee and juices delivered to our room which was presented well and i would presume the breakfast was of the same standard. As a travel advisor i get to travel a lot and have stayed in 100's of hotels/guest-houses etc and would definitely recommend this hotel to others as long as you heed the warnings above. When we left i did take the opportunity to look at the other rooms which is how i know we had the smallest room in the hotel, but i was still happy with my stay and would most likely visit again. One last warning, the hotel states that it has free Wi-fi in all rooms, well unfortunately this doesn't seem to be the case. Reception will give you a log on and password and in reception the access is great but as soon as i left reception i lost the signal, room 7 is above reception and i still couldn't get a signal, so again just a minor point, there are seats in reception as well as a desktop so i could still access my emails etc. Hope this is useful for someone !!

Reviews.Title: “stylish and good”
Reviews.Author: EBGB,s
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish, clean hotel and a good stay for sightseeing Paris. Restaurants, cafes are closeby as is a cost saving McDonalds just across the road. The metro too is just a few steps from the front door. Rooms are not too small although storage in ours could have been improved. A safe in your room provides security for valuables. Self service breakfast is more than adequate. Negatives? The lift is the smallest I have ever seen, you need to see reception to turn up the room heating, and the metro rumble can be heard on occasion. A good value friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience varied rooms”
Reviews.Author: kruzink
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this very conveniently located hotel, literally steps from the metro. The elevator is very tiny so taking the stairs is the best option, we requested 1st floor. the 1st night we had a twin room #5 street side, we found this a little cramped for 2. They were very accommodating in moving us directly across the hall in #9 which was much roomier. The rooms are simply but nicely furnished, each is unique & size varies.There are many places close by to eat. Bristo Porte Doree around the corner was pricey yet wonderful. When you look in & see several(well behaved) dogs, you know you've found a authentic French bristo! The bakery across the street is wonderful but closed Sunday, Monday, Tuesday.McDonalds is on the corner and a grocery is a few blocks. The down side of being this close to the metro is you can hear the train underneath the building, not good for light sleepers, although maybe the upper floors would be better.Their internet site offered a better $ than the hotel did when contacted directly. The "day crew" speaks excellent English the night crew is limited. The neighborhood is up & coming but not a place I would walk alone at night. Except for an invasion of ants in our room we were very happy with the value offered.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NattyLondon
Reviews.Content: Your would go far to find a 2* hotel in Paris as good as this one. We arrived early and had no problem checking in - the lady on the desk was american which helped a lot! The hotel itself is about a 20/30 min metro ride from everything you might want to see and is on a great line so you rarely have to change. This meant that we got all the benefits of paris without all the noise! The room was just big enough - unless you have hundred of bags - and the shower was great, very powerful. Other reviews have mentioned the temperature variance, which we did notice but its not too unexpected given the number of other showers in the building! The bed was very comfortable and the room was very tastefully decorated. Breakfast was good and ours was included. Not sure would bother with it if paid for it separately as for 12 euros you could get a better breakfast elsewhere. The only thing i would mention is that ear plugs would be recommended! You can hear the vibrations from the metro underneath but it certainly didnt keep us awake and my partner is a light sleeper. There are a number of restaurants around the hotel but they are not necessarily cheaper than the centre of paris - so dont go back to the hotel thinking it will be cheaper!! On the whole, would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tipgirl
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend this hotel. The rooms are decorated very personally and with good taste, and most of them are spacious. This hotel has all I appreciate: no carpets, excellent beds and white, crispy duvets. You immediately feel at home. There is a bus stop and a subway stop in front of the house, and a nice bakery on the other side of the street. A typical parisian street market takes place every sunday morning. The staff is welcoming and friendly. I definitely prefer this place to the cramped, overpriced downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: CaliMaroc
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, friendly staff. Little pricey but would rather have a nice place for a little extra. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome”
Reviews.Author: JerryH1
Reviews.Content: Franco/American Hotel....as far as price it was really reasonable...Owners are really nice...she is american and he is french...price has now gone up...they remodeled

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for a gorgeous hotel and a great sleep...”
Reviews.Author: BubG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and while it's not located in the centre of Paris it's only a few short metro trips to reach the main tourist destinations. When we arrived were were given the choice of three rooms and all were immaculate. The renovation has been very tastefully done, and with a lot of care. We chose room #19 and couldn't have been happier. The room was huge and our bathroom was nearly new, with a big shower rose and hot, hot water! The bed and doona were soo comfy and in 9 weeks of travel across Europe we had some of our best night's sleep here!! We could open the window for fresh air, and being at the back of the hotel there was no street noise. Yes, you can hear some noise from the metro but this wasn't disturbing at all. There was table and 2 chairs in the room, free ice douwn the corridor and staff were kind enough to lend us a knife and corkscrew when we wanted to dine in. The sitting room at reception was comfortable and welcoming and the 1 euro coffee, free internet and mouthwatering boulangerie across the road make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oui Oui to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Smileeem
Reviews.Content: After having this hotel recommened to us and then seeing all the positive reviews on tripadvisor I had high expectations of this hotel. I am pleased to say, it met them. We decided we wanted to treat ourselves while we were in Paris, so we paid the little bit extra and got the Queen Size Room. This room is on the ground floor, which means you don't have to worry about the tiny lift. We were also quite happy with the size of the room. It was much bigger than we had experienced so far on the trip, and it had lots of cupboard space, and as we were staying for several days, we were able to unpack and hide our bags away, rather than tripping over them all the time. Being on the ground floor though, I was worried about the rumble you could hear from the subway. However it did not keep us up/ or wake us at all. In fact I had the best nights sleep while staying here, compared to places we had stayed in England. This was due to the best feature of the room, eletronic window shutters that totally blocked out the light. Being on the Ground floor, we had french doors that went out to our own private courtyard. This is Room 37, I did not take any photos of this room but I have seen some photos of it on here. The area was also very good. The first night we went to La Gourmandise, right next door to the hotel. Our French was hopeless and they didn't speak much English, but the expereince was good and the food was fantastic. The pizza place next to La Gourmandise was also very good for a quick, light and cheap meal. We stayed at Porte Doree from a Saturday until the Wednesday. Therefore we were unlucky that the Boulangerie across the street was only open on the Sunday and Wednesday morning. We walked down Avenue Daumesnil to the Michel Bizot entrance of the Subway, where there was another Boulangerie. They were also very good. They sold lovely Baguets filled with very yummy sandwich fillings, the brie cheese was the best. We also ventured up to the round about up near the Daumesnil subway entrance. Up there it was a bit busier and more cafes. Here you got a real sense of a Parsian Neighbourhood. We also went to the new Bercy Village. The gardens were beautiful and the shops and cafes there were trendy and nice. This was within 15 min walk from the hotel. The park near the hotel, was also a nice area to walk around. The subway system was very easy. If you missed one, another one would come in 3 or 4 minutes. It didn't take long to get anywhere really. There were several places of interest you could go to with out switching lines and everything else was only one change. The trains and subways have the route map and the line changes, which is very helpful. One night we stayed at the Eifel Tower until quite late, and didn't really think of how to get home. In the end it was very easy, line 6 took us from Eifel (Bir-Hakeim) to Daumesnil, and then we just walked back to the hotel. It did take about 35 min but it was direct and very easy. All in all we had a nice time in Paris and a wonderful stay at Hotel De La Porte Doree. If I ever get back to Paris, I would stay there again. Oooh and before I forget, you have to try Macaroons, especially from Laduree.

Reviews.Title: “Always an enjoyable stay; more than worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mprettypaws
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the hotel since 2004. Having stayed in the center of Paris, I find many advantages being away from the tourist/high crime areas. You are allowed to view and even participate in city life through visiting local cafes, bakeries, and grocery stores. Major complaints seem to be small, noisy rooms. I have stayed in just as small rooms on the rue de Rivioli and experienced traffic noises and the rumble of the Metro. The only difference is that I had to pay alot more and only could afford to stay in Paris 5-7 days instead of 12-14 days.

Reviews.Title: “Driven mad in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: kirmizman
Reviews.Content: On day of leaving reception rang every fifteen from 10 oclock till check out time midday.asking are you leaving yet.Never came across the likes in thirtyfive years of travel.Pity nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: becnbaby4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends who stayed there and due to the number of positive reviews here on TripAdvisor, we booked our stay. The hotel staff was very helpful and spoke English which was great for 2 travelers who's French was terrible. The rooms were very clean, and the beds quite comfortable. The location was great- right near the Metro and a short ride to the center of Paris. The bakery across the street was twice as good as everyone says with very friendly employees. There was a neat little market that set up across from the hotel on Sunday morning. And everything was within walking distance. There was internet available and the hotel itself was very quaint and definitely added to the Parisian experience of our trip. I would highly recommend this hotel. One word of caution- if you have quite a bit of luggage- request a room on the 1st floor as the lift is unbelieveably tiny.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was there again!”
Reviews.Author: katied1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in April 09. I chose to stay after reading reviews on this website and also from the great comminication via email from the manager. Not speaking any french, we never had a probblem with the staff. There is a fantastic supermarket about 5 minutes down the road and an amazing bakery right across the street with the best croissants ever!! We were happy not being in the absolute thick of things and found that the Metro could get us everywhere we needed to go with minimum fuss. There are a couple of stops near by. The rooms are nicley appointed but are small, but that is what you have to expect. Good hot water and very comfortable bed! I am starting to save again so I can get back in a year or so and would certainly look at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel with the comfiest beds we have ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: lynn_ksk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Porte Doree on Sunday evening and were greeted by warm red walls and surroundings. Checking-in was without any hassle. The lift was rather small..just enough to fit 1 person and luggage but that didnt bother both of us. Anything beats hauling 2 sets of luggages up 3 flights of stairs! Our room had twin beds which was clean, fresh smelling and spacious enough to maneuver around. Best of all the comfiest beds with the softest sheets we had ever slept on in a b&b..:) And the room was cleaned and beds made up daily. The toilet was very clean as well complete with a built-in hairdryer and heater rack which we found really useful after our cold morning showers. We had only manage to have breakfast on one morning when we werent rushing out. At 9 euros per head, we found the fresh croissant/ pain au raisins and variety of breads and particularly the slice of butter breadcake delicious and worthwhile. There were also a variety of fresh juices, tea, coffee and hot chocolate that would be served at your request. The buffet cabinet also had fruits, cold cuts, eggs and cereals if you fancied that over the typical Parisian croissant breakfast. The complimentary use of internet in a little room on the ground floor was something we found very useful. The hotel is located about 25mins away from the city but the Metro that is 10 steps away from the entrance made it very convenient. From there on, its a pretty straight forward journey getting into town. And yes - it does get a little loud a nights as the Metro station is directly under the hotel but then again..that didnt bother us. We would definately return to Porte Doree on our next visit to Paris - staying there somehow completed the whole Parisian feel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out so that you dont get robbed by the hotel management”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravler101
Reviews.Content: "O´no the price we gave you is no longer valide, you need to pay 20 % more" - If this is the experience you want to close your stay in Paris with, this can be an ok hotel, but if this is not what you want - chose a different hotel. Despite a confirmed price, the hotel managers/owner wanted to charge me 20% more than was originally agreed when departing. After a serious long, one hour talk, they where pursuaded that "one need to honor ones commitments". For me it was not the money but the share principle not give in to people who are trying to exploit the situation with a family of 3 small children not being amused by waiting on dad. Can you then believe my frustration that the prepaid shuttle to the airport, paid the same morning for 50€, suddenly cost 66€ in the afternoon ( less than 1 hour before the pickup), and that "I just had to complete". Needless to say I paid up given the sudden risk of loosing my flight. In all fairness I should say that the rooms where clean and nice, but the surroundings are dull with very few good restaurants around. Would I recommend this hotel? No I would not.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Hotel de la Porte Doree for one week with my mother in Room 35, a twin bed room. After hours of searching for hotels online I picked this one based on the reviews and photographs of the hotel from reviewers on TripAdvisor. As it was a 2 star I was a little nervous, but when I arrived it was far nicer than I had imagined and not what I thought a two star hotel would look like. And I'm quite picky about hotels! The room was larger than I expected which was great, as most Parisian hotel rooms I had viewed looked no bigger or better than student accommodation, and was spotless and decorated beautifully. The beds were clean and comfy. The bathroom, which had a bath, toilet, sink and two shower heads was also a fine size. There was also a sort of little hall as you walked into the room with a wardrobe and safe, so the room seemed more like a little bedsit. We were on the top floor but you can still hear the faint rumblings of the metro, if you are sensitive to noise this may be an issue for you, but it didn't bother me at all. The only issue I had with the room was with the bathroom hair-dryer, it would stop every now and then while in use but it's usually hit and miss with hotel hair-dryers anyway and it was no big deal. The rest of the hotel is decorated beautifully from reception to the furniture on each floor to the breakfast room. Yes the lift is tiny but I used it frequently as did my mother who was dubious at first. As for the staff, I found them to be very nice and the American lady on reception was particularly helpful. Breakfast was lovely - fresh pastries, eggs, meats, cereals, juice and coffee was on offer every morning, it's €9 but we felt it was worth it for the quality and quantity of food available. The hotel is about 20 minutes by Metro away from the main tourist sites in the city but as we had planned to use the Metro to travel all over the city this wasn't an issue and it was right beside the hotel - I don't like to stay in the heart of the city because it can be quite noisy and you really don't feel the 20 minutes on the Metro! The area the hotel is situated in is lovely, good restaurants and a fantastic bakery right across the street, with a market on Sunday. All in all, we loved this hotel and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Also, it didn't hurt that we got a great deal - it cost us €100 a night for the room and was well worth it. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Paris centre”
Reviews.Author: Ticinese
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel four days with my daughter 16 years old. Usually i have left the hotel at 8 am and i have came back at about 11-12 pm Advantages - near the metro stop Porte Dorée, line 8 Disadvantages - is too far from Paris Centre - at four stage you can hear the metro when passes - lift tight ( lagguage problems) - courtesy versus cients can be improved substantially - if you change reservation, nobody informs you about new prices also if you ask! - I did not get the bill receipt at 5:30 pm as the person at the reception told me the computer was requiring 10 minutes to switch on and when i said this was said by his colleague he answered not to deliber it on a angry way. Conclusion: choose a hotel in arrondissment 1, 2, 3, 4, 9 e 10 Have a nice trip

Reviews.Title: “very nice - but pricey for its location”
Reviews.Author: olympustrip35advizor
Reviews.Content: very nice room - not overly huge, though; good staff - and the narrowest elevator i have ever seen! worth staying at, if only for the amazing vandermeersch boulangerie, across the street!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in Paris - we found an absolutely lovely hotel by venturing slightly further out”
Reviews.Author: adventureEgg
Reviews.Content: It is an adorable little hotel, and a lovely place to crash out after a exhausting day of Paris sightseeing! Although it is situated slightly further out of the centre with the metro stop right outside, getting into the centre couldn't be easier! Although the room was fairly small, it was clean, bed was very comfy, and the decor was very in-keeping with the feel of the hotel. We had a delicious breakfast brought up to us in bed every morning for no extra charge whatever, which was a lifesaver when we were too sleepy to make it downstairs. One piece of advice (in general for all of Paris accomodation) would be to try and book online and find some sort of deal- we found porte doree in a deal that included eurostar travel and 3 nights accomodation so the price was very reasonable. However, their normal rates aren't cheap - like anywhere in the city. I would love to return, and miss Paris already.

Reviews.Title: “The real Paris.”
Reviews.Author: medrumdiva
Reviews.Content: After traveling through Spain and other parts of France landing at this sweet hotel was just what we were looking for. A real flavor of Paris, with a homey feel. Having the metro right outside our door made it easy to explore the city, but still have a quiet place to crash at the end of the night away from the tourist hoards. Christine at the front desk was great when we needed some direction on dining or getting around. Loved the breakfast and homemade jam! Our room was super comfortable, with a true european flair. Don't expect huge rooms anywhere unless your staying at a chain=you could be in Arizona and not know the difference. For us it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but comfortable! Clean, cosy and next to Subway Station”
Reviews.Author: Marcioxes
Reviews.Content: Comparing to another hotels in Paris, the price is good. It's a small hotel, with charming rooms, comfortable beds and good brekfast. Not closeto the sights, but it's possible to get to the mains atractions in 20-30min, just take the metro (subway station infront of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay..... would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: aki86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in a room with a double bed. The room (#6) was on the 2nd floor and was definitely spacious, clean, and comfortable. It was a little noisy due to the fact that i was on the 2nd floor facing the street, but that really didn't bother me at all. Other than that, there's nothing I can say that is negative about this place. The staff is friendly and helpful...all spoke english. They offered breakfast for 10 euros, but i ended up going across the street to the bakery there...or a few that were within 5 mins walking distance. The hotel is literally right off the metro entrance, hence super convenient. (Although at night, there were usually cops standing around.....but i never encountered or saw any trouble in the neighborhood). It's around a 10 min train ride from the city centre. So after hearing all the horror stories about how dirty and small euro hotels are, this place was definitely perfect. I would definitely stay here again. PS: The convenience store around the corner sells stamps for those ppl who like sending postcards like me :)

Reviews.Title: “nice, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: eg1978
Reviews.Content: my wife and I ended up getting a triple room (1 double+1 twin bed) and the extra space was well worth it. the hotel is located on the outskirts of paris in the 12th arrondissement, which is a quiet residental area. It has everything you need -- cafes,brasseries,bakeries,supermarket... even a McDonalds! the good: great staff, wonderful breakfast, free WiFi, good value. it is a 1 minute walk to the Porte Doree stop on the #8 Metro line. it takes about 15 minutes and 1 transfer to get to the museums and other things in the center of town. the paris metro is great so no worries there. the bad: you can hear (feel) the metro. me and my wife are from New York City so no problems for us. Plus, the metro stops running at 1am, and we usually were out that late anyway, so it never disturbed us. the street in front of the hotel was sometimes noisy though.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: katy2tul
Reviews.Content: We were told about this hotel from friends of ours that stayed there about 6 years ago. We were not dissappointed! It was a lovely quiet little hotel with friendly staff (that can all speak good english). Its very close to the metro station which means you can get to everywhere you need to. We got the RER and metro all the way fron charles de gaulle airport and it took about 45 mins and cost us 18 euros for the 2 of us. The hotel was clean and tidy and our room was small but perfect. You can hear and feel the metro but it does not disturb you (and im a light sleeper) in fact i got used to it. The location has its positives and negatives, it was great that it was a proper french little town and was quiet at night, however we found that we had to eat out in whichever area we were sightseeing in then travel back at no later that 9pm (we were wary of using the met later than this and we often had to use 3 lines to get back) Once we got home we were just reading in our rooms. Theres not many nice eating places around (except the pizza place down the road that was lovely!) If i could lift the hotel and put it in the latin quarter where theres lots of eating and drinking places it would be ideal. Our flight home wasnt until 9.15 and you have to check out at 12 but the hotel staff were brilliant they looked after our bags for us which allowed us to enjoy our last day. We then used the breakfast room to sit and have a drink before we left. The hotel book in the room was really helpful and is in english and french. All in all we had a fantastic time and to be honest by the time we got back at 9 i was ready to lie in bed and relax as my feet were killing!!!! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone going to paris. Oh also wifi throughout so ideal if you want to take your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaReviewr
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels that we stayed in during our entire two week trip through France. The rooms were immaculate and very charming with a fireplace, wood floors, and windows that opened over the street below. The beds were really comfortable and the flat screen TV had an excellent assortment of channels. Either the shower in our room didn't work or we couldn't figure out how to use it, but that was OK because we enjoyed taking baths every day in the giant bathtub in our room. There is a computer in the basement that guests can use to check email. Its painfully slow, but its free! It is super close to the metro stop, which is nice after a long day of sightseeing. Our room was a single (two twin beds) on the fourth floor. The elevator is TINY, but very cute. Despite the somewhat heavy traffic on the streets nearby, the room was relatively quiet. Breakfast was delicious and very convenient. (Hint: take a piece of fruit with you. It will be greatly appreciated if you get stuck in line at a museum.) This hotel is on the outskirts of the city, but I actually found this to be an advantage. The neighborhood is quiet, giving you a sense of what Paris is really like for residents, and the park down the street is incredibly beautiful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat. The price is unbeatable and the staff are some of the most friendly, helpful people I've ever met. If you are staying in Paris, definitely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for excellent value”
Reviews.Author: m45
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after searching through TripAdvisor and we were really pleasantly surprised upon arrival. After reading other reviews expectations were not very high and especially considering the price we paid; 278e for 3 nights. We contacted the hotel to get metro directions etc. and received very prompt and helpful replies. The staff were also very helpful when we arrived, recommending nearby shops and booking a taxi for us when required. The metro stop is literally outside the door, which was perfect as we were absolutely shattered from dragging our bags around the underground maze!!! Our room was beautifully decorated and quite adequate in size for myself and my partner. Beds were very comfortable and the bath was a welcome addition. One thing to note, is that due to promixity to the metro station, some vibrations could be felt in our room on the third floor. Although I was aware of this, it did not impede my sleeping in any way. The area the hotel is in is not for those looking for a lively neighbourhood, but suited us perfectly as it was very safe and absolutely everything is accesible by Metro. Would definetly recommend this hotel for couples looking for a nice hotel to relax in after a day of sight-seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed & charming with quite style”
Reviews.Author: AaronMarsSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the recommendations of friends. My room was beautifully decorated but low key, which helped me feel right at home. I was visiting with a large group of friends (one of which is a chef), and food is a big part of our traveling experience. All of the restaurant’s that Christina & Laurent recommended were amazing. I especially liked the homemade jam the hotel provided with breakfast each morning. My only regret was finding out the boulangerie I had heard so much about was closed for summer vacation -- an excuse to visit again. I recommend the hotel to all my friends visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “owners helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kellyjamesrobert
Reviews.Content: I never got to stay at this hotel as a wedding I was meant to attend was cancelled. I had booked the hotel though and when I went to cancel the booking through a third party there was a problem with the cancellation. I contacted the owners Laurent and Christina and they were very friendly and sorted out the refund by contacting the booking agency. If this is the way they deal with a non customer I'm sure your stay as a customer will be very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: illian420
Reviews.Content: After looking up many many Paris hotels on tripadvisor, I chose this one. The price was right and even though it's farther away from the main touristy things it was the best choice. It's a short walk to the metro station so the distance isn't too bad. We opted for the larger queen size room for comfort since Paris hotels are supposed to be TINY! Well the room wasn't huge but it was enough that we didn't feel like we were in a tiny room. The bathroom's small, but much more roomy than I expected and very clean. We had a shower with an adjustable shower knozzle for those taller people. We were pleased with the room and having in-room internet access for our laptop. I will say I was at first disappointed to see we were on the first floor. I'd read reviews about the noise. We were a little annoyed to be on the first floor and you can hear the metro and some random water noise running through pipes, but it wasn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be after reading the complaints. We were going to give it a night and see if we wanted another room but it wasn't bad at all. We weren't woken by it either so it did not affect our honeymoon. We didn't try the breakfast because we were trying to save money. The Boulangerie across the street was EXCELLENT though. It's got great bread and pastries and is packed on the weekends. Be sure to look in the little hotel booklet. It gives nearby recommendations for restaurants and tourist things to do. The italian place to the right of the boulangerie was also excellent. The Bistro de la Porte Doree was good too, but not cheap. And by all means, avoid the McDonald's nearby... there're other ways to eat cheap. Do it the way many french people all do, eat bread or a sandwich on the go for lunch and eat a nice dinner. I loved the excuse to eat pain au chocolat (bread with chocolate inside) for many many breakfast and lunches. You can look at the menu and prices before going into almost all restaurants in Paris to see if it's affordable. Overall the place was great, the people were nice, the room was clean, and the first floor noise wasn't a problem like I thought it might be. I would definitely stay here again and will definitely have to revisit that Boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: miajean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights and loved it. We were able to check in early in the morning. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. (We had a room with a bathtub rather than a shower stall.) The breakfast every morning is simple, but good. The coffee is great. The folks at the desk are all very helpful, especially the lady from America, who was always cheerful and had some great recommendations for places to eat. This hotel is NOT in a touristy area. It is certainly a residential area, and you get a better picture of what life in Paris is like. This means that the restaurants are on Paris time, and everyone you run into does not always speak English fluently. We loved the whole trip and this hotel helped us stay well -rested!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay when exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: pc-utd
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel, very clean, friendly and easy to get around Paris with the metro just outside the front door. Obviously its doesn't have mini bar and other extras like three star plus hotel but who needs a mini bar when you can enjoy all the atmosphere from the nearby cafe and bars. There is a very useful guide book in the room explaining about the local area, which we found all information very accurate. We had a lovely meal at the little Italian accross the street. -We would have liked a kettle in the room for our morning cuppa, but thanks to other reviews we took our own with us.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to say, overall a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: little_ozzie_one
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel directly based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. I was really looking forward to staying here, but must say I was disappointed overall. Our double room was on the first floor. The room, although small, was clean and neat with a flat screen tv on the wall and a safe hidden in the old fireplace. No minibar facilities at all, and a kettle would have been nice. The bathroom however, was absolutely tiny. Separate toilet was fine, but the shower and sink in the other part of the bathroom was so small - shower was difficult to manouver under (and i'm only small!) and was quite awkward. The showerhead was not very strong and the hot water was hit and miss also - frustrating after being out all day in the middle of winter. The sink had a medicine cabinet above it, but the handle was broken off, so you couldnt access it easily. The biggest issue with this hotel was noise. We kept the window shut, and really didn't notice the street noise, but the metro below the hotel was very obvious. It was a deep rumbling noise, every 15 mins or so until 1am. On top of that, we heard every noise coming from people going up the stairs, as well as noise from adjoining rooms (conversations, flushing toilets, showers etc). We could also clearly hear footsteps above us, and would jump everytime the people in the room above us dropped something on their floor. Worst of all we were above the breakfast room, so we could hear all of that noise as well. No chance to sleep in! Also, despite this being a non-smoking hotel, we could smell cigarette smoke coming through the ventilation. They told us to report anyone smoking, but we couldn't work out where it was coming from. We didn't have any problems with the staff - they were more than helpful, and the American lady working during the day was great with sightseeing tips. We did ask for a bottle opener one night, but the hotel didn't have one for us to use(!) so our wine travelled home with us. A computer with free internet access was located just off reception - this was greatly appreciated. We didn't eat out much in the local area, but we did try the great italian pizza place down the street - across the road from MacDonalds. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was adequate for a continental buffet. Whilst this hotel was clean and neat, I would not be keen to stay here again based on my experience. Not a cheap hotel by any means and the negatives really did outweigh the positives overall.

Reviews.Title: “Water damage and an unpainted wall . . . avoid Room 26”
Reviews.Author: GlobeGalloperNYC
Reviews.Content: Weeks before I arrived to spend a special night of celebration at the hotel, I requested the best room available. I was told that I would be put in a great room. Not only was my room just so-so, but there was a GIGANTIC part of the wall that was UNPAINTED! It even had water damage. When I mentioned this twice at the hotel front desk, all I was offered was a lame excuse about how the damage had happened over the weekend, and that there wasn't time to inform me. That's laughable! It was the most aesthetically unpleasing environment I've ever stayed in during my time in Paris. Yes, the price is decent at this hotel, but the service, in this case, was inferior. If you have a choice (and you always do in hotel-packed Paris), choose otherwise. And if you must stay at this hotel, avoid ROOM 26! PS. As other reviewers have noted, the elevator is impossibly small. Don't bring a lot of luggage if you expect to use that elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, good value hotel with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: shortyrock23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends in a triple room. Great design, comfy beds in a good sized room and very large bathroom. The hotel was very clean and the staff was more than willing to help out with any questions and went above and beyond for some of our questions/requests. Breakfast was very good and plentiful. Location wise...out of the center, but a few minutes walk from the metro and a few more to the major sights. Also close to several good restaurants and patisseries and a park. The hotel also seemed to be "green" with recycling and sensored lights in all the common areas. Great, efficient internet connection in a small room on their pc for free. Would definitely stay here again!! Check out the website and blog. www.hoteldelaportedoree.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Cute little Hotel - Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: gauravcal
Reviews.Content: I found this fabulous hotel through Trip Advisor - having read some nice reviews. My wife and I were delighted with our one night stay - good location, metro station at the doorstep and good restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel sells double rooms at € 90 per night - and superior Rooms at € 98 / night (recommended - since the bed is larger). Toilets are clean and the housekeeping is efficient as well as excellent. The reception is very well staffed and helpful with info on Paris and speak pasable to good English. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a memorable and great value for money stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Sara037
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. First of all, the area is great, set aside from the main sights but hardly noticed getting the train. The Port Doree metro is closed until December but it’s only a few minutes walk to the next metro. There are loads of patisseries nearby and a lovely park with a boating lake, with lovely autumn colours when we were there. The room that we had (26) had a very comfy bed and flat screen TV, although now completely sick of watching CNN. The room was very clean with a lovely bathroom. Only a couple of down points really. The cleaners didn’t clean everything i.e. the glasses were left unwashed and the ice bucket was left on the bathroom floor. Also, the floorboards are lovely to look at but it meant a lot of noise came through the ceiling. The family above us were checking out and packing up, but this took hours of banging about and generally being really noisy. Really fancied a sleep on the last morning! However, there was someone there laying a stair carpet when we left so maybe this will help. If you do stay here make sure you have dinner at the nearby Cascades restaurant, the best value we found in Paris, great croque madams and amusingly cheeky waiters. If we are ever back in Paris we will be staying at this hotel again for the friendliness, the area and the price.

Reviews.Title: “absolutly loved it”
Reviews.Author: ipaint33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost 3 weeks and it felt like the lap of luxury. All of the hotels rooms are beautiful and have a wonderful romantic decor. Each room had a very nice flat screen tv and plenty of interesting television to watch. The shower had an amazing rain shower head with really good water pressure. The rooms were very clean everyday. The owners and staff arep delightful, friendly, and very helpful. I was more than pleased with the hotel and highly recommend anyone who is visiting paris to stay there. Its close to every thing, and public transportation is a step out the door. Excellent food all around the area also.

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: perthstevePerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, tue-thurs, booked months in advance and requested room 37 as advised by others here,we got the room as requested nicely furnished/decorated and overlooking the ave Daumesnil,nice bathrooom and seperate toilet,we never met any rude staff or heard noisy neighbours the reception staff were always polite and helpful and let us leave our luggage in the dining room for a few hours after we had checked out,we didn't have breakfast at the hotel but thought it was a little expensive at 10 euros we prefered to buy something from the bakery opposite the hotel then call at McDonalds for a coffee and tea then eat at the park overlooking the boating lake(we were lucky with the weather) for approx half the cost, we ate at the Italian restaurant a few doors down from the hotel which was good value and we recieved a free cocktail because we were staying at the hotel,the price of the room was 98 euro per night which was fine but the only downside was that the hotel was in the middle of renovations and there was often a smell of paint and the lift was not operating some times which was a nuisance after a long trek around the sites of Paris and when we were checking out having to carry our suitcases down the stairs but other than that I would recommend the hotel,We liked the area as it was less touristy than many and easy to access central Paris in fact on our first day we walked the promenade plantee to the Bastille and along the Seine to Notre Dame then on to the Louvre and after having a picnic lunch at Jardine Des Tulares we treked up the Champs Elysees and up to the top of the Arc De Triumph then on to the Trocadero and finally walked to the first level of the Eiffel Tower(my wife declined to walk the second,some people are so soft :)) so we went back to the Trcadero for the metro back to the hotel,the metro outside the hotel is closed for building work at present but the stationMichel Bizot is close enough, we are in our 50's and the trip was pleasant enough,had a great time and would stay there again no probs.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cosmopolitan_Lorelai
Reviews.Content: My family and I shared a triple room at Hotel de la Porte Dorée during our week in Paris and we all returned with very positive impressions of our choice of accommodation. I had initially booked the hotel based on good reviews on Tripadvisor and the fact that there is a Metro station right on the front door. A couple of days before we left, while checking the RATP (integrated transport authority for Paris) site, I found out that the Porte Dorée station is closed for renovations. I now know I shouldn't have worried, as the Michel Bizot station, just before Porte Dorée, is only a 10 minutes walk from the hotel and takes you right by 2 boulangeries with mouth watering offers. The location of the hotel, in the 12th arrondisment might not seem ideal for sightseeing purposes, yet this is one of the aspects I enjoyed most about the hotel. Staying there you will not be in walking distance of the Louvre or the Tour Eiffel, but you will be 20 minutes away by metro and, best of all, you will experience a "real" Parisian neighbourhood. This being a residential neighbourhood, everything a traveler might need will be readily available : 3 great boulangeries, restaurants, a Monoprix supermarket, a launderette and even a 'Fleuroteque' (a florist, but isn't that a cute commercial name). Our room was very nice, spotlessly clean, with extra-confy beds and lovely furnishings. Although the hotel was undergoing renovations when we were there, this did not affect the room in any way. The only thing I would've appreciated in the room but there wasn't one is a mini-fridge for keeping drinks cool. Not a big deal, though. Overall and for the price it is impossible to fault this hotel. From the accommodating staff to the lovely, cosy decor, everything gave us a great parisian experience and we are really looking forward to going back, both to Paris and to the Hotel de la Porte Dorée.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Holidays3
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from this hotel and I'd definitely recommend it! It's not in the main city but only about twenty minutes away on the metro which is pretty easy to use! And also close enough to the airport if you want a cheaper taxi! I stayed in a standard double room which was a grand size and had a double bed, wardrobe with full length mirrors, flat screen tv, a desk, chair and a nice little bathroom! The hotel is under rennovation but the only place where this is obvious is the halls and stairway! They have a computer with internet which is free to use so it's pretty handy. The receptionists are nice and helpful! If you're going to disney from here it's pretty simple, mail me if you want details!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jjg004
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room at this nice little place for 3 nights in August. The property was very clean, staff were friendly and always willing to help out. The metro stop is just outside the door and there is a Monoprix supermarket just up the road. I ate breakfast and lunch from the supermarket as eating out can get expensive. The metro line the hotel is on is not a direct train ride to any of the major attractions, but one or two line changes will get you most places. Don't be put off by this because the metro is really easy to use (if you can handle up and down a few steps). The room had two single beds, closet, A/C, TV, separate toilet, shower over small bath. It was very clean, the bed was really comfortable. My room overlooked the main road and double glazed windows meant street noise was not a problem. The only thing that disappointed me about my stay and the only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because the hotel was undergoing renovations which I was not advised of at time of booking. The smell of paint and the dust from the sanding was bothersome at times. If you are thinking of booking this place, check the renos are finished and if so go for it. It really is a great little hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: oregoncynthia
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Porte Doree. As a middle aged woman traveling alone, I found the hotel to be a bit off-putting. First of all, the room numbers have no relation to the floors. I was on the 1st floor in room 46, while my friend, who met me in Paris, was on the 2nd floor in room 11. It made it confusing. Plus, they were doing construction while I was there and that gave the place an unfinished feeling. When we returned one evening from a late meal, I found the motion sensor lights on the stairs to be a bit scary. Sometimes it was several seconds before they came on and walking in a darkened stairwell in a strange hotel was uncomfortable. Any hotel room for a single person always seems to be something converted from a closet, which unfortunately seems to be the norm everywhere. The window in my room looked out on to a brick wall. The room itself was very tiny, but clean. The bathroom was a nice size and spotless. I highly recommend upgrading to a double. We saw inside one of the double rooms, and they look just like the pictures on the website. The staff was very nice and helpful. The location is good and the neighborhood felt safe. Another issue for me was that as a vegetarian I found the neighborhood to definitely be lacking in meal options. The French bistro mentioned earlier (which was very nice) where we had dinner one evening had nothing on the menu I could eat, with the exception of a starter that consisted of a nice selection of cheese and some bread. But the Metro station was close, and we had an easy time getting around Paris from there. The French people were of course, wonderful and were very helpful when we needed help. I think I would consider staying at the Porte Doree again only if I upgraded the room, and all the construction was finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: irelandsown88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid August. The room was great-good comfortable beds, separate bath and toilet, tv and phone etc. Though the hotel was being repainted and plastered when we were there the rooms were always spotless. Staff were extremely friendly and always helpful. There's a fabulous traditional French restaurant around the corner....Bistro something....that did a huge set menu for €39 including a bottle of wine. Well worth the money!! The hotel was difficult to get to from the airport if you're not familiar with the layout of the metro but after a couple of trips in and out of town it was grand. Lots of bakeries and a handy supermarket nearby. Breakfast is best eaten from these rather than the hotel itself. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with children”
Reviews.Author: mlcutler
Reviews.Content: We as a family of five had a wonderful vacation in Paris! The Hotel de la Porte Doree was so welcoming and helpful! Traveling with three small children is hard work and at the end of the day our nights rest was so wonderful. The beds are really comfortable... no bugs on them. The rooms were wonderfully appointed and had flat screen televisions. In the bathroom we enjoyed the luxury of very big medicine cabinets to unpack into. Our room had a his and hers closet. We woke to the sounds of the city with our terrace doors open. And chose to eat breakfast on the terraces because it was such fine private outdoor space. The gentleman that served our breakfast was so great, in addition to our rooms he was serving other guests of the hotel in the breakfast room, which was so gorgeous. The food was of course a typical delicious french fare and the coffee was so nice to wake up to. The front door staff was great. The mornings we had plenty of help making the right decision on what to do with the family for the day. Less than obvious pointers were made to us to make for smooth sight seeing days. Along with thoughtful recommendations we followed up on and were very please weather is was a specialty shop or the right area to exchange money. They really made a huge effort to supply us with the right maps for the day. The night men were always there and seemed to be alert the night through, I really appreciated a locked door after 2am for a sense of security. Although the neighborhood is so dreamy. The house keeping was really great and very helpful. The rooms had full attention everyday and the linens towels were a very nice quality. The location for us was great. Very close to the hotel is the Bois des Vincennes. A huge park. The flowers were amazing there. And if you like bonsai trees it was a real treat. Our children love the playground there, they even had a zip line. The food in the neighborhood was delicious. After a long day of seeing the sights dinners in the area were ideal and there are many restaurants to chose from. We loved the sushi restaurant and the pizza place next to a small playground. As for cuisine in the area there are so many, and the lunch place across the street was a place every Parisian is on the look out for. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Porte Doree is nice...”
Reviews.Author: 34Sparky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de la Porte Doree in late June... and yes, the elevator is quite small. No problem, one of us took the elevator and the bags and one of us took the stairs. We booked a double. Small, but nice. The Metro stop is on the corner. The Metro rumbles a bit, but not enough to keep us awake. We found the staff to be helpful, they always answered our questions, and were never rude. There are actually 2 bakeries in the neighborhood. We also found a lovely Italian restaurant a couple blocks away (forgot the name). There is also a Monoprix just down the street. Handy for a Coca Cola Light fix. All in all, we were happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian flavour”
Reviews.Author: bluejaysgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overall very lovely, with a few minor flaws. First off, the location is great, and though not in central Paris, is easily accessible with a metro station 30 seconds from the door. The neighborhood is nice, with a McDonalds and a lovely bakery across from it and very safe. The rooms, though not very large, are cute and nicely decorated. The toilet and shower are separate, but that wasn't a big deal to us. Blankets all seemed clean, bed was comfortable. The toilet room, however, smelled a bit like mold. The shower didn't really have a curtain, either, just a glass door covering half the shower, thus a lot of water would come out. Most of the staff was friendly enough, though the night person did not seem that friendly and rather annoyed at any questions or requests. There was a baby crib in our room for some reason and it turned out that it was supposed to be for the room next to ours, but when I phoned down to ask very politely why it was here and if they could take it away, he was rude and abrupt and got annoyed with me like I had done something wrong, telling me to speak to the manager even though I had no idea who the manager was or where he/she was. In the end, we resolved the issue ourselves when we found the family next door outside their room waiting for a crib and moved it to their room. The lift is really small, like you have to see it to believe it, so we took the stairs most of the time, and it didn't even work when we actually needed it. Another really big peeve I had was the amount of noise your could hear through the door, waking me up early every morning. Whenever someone made any noise in the hallway, you could hear it very clearly. I left my room with the TV on to go get some ice and could hear it clearly from the hallway even though the volume wasn't on that loudly. The train passing by was also quite disturbing, with noises and vibrations being sent to our room. Overall, if you are looking for Parisian charm with good value, I would recommend this hotel, and I gave it four stars because of its location and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ladavis131
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in beginning of June and cannot say enough good things about this place. Some aspects reviewed in the previous bad rating we will compare. We booked a lower fare through the hotel's website and chose a refinished room. The hotel is clean. Our room was sparkling clean. Indeed, there is not much room for suitcases or running around but this is Europe, People! We were able to put one large suitcase down and could walk around it. The floors were clean and so was the bed. It was extremely comfortable to an extent that we had difficulty getting out of it in the morning. The bathroom was cleaned every day. Upon our arrival we noticed that the shower door was unhinged; it was fixed promptly. Yes, the shower was small, good enough for us but maybe not for a plus-sized person. The air-conditioning worked very well. We did hear the metro every once in a while but by no means was this bad and the street (a relatively major road) did not seem noisy from our first floor room. Even when we left the window open, we could easily sleep through the minimal noise. We didn't watch much TV cause we were in PARIS and didn't come to watch TV in our hotel but spent most of our time out and about (the content of european TV is more liberal than the US: gun fights and murder shows are found to be more offensive than a naked breast). The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. Sometimes the fren-glish can be misinterpreted as harsh but it is not by any means. Everyone on staff at least attempted to speak English and they were polite and helpful. The location of this hotel is absolutely ideal: there are three Boulangerie's (bread and pastry shop) with absolutely delicious warm breads to feast in the morning. There is a great authentic french restaurant around the corner which shares the hotel's name and probably has the best meal we had in our three week vacation. One can also find many other restaurants in the neighborhood. The metro stop is 50 feet from the hotel main entrance and unlike the previous reviewer's experience, we were able to reach Paris center within 15-20 mins. We came back before 1am and never felt any transportation problems. When we did arrive later in the night, the staff opened the door for us and were not rude about it. There is a public computer in a separate room with internet access which didn't always work but it was good enough for us. We definitely would return to this hotel. If you chose this hotel, you clearly are making a choice not to pay 300+ Euro's to be able to stay in the heart of Paris. The distance from the city center is easily compensated by the cleanliness, comfort, the proximity to metro and local scene. This was quiet, quaint and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty mediocre, bad location, bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Virgil1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree with my brother for 6 nights in June 2008. We didn't want to spend a ton of money, and based on the reviews here, this hotel seemed like a decent choice. Sadly, this was not the case. First of all, while the room was of a reasonable size, there was practically no place to put anything, like luggage, toiletries, etc. There was a small table/writing desk which didn't really serve much purpose, a small closet with a few hangers, and two very small ledges next to the beds, with basically enough room for a glass of water. For people with a good amount of luggage, this was a problem, and led to our floor being very cluttered. The bathroom was separate from the toilet (not a problem) and it was very, very small, with no ventilation, so after a shower it was dripping with condensation. The light in the bathroom kept going on and off. The bathtub was exceptionally bad; the floor wasn't flat at any point, and given how cramped it was, one could easily fall while trying to maneuver in the tiny space. The room had an air conditioning control, but it didn't seem to do anything, and the room would get swelteringly hot. The street outside is quite loud, if you intend to leave the window open. In addition, one definitely hears the Metro. We were on the top floor, and it sounded like not-so-distant thunder. Also, beware of the TV stations at night! I am not a prude by any means, but while flipping through channels one night I saw some things which are bound to make the most calloused person blush. These are relatively minor points considering that this is a two star hotel and they don't advertise that they have air conditioning, but other problems are more troubling. The room did not seem to be all that clean, and it had a bit of a musty odor. Worst of all, we both got several bedbug bites. Looking through other reviews since we've been back, I notice that this has been mentioned in another review, so this is obviously an ongoing problem. Based on this alone I would not stay at this hotel again, because as far as I know all you need to do to get rid of bedbugs is to wash the bed linens in hot water. The location of the hotel is really quite bad. The area seems okay as far safety, but if you are there as a tourist, there is practically nothing of interest anywhere close, and it's really, really far to get to all the places you'd like to be while in Paris. You can go to the RATP website and calculate Metro times to various neighborhoods. In our experience, with connections (you always need to make at least one) it took about 30-40 minutes by Metro to get to the center of Paris (Hotel de Ville, Place de la Concorde, for example). Forget about walking. I tried it twice and couldn't make it (and I consider my self in pretty good shape). The Metro stops running at 1 am, so if you're out late (as many people are and should be in Paris) you'll absolutely need to find a cab, which isn't always easy on a weekend. I should also mention that if you get back late at night, you need to ring to have a member of the night staff open the door for you, which was a big turn off for me. The man who would let us in always acted like we had woken him up and he was doing a favor. I didn't want to wake him up any more than he wanted me too, but it's his hotel that feels the need to lock its front door. Other European hotels that lock their door in this fashion usually enable their guest keys to open the front door, and one doesn't feel that he's putting the staff out by coming home late. Also, apart from the woman who seemed to be the owner, the whole staff seemed rather rude, especially at night. I believe that this is an ongoing problem, based on other reviews. All in all, the hotel is relatively cheap, but not cheap enough to justify what you get (especially bedbug bites!). I'd rate it as a pretty mediocre 2-star hotel. What you save on your room, you probably end up sacrificing in cab/metro fare, and in the overall enjoyment of your trip. I would bet you could find a better value for 100 euro a night, which is what we paid. Paris is a lovely city, but it isn't cheap, and you get what you pay for. If you are lucky enough to take a trip there, spend a little extra and find a place with a better location. You're in Paris after all, you might as well do things right.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for two weeks and loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindySacramento
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 weeks and we have no complaints, and we are both very picky. We did not want to leave. This is our second time to stay here. We love Hotel de la Porte Doree. Our room had two beds and there was still plenty of room. The beds have high quality linens. Our bathroom had a bathtub, and we were very happy after a long day on our feet walking all over Paris to take a hot bath. The hotel is a green hotel which is important to us that they are helping the earth. The front desk answered all our questions and were more than helpful. It was great to have computer access for free. We had breakfast at the hotel several mornings and we loved the choices of fruit and juice and crossiants and hard boiled eggs and cheese and bread with Christina's homemade jams. We wish our coffee in America tasted this good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is very nice, clean and conveniently located on Av. Daumesnil, just in front of "Porte Doree" metro station (line 8). The journey to the city centre takes about 20 minutes. Our room was located on the second floor. The room was not big, but had all the necessary, perfectly clean and bright. Good beds and great big duvet. Bathroom was small, clean and adequate. No fancy shower gels but shampoo and soap available. Hotel is right on top of the metro and in the evening you can sometimes hear the metro pass below. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but you have plenty of choice around: there is a typical boulangerie just across the street. For fast food lovers McDonalds is also there, close to the boulangerie. Regarding the elevator, that a lot of people was writing about, it was really amazing: the smallest elevator we have ever seen. We did not have the necessity to use it and we have took it only for curiosity. The only negative point is the noise: you can hear the metro and the Daumesnil avenue is quite busy in the morning and an night. If you proceed from a quiet location and are used to quiet street, bring earplugs. We would stay in this hotel again when in Paris as we loved the neighbourhood, it was close to the metro, and had great value (the noise on our opinion is the only negative point).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: MSoft
Reviews.Content: The night person was so rude when we tried to book this hotel that should have given us a clue. "Call back later" he fumed after chastizing us for not giving him the dates all at once (we had two separate bookings). Response time was slow and they kept jerking us around. Yes, we have space at this price, we replied "ok book it" then the next email says "no it's full" and only the most expensive room is available (hard to believe that could be the case for two separate sets of dates falling on different weeks). The manager, Christine, has rec'd enough warning about her night staff on this website and has failed to rectify the situtation. Unprofessional in my opinion and it caused us a great deal of stress. If you want to play games, then this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wikiwoo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean and tidy with a great Parisian feel. The hotel and rooms are well decorated. Plus Points: * Good value for money. * The staff were helpful, mainly as they spoke English! * Although the Hotel is not in the centre of Paris, it is just a quick metro ride away from all the tourist spots (inc Disneyland) * The area around the Hotel is nice, one of the first things we did was a walk around the park near-by. * The Hotel was very accommodating to requests given when booking, via Hotel website. * Good checking times, we arrived late evening, and check-out time was not till 12. *The lift was an experience, but serves its purpose! Negative Points: * I would have liked tea and coffee making facilities in the room. * Our en-suite had a shower over the bath, but you had to hold the shower head as it had no wall fixing. * Yes you can hear the Metro, however we think this would only effect you if you were a very light sleeper (although, by request, we were on the top floor) Overall a great little Hotel (well 46 rooms!), thats good value for money and great to us as a base for a sight-seeing trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieR1
Reviews.Content: Preparing to visit Paris I was really worried about accommodation simply because most decent budget hotels also have very poor reviews however I need not have been anxious about this Hotel. My husband and I stayed in Room 38 which overlooks Ave. Daumesnil. We purchased a Paris Visite bus & metro 3 day ticket which saved us not just money but lots of time and allowed us to use bus and metro when ever and where ever. After arriving at the Eurostar terminal (Gare du Nord) we travelled to the Hotel by bus no 46 which dropped us off right outside the Hotel. The Hotel is lovely. Lovely soft furnishings, fresh flowers, clean and welcoming entrance. Our room was a superior double. Large bed (very clean), two windows overlooking the street, We had great views of the rooftops. There is a also a double built in wardrobe plus a little bureau with chairs. Beautiful curtains and decor was lovely. The bathroom was an adequate size. On my first night I had a great bath with lots of warm water available. Shower is not a power shower but it is fine. Again, very clean and modern. The litle lift is amazing - we even took a photograph. Each floor is welcoming - again the whole Hotel appeared clean and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. We did have breakfast each morning as we did not want the hassle of trying to find an alternative. Breakfast was lovely. The breakfast room is very pretty and each table was lit with candles which is a lovely thoughtful touch. The croissants were delicious and as other reviews have mentioned there is plenty to choose from including Fairtrade juices and home made jam. We used the metro to get to and fro the centre of Paris but did not find this to be a problem at all - just give yourself time to plan your day ahead. In the tourist books I purchased prior to our trip the 12th District (where the Hotel is situated) is described as 'Undiscovered Paris' and so we used our last day to try and discover it! We took a stroll along the Promenade Plantee and visited the Viaduct Des Arts. We then visited Le Marais area which is great and then returned to the immediate area of the Hotel to spend some time in the local park -the Bois de Vincennes which is really pretty. We also had lunch at the restaurant next door to the Hotel ~ The Villa Romana which was delicious and inexpensive. We had no problem at all with street noise - in fact we liked it. I enjoy waking up to the sights and sounds of everyday life. I would definately recommend this Hotel and would stay again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Charming, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ArieSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen sized room with en suite bathroom at the Hotel de la Porte Doree for four nights in March 2008 as part of our honeymoon. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff were friendly, all spoke English, the common areas were very well kept and smelled good, the bed was extremely comfortable (fluffy down comforter and pillows), the room was clean and the bathroom was spacious for European standards. The breakfast was also excellent - large carafes of coffee and steamed milk, fresh French bread and pasteries, fresh meat and cheese... I could have stayed another week! Even with the horrible Euro to Dollar exchange rate, this hotel was a great value. It's a little bit outside of the center of Paris, but there's a Metro stop on the same block, so all of the major sites are within 20-30 minutes away. We took a cab from the Eiffel Tower one night after the Metro stopped running and it was 15 Euros (not too bad).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, near metro, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polarbjorn
Reviews.Content: Hotel in 12e district, a bit from the center (20min by Metro) which means quite good value prices (77 euro per night / double room). Straightforward hotel, you get what you pay for. Our room on the first floor was average sized, perfectly clean and bright. Good beds and great big duvet. Bathroom was small but adequate, shower a bit temperamental but workable. No fancy shower gels but shampoo and soap available. Hotel is right on top of the Metro and in the evening you can sometimes hear the Metro pass below. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but used the lovely boulangerie across the road - very good and very busy.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in Paris...Not too central, but still convenient”
Reviews.Author: EgyptianHeidi
Reviews.Content: Some friends, my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during New Year's week. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has true old world charm - our room even had a little fireplace in it which added to the ambience! It was a crazy week in Paris (half the world seemed to be there for New Years), yet the staff were very accomodating. We even received a lovely box of chocolate truffles in our room on New Year's Eve. I liked that the hotel had secure entry. So, later in the night you'd need to ring a bell for the doors to unlock. There was always someone manning the front desk. It's also RIGHT near the metro station, and across from a cute little Boulangerie. The hotel also does a LOVELY breakfast for 8 euro per person. You get private little pitchers of hot coffee or chocolate, fresh croissants, cheese, fruit, cereals, hard boiled eggs, meats, etc. Really a great value. The only downfall to the hotel was the size of the bathroom. I know, it's frustrating when Americans travel to Europe and complain about the size of the bathrooms. But, I've got to say, the bathroom in our room was amazingly small! ;-) There were also some patches on the wall needing paint, etc., but I believe they're working on that. Christine (the owner) was so friendly and helpful in the months leading up to our trip. I exchanged several emails with her and she offered great advice on things to do and see in Paris. Overall, an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: wannie67
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay in this hotel. Price is very reasonable and location are good. The staff and management are very friendly and helpful. Clean washroom/toilet i must say and a very unique victorian bed frame...which are seldom found in Singapore. Wannie - Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaniM
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel De La Porte for 3 days in June 07'. We had a wonderful experience! The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Very close to the metro and directly across the street in a tasty boulangerie, McD's on corner and a great hole in the wall sandwhich shop. When I return to Paris I will definitely stay at this hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful, the decor of the hotel was beautiful for the star rating, in fact, compared this was the best 2 star hotel I found. I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and I really did enjoy this boutique 2 star hotel. It was very nice to have our en suite bathroom. Thank you Hotel De La Porte for enhancing our visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “FAntastic, comfortable, great value...but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Sarahspeech
Reviews.Content: A little late for writing a review, perhaps, but was inspired by reading some recent reviews of this hotel. I also felt that the standard available since this is a 2 star hotel was excellent. Clean, comfortable rooms, excellent location - perfect for those who wish to sample a more realistic view of the life of real Parisiens but still on a major route into the heart of the city. Also handily located by the beginnig of the Promenade Plantee, a romantic rooftop walkway made famous in the film Before Sunset. The available breakfast was tasty and good value (similar price as a coffee alone in some more central establishments!). One drawback is, however, the soundproofing. Like other patrons, I could hear even quiet chat from the room next door and had the unfortunate situation of oflate night tv watching couple for 1st night, followed by rest of week with early rising exciteable children! I did have to buy earplugs to get any decent sleep. That said, I would certainly return (with earplugs) for a later stay. Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeidelbergTara
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked 4 nights at this hotel during Christmas/New Year. We have traveled widely in Europe and overall, we find the hotel as average. (+) Good Price, Nearby Metro Station, Clean Rooms, Small Surprise(small box of chocoloates for New Year's celebration) (-) Very Thin Walls (Our sleep was disturbed at night and we can hear ppl next door chatting or flushing toilet), Unhelpful Staff (Who has not bothered to help us find a secure parking place where we can leave our car for a few days and simply suggested us to park "anywhere in the street". In the end, we walked around the neighbourhood in the cold night for more than an hour in search for one and the receptionist of Ibis hotel nearby was helpful enough to point us to a good private parking place which is a few blocks away), Noises made by the metro running below it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: BNGann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from Paris and our four night stay at the Hotel de la Porte Doree on Nov. 30. Our only regret was that we didn't stay longer. If you read the previous post and realize that this is a family owned two star hotel, you will be delighted. The atmosphere and decor is decidedly Parisian, even though one of the owners is American.
