This is nice for us English speaking travelers. We ate at the the resturants recommended by the hotel and were never disappointed. Unless you have an unlimited travel budget, you will be delighted by the cost of the food in the Avenue Daumesnil area, as well as the price of the rooms at the hotel. We stayed in room 38, a queen room, on the fourth floor and were charmed. We purchased an orange card for the Metro and with a, "Streetwise" map were able to negotiate our way all over Paris. The location of the hotel was never an issue. In fact, we loved coming back to "our neighborhood" at the end of the day. The first part of our trip was spent in a four star hotel near the Eiffel Tower, booked as part of a flight/hotel package. The room was nice, but except for the French staff, the hotel could have been in any large city in the United States. If you are looking for a Parisian experience, I highly recommend that you stay at the Hotel de la Porte Doree.

Reviews.Title: “Porte Doree is truely gold”
Reviews.Author: fredjeff
Reviews.Content: Over the last 5 years, I've stayed at the Porte Doree three times. It is always my first choice in Paris. Christina and her husband have been working hard over the last few years to upgrade the rooms. The addition of soundproof windows throughout makes even the street side rooms quiet. By next summer every room should have air conditioning. Free WIFI was a plus. Breakfast is very good at a reasonable price. Forget "hotel coffee," they serve real coffee and lots of it! They even have a lending library of novels, and tour books. The guests are multinational which makes it more fun. The staff is multilingual too. The rooms are as pretty and comfortable as the pictures on the hotel's website depict. The staff is wonderful. When we were there last October, we needed to get to CDG airport on the first day of the transport workers strike. The night manager spent hours finding us a cab ( he spent most of the night finding cabs for many guests). The hotel is just about 100 feet from the Metro. It is also just 2 blocks from a delightful park, the Bois Vinciennes which is on the scale of Golden Gate Park. Enjoy a delightful "Sunday in the Park", rent a row boat, have the kids ride the ponies or get an excellent lunch on the island. Across the street form the hotel is one of the best Patisseries in Paris. This last trip, I accidentally left a knapsack at the hotel. They tried to get it to me at the airport. When that proved impossible, they shipped it home for me. They actually refused to accept more than it cost to ship. WOW. Jeff Wilson Placerville, CA

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitekat
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband (from Canada) went there for 7 nights (3 nov. to 12 nov.) This place is very easy to access by train and metro, took us 1h15 to get there. You have the train right outside the airport (roissy, terminal 3). The area is very nice with everything you want right next door. You can find 3 or 4 bakeries (with very good pastries and bread), a market (Monoprix) where you can find pretty much everything you want: food, wine, beer, clothing and much more...), drugstores, mcdonald, restaurants, pubs, zoo, aquarium, parc, chateau de Vincennes (it's near and a really great place to visit). The hotel is amazing really !! The service is great, everyone is nice and always willing to help. The place is clean and the decoration is great.... you feel like you're in an other time! The room was on the 4th floor and it was perfect: queen size bed, bathroom, bath with shower, tv, 2 big windows, romantic decoration, clean. We loved this place and will go back for sure !!! we booked directly on their website. The price was really good !

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps overrated?”
Reviews.Author: nozzad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 8 nights in the first week of April 07. Overall I had high expectations because of the raving reviews, but for me the experience was mediocre. Rooms: Tiny but cozy, thanks to the decor. We stayed in #14 followed by #16. TV available in both rooms but limited channels. No fridge. Thin walls - I could hear folks next door chatting, getting ready in the mornings, watching TV late at night. #14: Cramped considering I’m a very petite woman. Also, the shower and toilet were in two separate rooms across from another. Wireless internet was hard to connect and stay connected to. #16: More spacious in comparison, and both shower and toilet were in one room! Wireless internet was much easier to access. Only disadvantage was it was two single beds so my husband and I had to move the beds around so we could sleep together. Location: Loved the neighbourhood, very quaint and gave us a chance to experience the way the locals live. Lots of grocery and pastry stores nearby, however they close early for what we’re used to. The hotel is a bit of a distance from all the touristic sites, at least 30 mins by train. After a long day of walking, getting to the hotel felt like eeeternity. Cleanliness: Up to standards, no complaints. Front desk & Customer Service: I had high expectations as far as customer service at the front desk since all the reviewers were gushing about how friendly and accommodating the staff were. Personally, I didn’t see anything to be impressed about. At some point we had some questions for a gentleman at the front desk (balding and tad feminine one), he was talking to someone on the phone and seemed more interested in doing that than answering our questions about the neighbourhood. On our last day he handled our check-out and almost double charged us but quickly rectified that situation. We had questions about getting to the airport and he didn’t seem too happy about answering those either. All in all mediocre hotel. I think next time my husband and I will try for a hotel closer to the touristic sites. I highly recommend the mille feuille at the pastry store right across the street. It was so good I had to bring some some with me for the plane ride.

Reviews.Title: “Higly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: ErKo-DK
Reviews.Content: Just to confirm that all the nice things said about this hotel and its surroundings are true. Yes - the rooms are rooms, not ballrooms - but they are clean and the bed is comfy. Photo 1. Yes - the elevator is almost unbelievably small. In fact it deserves to be a tourist attraction on its own. At least I've never seen anything like it anywhere in the world. Yes - you can hear and feel a distant rumble when the metro passes deep below the hotel - but take it as a charm. And - if you remember to say "bon swar" and "mersi buukoo" to the night portier, then he's not grumpy at all. And if you on top of that try to say your room-number in french, the he becomes the nicest night portier in all of Paris. A few things that I would like to mention, and which haven't been stressed enough in the previous reviews are : - the breakfast is good and solid. Coffee or tea, apple or orange juice ad lib, (hard) boiled eggs, homemade jam (yummy), fresh fruit, a croissant + some white bread. You will not find it better or cheaper in the nearby bistros. - the bistro "Porte Doree" just around the corner is a MUST if you like an excellent dinner. And it's not at all expensive considering the quality. Do NOT cheat yourself from that experience. - go and check (at least the front of) the museum / aquarium situated between the hotel and the Park Vincennes. Just after the golden statue. Photo 2. - be aware that this hotel for some reason is a magnet on american tourists. The upside of this is of course that you have at least one fix-point in Paris where you are not forced to speak French. Finally a tourist advice : Instead of going to the top of the Eiffel tower, then go to the "Tour Montparnasse". It's cheaper and the view is better. Photo 3 and 4.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could've stayed longer!!”
Reviews.Author: travellots99
Reviews.Content: Starting the trip off in Paris by going to this hotel was great! The staff is super friend, hotel is literally right beside a Metro station. The hotel is extremely well-maintained, large, has an elevator, and rooms are very quaint and nice. The neighborhood where this hotel is located is very nice as well, great walking area. The housekeepers are very pleasant, always smiling and nice. The staff at the front desk are always very friendly and cheerful...it's odd, I think they are North American because the 2 females I encountered that work there don't have any trace of a European accent. I stayed here upon recommendation of a friend of mine who stayed here 3 years ago. It is everything they said it would be and more...highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good on a repeat visit”
Reviews.Author: marchtraveler
Reviews.Content: A friend and I returned to the Hotel de la Porte Doree for a second stay in October of 2007. The Hotel continues to be a great value in a very pleasant location with easy access to the rest of the city through the efficient metro system. A major advantage is the location - a non-tourist neighborhood surrounded by moderately priced, good restaurants. Just a few blocks away is the beautiful Bois de Vincennes park.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: mrcp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here and enjoyed our stay. Our room was of a standard smallness for Paris but comfortable nonetheless with a nice bed. The hotel is very welcoming with a charming facade and reception and the owners do everything they can to accomodate theirs guests. Also the neighborhood is great, good restaurants ( ask Christina, the owner, for recommendations ), a beautiful walk on the Viaduc des Arts (=promenade plantee) takes you from Porte Doree to Bastille through a beautiful park/garden. My only complaint is about the rudeness of one of the staff. This man was very courteous at first but got increasingly rude. I tried to not take it personnally... then noticed he was rude to other customers at well. He even refused to call us a cab, directing us to a cab station where we never manage to get one ( only empty cabs at the curb perhaps because it was lunch time...) until we were 'saved' by Christina (we bumped into her in the street) otherwise we would have missed our train at Gare de Lyon. We will gladly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay..”
Reviews.Author: Andi1979
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Porte Doree is a small two-star hotel located a few minutes by metro from downtown Paris. The Metro is right outside the hotel. Rooms were surprisingly spacious for Paris but like a "refrigerator" due to airconditioning maintenance. Moreover you can here the noise of the metro until late at night.Breakfast was OK (we enjoyed the boulangerie across the street more) and hotel staff was very kind. I was not excited from our stay there but it was OK overall....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan40Cheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2007 - after reading the great reviews on this website - and I wasnt disappointed. Dont expect sheer luxury - after all - this is only a 2 star hotel - but it is a typically french hotel and is very, very good value for money. The rooms are very french - although a little basic, the breakfast room is very nice - and so was the food (although again a little basic). The rumble of the underground can be heard until late at night - but we did get used to this and it isnt really an issue. We stayed in room 44 - which was just about to be refurbished - but was still good. My mother and daughter stayed in a twin room (35) which was very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel - but just dont expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Paris”
Reviews.Author: epacheco14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews. I was for the most part happy with the hotel. The rooms were a good size and comfortable. The first night we were put on the first floor in a room with a bathroom in construction. Stuff from the ceiling was constantly falling making a mess of the bathroom, but not a big deal and would be fixed soon I'm sure. When we returned to paris I stayed on the 3rd floor. A very nice room, quiet with comfortable beds. I think the front desk staff is hit and miss as the guy on duty while I was there was extremely rude. He couldn't even muster a 'bonjour' and completely ignored my questions most of the time. The morning I checked out a different lady was there and she was super friendly and helpful. The location was great. A distance from the main attractions, but with the metro so close it really didn't matter. The restaurant right next door was cheap for Paris with good food and the bakery across the street was great. You can hear the metro below the hotel, but only faintly and it didn't bother me at all. For the price of around $100 US for a queen bed you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yibbert
Reviews.Content: For Paris this hotel is exceptional. The rooms are (suprisingly) big and hotel is really really close to the Porte Doree metro stop. [Portee Doiree is on the pink Line which is not the best metro line for getting to all the highlights, but Metro is easy to navigate]. The staff are very nice, Didn't manage breakfast any morning but there is an exceptional bakery across the road!! The Hotel is very parisian - lock doors at 1am, creaky floor boards, full of french style. I have stayed in many hotels in paris and this is by far the best (for this type of money) - Very good value for money and i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “....away from the maddening crowds”
Reviews.Author: ballymahon
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Located away from the bustle of tourists near an expansive park, the Hotel Port Doree is only two Metro changes from Notre Dame. Great value! The money we saved by not staying at our usual spot on the Left Bank, afforded us one of the best French dinners I've ever had around the corner at the Port Doree restaurant. The staff was most accommodating and the room was charming. The staff arranged our transportation to the airport. The restaurant guide in the room was comprehensive, whether you're looking for a bakery or 5 course dining. Thanks, Christine, for a most pleasant experience. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accessable, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: rpkern
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Paris, and we found this hotel to be perfect for us. If you like to immerse yourself in the "real" Paris, being outside the city center is the way to go. We patronized the local bakeries, supermarkets, restaurants and shops, and we really enjoyed this quiet section of the city. The metro is right outside the front door, and taxis to anywhere in Paris central average between 8 and 12 euros, not bad if you have 3 or 4 people. The Gare de Lyon is 10 minutes away, as is the Bastille. The price was super, the rooms were clean (if a bit on the small side), beautifully furnished and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. We arrived on an early morning flight and expected to have to wait to check in. By 10am our room was ready! Booking on the web was a snap. If you want to see the real Paris, this is the place to go! We'll definitely come back to the Porte Doree.

Reviews.Title: “Beat all expectations”
Reviews.Author: 2retire2
Reviews.Content: It was easy to book the room over the web. The web site photos of the hotel and hotel were accurate and the owner has done a wonderful job remodeling. The price was well below that for comparable hotels. The owner, originally from California, has been in Paris for 14 years. She and her staff speak excellent English and are very familiar with Paris to provide restaurant and other recommendations. The hotel is outside of Paris proper but the Eiffel Tower and all other downtown sites are within one (line 8) or two metro lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: prinses
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room no 4 in Hotel de la Porte Doree at the end of May. The hotel is not situated in the touristy part of Paris, but it offers extremely good value for money - our room was clean and welcoming on our arrival and we were totally satisfied with everything. Although you could hear the metro passing underneath, it was not a problem as it was quiet at night. We had a good meal at the Bistrot Porte Doree around the corner, but would not recommend the Villa Romana restaurant next to the hotel. All in all, a great stay in friendly surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Carmexia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was far enough away from silly tourist crowds, but very close to affordable restaurants, the Metro station, a lovely park, and even a laundromat! What more could a traveler ask for? Next time we're in Paris, we'll definitely stay here again! We especially appreciated the excellent level of service provided by hotel staff. Everyone was very accommodating and kind. I was sad to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vedwa001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this little gem! We stayed here for 4 nights and were sad to leave. The hotel desk workers speak English and were very friendly. Just a block from a Metro station. Not very touristy area (which was a plus for us). Free internet access in the lobby, very clean and a good sized room. The best part of all is the boulangerie right across the street from the hotel. We were over there for breakfast every morning and usually at least once more later in the day. If we get to go back to Paris, this is definitely where we will stay again. Value-priced and a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “2 Canadians, loved Hotel de la Porte Doree”
Reviews.Author: gloryglory
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel immensely. Best things: great service, fantastic location (to a good Metro line), great recommendations for food by the hotel guide (in English and French), great character, clean, fairly comfortable. The food places suggested themselves were worth the stay (bakery, and cafes/restaurants). Yes the criticisms are true: tiny elevator, older hotel that rumbles, waterpipes that make odd noises. But these didn't bother us as this is what we expect with old buildings in Paris. The one thing that was difficult though was the size of the bathroom: so small that I (at 5'1") could not dry off after a shower without opening the door for some extra arm space. The shower itself is pretty small also. My only complaint. When we return to Paris, we would love to stay again at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: Aliree
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. Overall, the hotel was in a great location, easy to get to from Gard du Nord and the reception staff were very helpful. Internet was free and the room was a good size. However, upon arrival, our room was dirty. The carpet had not been cleaned around the edges for some time as there was an inch wide strip all the way around the room which was thick with dust and fluff. You could see it was a different colour from the rest of the red carpet. In the bathroom, the large heated towel rail had not been cleaned for some time. Every rung was thick with dust and felt sticky. Not very appealing when our fresh towels were hung on it! A couple of the towels had slight stains on them as did the bed spread. Having complained to the front desk the room was cleaned and we had no problems after that. Some of the wallpaper was peeling though. We were given a discount of 16 euros from our bill in compensation when we checked out. I would stay in the area again but not sure I would stay there. Our room had no tea or coffee facilities and did not have a fridge which would have been helpful. The metro which runs past on a viaduct every few minutes can be a bit annoying as it is quite loud. You can also feel the rumbling of trains beneath you which is strange. If you do decide to stay here, there is a very useful Monoprix supermarket down the road where you can buy very cheap water, filled baguettes, fruit etc. Also the restaurant two doors down, Villa Romana is excellent. You can get a dinner plate of smoked salmon and caviar with a side plate of toast for 8 euros and a huge pot of mussels with fries for 10m euros. The waiter is very helpful, the food excellent, well worth a meal there.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dunerunner
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonably priced hotel a bit off the tourist track. We have been to Paris several times and really enjoyed this neighbourhood. It was great to come back to after the craziness of the central part of the city.The lovely park was close by. If you are travelling with children there is a terrific amusement park there . There are several great bakeries in the neighbourhood and a post office around the corner. We followed the recommendations in the room for local sights and restaurants. The Romano next door has great pizza- the owner is very friendly and has family in Toronto. For a lovely reasonable bistro meal dress up a little and go to le Bistro Porte Doree around the corner. Again if you have kids Quickburger and McDonald's are nearby. On Sunday go to the street market and marvel at so much fantastic food in one place. The metro stop is literally steps from the hotel door. We had no problems taking public transit from the airport. We took the Roissy bus to the Opera and the metro from there. We arrived early but were able to access our room right away. The staff were helpful, internet was free, the room was certainly big enough for the two of us. The subway sounded like distant thunder, at first I thought that was what it was. My only suggestion would be that they freshen up the room a little - bedspread was shabby, wallpaper peeling a bit but certainly very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Jgarvie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and I was not disappointed! All the positive reviews were right! The room I stayed in (#7) was a decent size with a great view of the street. The only problem some people (not me I don’t watch TV) might have is that the TV is a little small... but then again if you really care about watching TV what in the world are you doing in Paris anyhow? The rooms have free Wifi (Although its not a guarded connection which means you may have problems from time to time connecting) and an electronic safe both which I found very handy. Also, if you don’t have a laptop there is a computer room on the main floor for guests to use. The hotel is a 2 second walk from the metro which I found invaluable seeing as we took the metro every day. If you are really ambitious you can even walk downtown... we did this our first day here, however, I would not recommend this for people who are not willing to spend 2-2.5 hrs or so on foot. Right next to the Metro and the Hotel is a great park with an amazing statue , and an aquarium which is included in the Paris Museum pass (only open 10-5pm). There are lots of great restraunts near by , a grocery store and a bakery across the street. The bakery I must say is amazing, YUM! Most of the staff at the restaurants are not very good at English but they really try, and this is France (not the Uk, Canada, US etc etc etc) English is not a requirement and you can get by pretty well anyhow. I guess that there was a little street noise (we were on the 1st floor) but this did not bother me or my boyfriend in the least (and he often has sleeping problems... not here though) someone in these reviews complained about the subway, although it does rumble a little bit this was again no problem for us and hardly noticeable to be honest. The staff and the owners are very helpful and very nice. If you need anything just ask the desk staff and I'm sure they will get it for you. Hmmm what else... oh yea... the bed was VERY comfortable, I'll be lucky if the beds in the other hotels I'll be staying at in Europe are this great. Price wise this hotel cannot be beat we only paid $70E a night, which was the cheapest of all the hotels we have booked for this month. Breakfast is a little pricey (8E) but if you want something easy and at your fingertips this might work for you. Personally, we never ate at the hotel so I can’t talk about the food quality or anything like that. If I ever come back to Paris again I will definitely be staying at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mackem1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary with a trip to Paris, and enjoyed a very pleasant two-night stay at this hotel. We wanted to keep our cash for sightseeing and dining, and so we set ourselves the challenge of finding a nice, safe hotel at a reasonable price. The Porte Doree met this description. First things first - this is a clean, attractive hotel with friendly staff. It isn't in a central location, but like so many European cities, Paris has an efficient transport network that we're simply not used to in Britain. Once you've mastered the underground map, getting around is a piece of cake. There's a metro stop just outside the hotel, and it takes around 10 to 15 minutes to get to the heart of Paris. The transfer from Charles de Gaulle airport to the hotel took around one hour. We were on the ground floor of the hotel in a room behind the reception area, and yes, there was a deep rumbling metro noise. This did not adversely affect our experience as we were up and out early and back late, though I can see it being more of an issue for anyone wanting to have a lie in. To us, the many positive aspects of the hotel more than made up for this. We didn't make full use of the hotel's own travellers' guide, but the one restaurant we did visit on its recommendation - Little Italy - was superb, which suggests you can follow it with confidence. I can echo other reviewers' delight at the bakery opposite the hotel. It, without a doubt, offers the best cakes I've ever had, and we tried a few! All in all, this was a great hotel at a great price in the most romantic city in the world. We would definitely stay there again, even if we had more cash available. To us, it was more important to have money to spend on making the most of our time in Paris, than to get a five-star hotel that we'd only be sleeping in. I'd also recommend the book, "The Mini Rough Guide to Paris", which we relied on a lot for its street maps. The book also lists the main sights, and we managed to get round most of them during our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and charming”
Reviews.Author: ChicharraJ
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Hôtel de la Porte Dorée. The rooms were smallish (this is typical for French hotels) but decorated nicely and cozy. American-style pillows were tucked into the closets and when the maid (a very nice older lady) noticed we were using them, she made our beds with them from then on. We had a view of the street outside and lots of leafy trees (we were on the second floor (what we in the U.S. call the second floor)). We were aware of the metro (some people have mentioned this) but aside from a very light rumbling sound and vibration, it wasn't a problem. It was easy to get used to and then easy to ignore. The hotel windows did a good job blocking the sound of the street, but when we opened them for fresh air, the traffic sounds were fairly loud. One real advantage was the hotel's willingness to let clients leave their bags in the lobby pre- or post-checkout. If you arrive with your bags and the room isn't ready, it makes life much easier to be able to leave your bags. We were able to leave them between our 12 noon checkout and 5pm train also. Several people have mentioned the bakery across the street - it was excellent. We'd get pastries and then head to a brasserie up the street for coffees. There was also a creperie nearby and the lady who ran it was extremely friendly and kind. We had a chance to explore the Bois de Vincennes, which is within easy walking distance. There are lots of joggers and dog-walkers and if you keep going, a lovely trail around a small lake. Lac Daumesnil, I believe. The only sour notes in our five-day stay were a random fire alarm at 6:45 one morning that woke the whole hotel up (for apparently no real reason), the loss of wifi for a full day because of a storm (although having free wifi was a treat - and there was an internet place across the street we used since the hotel's own computer was down), and a tiny bit of bad attitude (a little smirking and dismissiveness) from an older gentleman working the hotel desk in the mornings while we were there (we met the owners and they were very nice, but they left soon on vacation so we only saw them our first day there). All in all, the hotel was a terrific value, conveniently close to the metro, near some very nice places to eat (casual and not so casual), and very homey. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, rather nicely decorated, yet punishingly noisy”
Reviews.Author: kkushiba1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 46 and would not recommend this room to light-sleepers interested in staying at the hotel. Room 46 was not on the top floor near all the other rooms in the 40's(including the surreal room 45 with a door without a doorknob) but right next to the elevators and one floor above the reception area. So along with the noise of the metro trains rumbling (headboard jiggled a bit sometimes during those moments) and the periodic sounds of water rushing down through the pipes in the walls, someone in room 46 might be able to hear noise from the elevator and light sounds of anyone talking in a loud voice from the hotel's lobby. Also, as other reviews have mentioned, the hotel is in a quaint and rather newer part of Paris and very close to the metro stop and businesses such as restaurants, bakeries, and the huge Monoprix grocery store. However, anyone carrying heavy luggage and thinking about using public transportation to arrive at the hotel from either CDG or Orly Airports or specifically from the Chatelet-Les Halles metro stop should be extremely fit or should just abandon the idea. A taxi ride at least from somewhere central is a must, otherwise, one can expect to carry luggage up and down over 8 flights of stairs over the course of making a couple of station transfers to reach the hotel's closest metro stop. Also, the hotel's extremely thin elevator might pose a problem for certain people. With even just heavy bulky luggage, the elevator which measures perhaps 30" across might make for an unexpectedly unpleasant experience for people used to elevators of greater dimensions. I did see someone at the front desk being extremely nice to a guest. I'm guessing that the same front desk person wrote up the compact tips and travellers' guide in English located in each room. So some aspects of the hotel might be very ideal for certain travellers, especially those who are on a budget , appreciate local tips in English from some of the front desk staff, and can sleep through everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: PeteJN
Reviews.Content: I satyed here on the Easter weekend and found everything as I had hoped. Although the Hotel isnt exactly central, it still has godd transport links with the main attractions via the metro and it is also easy to get to good areas for the evenings out. The hotel had nice clean functional rooms, and served a good hearty breakfast. The staff were always very helpful and polite. I would recommed this place for a stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap prices, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: bmarcus
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel de la Porte Doree based on the strong trip advisor reviews and the price. No complaints about the price-$70 Euros a night is hard to beat. The lobby of the hotel is welcoming and the staff person on duty (Christine I believe) was very friendly. We checked into room 4 and after a long train ride from Amsterdam were ready to take a quick nap before heading out to explore. I know for $70 Euro you cannot expect much in terms of luxury and the simplicity of the room and minimal amenities were fine. As we were laying down to enjoy our nap, I tried to ignore the hairs and stains on our blanket and sheets, although no matter how budget a place is, I would hope for cleanliness. It's hard to know what woke us first....the pleasant sounding gentleman on the phone in the room next to us (we could even hear the phone being picked up and hung up), the constant flushing sound in our bathroom (it seemed the main drain pipe for the place ran through our bathroom), or the rumbling of the subway. All I can say is, if they put you in room No. 4, don't take it. We told ourselves we were there for Paris, not the hotel, which was true and headed out. The next morning when we woke up at 7am because our next door neighbors decided to wake up at 7am, we asked for a room change. We were obliged and moved up to a quieter room on the third floor. This one was better, mostly clearner, although with a broken shower head. But at least it was quiet and we could sleep. We left our adapter in the previous room and the night manager (who a previouse reviewer referred to as not being very helpful) wouldn't even tell us if someone was or wasn't in the room so we could grab it. The area was fine, it's nice to stay in an area where people live as opposed to just for the tourists. There is a supermarket a few blocks down so you can get drinks, etc. and keep them in the room. The subway ride didn't bother us, but we are from NYC and used to public transportation. You have to take the train a good deal in Paris anyway to get from place to place. Overall, if you are looking at price only, you can't go wrong. But be prepared for some staff unfriendliness, a little dirt, and a little noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelBud1
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to France and to Paris. We speak very little French, and have not much to rely on other than our Lonely Planet book. My wife and I stayed in this property in Mid May for 1 week. In summary, our experience had been great. The room rates are fair, the rooms are clean, the staff are friendly and as other reviewers pointed out, english speaking. We especially like the free Wifi access, the neighbourhood brasserie (Le Cascade), the Brasserie directly across the road, the 'Japanese' (run by Chinese) eatery next to Le Cascade which is very reasonably priced. There's also a restaurant around the corner also serves interesting french food. The monoprix and other conveniences such as laundromat are nearby. People in this neighborhood are friendly in general and the neighbourhood feels safe, unlike some other dodgy neighbourhoods we chanced on in our travel to Paris. We stayed on the 1st floor fronting the main road. As our window was closed most of the time, we were not too bothered by the noise from the main road. There was one night where the window was opened and i recall that it was quite noisy that night. If you are a light sleeper, you really should try to get a room that is not as noisy. Other reviewers have suggestions. The metro right at the door step is VERY convenient. The way Paris attractions are structured, you will end up walking a lot and relying on the Metro to get around. For the price of the room, I think instead of splashing 100+ Euros for a decent hotel in the city centre, i would rather - save on accomodation and stay here - use the money saved to buy Carnets (Metro tickets) - treat yourself to a good dinner every day Will definitely be back. Our trip to Paris had been very memorable, i think a large part because of our stay here and the wonderful neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “LIKED THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rshi
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel in may 2007. hotel is neat and clean. rooms are small but neat and clean. maid service everyday. staff is friendly and helpful. had the breakfast every morning. the breakfast room is very nice and service is good. great way to start day. if you are english speaking only, all tv stations except cnn are french, but really who watches that much tv in paris. portee doree sub station is right out door of hotel. you will have to connect to another sub way in order to reach most tourist areas of paris and in order to get back, but not hard to figure out and fairly quick. we traveled strictly by sub for four days. get the paris vista pass it saves money and time buying tickets each time. subway noise and vibration is noticed in hotel but not really a big deal. this is not five star hotel but for price, it is a nice little place with good service, clean and also has computer and internet access in area off of lobby. you get a real feel for paris by staying here. only possble draw back is it is a bit out from most sites, on east outshirts of paris proper. i would recommend hotel doree to anyone staying in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: smm648
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Porte Doree for 4 nights in May. We being my husband and I, my Grandfather, and my 8 month old son. We got there very late. Our room was still available and the night desk person helped us with our bags and got us drinks. We walked into our room, two beds and a baby bed. It was so nice to have everything taken care of. The bathroom was a nice size, I thought. A shower in a tub, plenty of room to move about. We didn't have much of a view, but that was fine. The breakfast served there is very good. I believe the price was 7Euros per person. Crossaints, baguets, fresh fruit, juice, cereal, coffee, hardboiled eggs, ham, cheese...really nice. We ate there twice. Everyone in the hotel, from the cleaning ladies to the front desk staff to the lady running breakfast was nothing but hospitible. The metro station is very close, as is that fantastic bakery, a lot of little shops, restaurants, grocery store. Being out of the center of town wasn't as bad as I thought, especially being so close to the metro station. You can hear/feel the trains go by, but this did not bother any of us. Really, this was a great find, we are so happy we booked with them. A very warm welcome and a "come back soon" goodbye. A+!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Emily_in_France
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through tripradvisor.com and after reading all the wonderful reviews. After staying there, I agree with all the positive reviews. This place was great! The owners were very nice and helpful. They speak French and English. The location was great. It`s right next to a Metro stop...literally out the door. And the bakery opposite the hotel is fabulous. I gave them too much of my money. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel has free internet and wi-fi for those that bring their own laptops. The only setback is that the building shakes a bit when the Metro goes through and you hear it, but it`s SO subtle. I give this hotel 2 thumbs up. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller24
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel but read on....We stayed here on May 14th, because on a web site we had read it was 0.5km from the Eiffel Tower. It certainly isnt!...It is 15-20 mins metro ride from the tower and main attractions. We paid 70 euros. No breakfast inc. (-) We arrived at 2pm but our room was an hour from being ready when we were told it would be available from noon. (I will add some web sites do have the hotel's correct distance from the main sites, just not the one we booked with. I've asked the hotel and the site to correct this as that error cost us 100 euros in taxis and metro tickets.) (-) However, we went out to explore Paris returned at 10pm. An elderly male receptionist couldn't find our booking, spoke little English, but made it clear he didn't have a room free. Fortunately I had printed our booking reference, so on production of that he finally gave us a room key, no pleasantries, actually very rude. (+) Very nice room, small but nicely furnished and clean en-suite, with double glazing. No complaints at all. (+) Quaint but TINY lift was available. (-)Metro rumble very evident, our room shook with each metro train below us. I didn't find it difficult to sleep, but some may find this too much ? Overall, I would stay there again as I didn't mind metro rumbles. The hotel is very pretty, very close to a metro stn, but some distance from the main attractions. Mixed staff, some lovely, others not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MargueriteTasmania
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is friendly and helpful. When we booked, we mentioned that we would just have flown from Australia. We arrived early, well before check in time and were given another serviced room to rest in while ours was made ready. The rooms are all individually furnished and decoration is sympathetic to the era of the hotel and while not big, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The rooms on the street side have a view through the plane trees to the boulangerie opposite. There is a lovely park nearby, and you can walk through a garden along an old viaduct for about 5kms, most of the way to the heart of the city. The area seems safe, and there are lots of shops and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “No Hesitation-Thumbs Up !!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinBilly
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. We stayed 2 days in April and found the Hotel to be a great value little place with a real atmosphere and a quality feel to it. As Gaz has pointed out the Metro Rumble is noticeable and doubtless if you are from a shaky part of the world then steer clear. But for the rest of us with our feet planted on stable soil the rumble becomes almost an integral part of the Paris experience. When I stay in a CITY hotel I expect to experience the sights AND sounds of that CITY and the Port Doree is just the place. We had a first floor front room and kept the windows open each night. Who needs late night TV when you can play gin rummy whilst sipping wine and watching the world go by out on the Avenue !! PS: The wine came from an excellent little Fruit & Veg shop just around the corner (Open till Midnight) where needles,anchors and VERY palatable Vins (€2 upwards) can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever......subway train ruin my stay”
Reviews.Author: gas
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Porte Doree is the best value you can find in Paris,it is a lovely hotel with really nice rooms,i book one on the highest floor which was very well decorated with ceperate toilete and shower, one big bed,and really nice and "warm" enviroment inside,it was tottaly clean and they had an elevator.The staff was really nice ,they were smiling and I had a really hospitable feeling from them.The price is really cheap and it is really rare to find all these in a so famous and exciting city like Paris.The area is good and as previous reviews said there is a great bistrot on the corner,which i try it more than once for its lovely salads and coffes.The metro station called porte dorre as hotel's name is few metres from there,and here is my big dissapointment.Having the subway station few metres from your hotel is allways a big advantage especially for a city like Paris where the metro is a must if you want to explore the sights.I cant undertsand why this problem havent been mentioned from anyone else.The subway trains passes every 4 minutes,and as you can understand every 2 minutes in a station due to both platforms.Living in a country with lots of earthquakes a building shaking even slighty and underground noise moving the whole facilties is a really bad feeling.So,subway trains passes every 2 minutes, even if i was on the highest floor of the hotel ,the noise was really bad, the shaking was begining at 5 ocock in the morning and it was end at 1 oclock at night,the operational time of paris metro.I know that some persons maybe dont have any problem with that,but for me after my first scare ,the continue passes every 2 minutes until the end of the day cause me problems even if i was returning late to my room.The noise can be keep you asleep if you want to rest during the day for a while,and i dont want to imagine how it feels on the lower floors. Hotel de la Porte Doree is the best value and is a really nice place but i would think twice to stay there when i will return to Paris.The noise from the subway passes underground ruin my stay there,and i cant undertsand why i havent read a comment about this in the previous posts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Omphalos McButton
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. The price is reasonable, the location fine, the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel was renovated fairly recently, and it is clean and charming and tastefully decorated with old reproductions of prints of paintings. There's some nice actual art work painted on the walls of the cheery breakfast room on the first floor, too. The other reviewers aren't lying about the bakery across the street -- it's world-class. And there are lots of other places to eat and drink in the immediate area, if you don't feel like heading into the center of Paris (we liked Tramway, and the Metro at Place Daumesnil). The Bois de Vincennes is a gorgeous park and a great place for a walk. Ultimately, it depends on what sort of Paris experience you are seeking. You can't see the Eiffel Tower from the Porte Doree, and the Louvre is a long way away. But the 12th has its own distinct charms, and probably gives you much more of a sense of the "real" Paris. So, if you want to wake up yards away from Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens, etc., this is not the place for you. But if you have a little time to spend and want a friendly, tidy hotel, and don't mind being a bit away from things, you can't go wrong. The breakfast, incidentally, was just fine (the croissants came from across the street!). About the only thing I can think of that was subpar was the water pressure in the shower; it came out fine in the tub, but the shower wand was anemic. Oh, and you can feel the subway inside the hotel -- when trains pass by the walls rumble a bit. I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Believe it!”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyageBC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Porte Doree in March for three nights. This was my fourth trip to Paris and easily one of my favourite hotels. I was a bit worried about staying outside of the city centre, but soon found that the hotel was worth the 20 minute metro ride into the city. The metro stop (called Porte Doree) is maybe fifteen steps from the hotel and runs on a great metro line (easy transfers to sights, etc). The hotel itself is lovely -- you can't find a hotel with more character for a better price. I booked my room online through their website and when I arrived they had 'lost' my reservation. They were very nice about it, explaining that it was a new system and then they upgraded us to a bigger room than we had booked online. The room was clean and the beds were soft; the bathroom was small but spotless. There are loads of quaint cafes, a couple of sushi places and a big Monoprix grocery store (with drugstore and a bakery attached) within a couple of blocks of the Porte Doree. This was my first time staying in the 12th, but I walked around until late into the night and always felt safe. I would absolutely recommend staying at the Porte Doree -- if you're looking for moderate accomadation at the right price, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a find !”
Reviews.Author: TerryToz
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Paris on quite a few occasions in the last 5 years and we feel that we have unearthed a 'gem'. We loved the welcome we received, we were given exactly what we asked for in regards our room and the service and advice we received was excellent. We had 2 rooms between the 5 of us and we will definately be back again soon. The only slight moan was that when the early morning staff arrived at about 4 in the morning, our sleep was disturbed a little by the slightly loud talking as our room wasn't far from the reception area. I asked them if they would mind talking a little quieter, they were very apologetic and we never heard them again. Terry Tozer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and wonderful Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneandMadeleine
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent nine wonderful days in May at this charming hotel. We loved the neighborhood -- away from the madding crowds. We felt we were among the real Parisiens. We breakfasted at a different cafe every morning -- hopped the metro (so close to the hotel) to our day's destination and were happy to come "home" every night. We had a great room with a little patio on the back of the hotel. We chose to go to the back of the hotel based on suggestions from other reviewers -- and found the rooms very quiet -- though you do forgo a view -- but sleep was more improtant. The staff were fun -- we both speak french -- but they were very willing to communicate in English. Incidentally we splurged on three nights at a far fancier ($300 a night ) hotel at the end of our stay and concluded in retrospect we should have spent our money at La Porte Doree -- and stayed another nine days in Paris. Great restaurants everywhere. We would recommend wholehearteldly and will return to this hotel if we are ever lucky enough to go to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mjogg11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree from Jan 1-5, 2007 and loved it. The hotel is very unassuming, blending in with the neighborhood around it. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly and helpful desk staff. Before checking in she answered all of our questions about the local area, the metro, and how to get to different places in the city. The hotel is located about 20 minutes, by metro, from the city center. When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised. For such a reasonable rate the rooms were really nicely decorated and very, very clean. It almost felt like you were checking into a bed and breakfast. The rooms are small but so are most rooms in Europe. Also in the room was a small book, written by the owner of the hotel. It included local restaurants, reviews, and directions. This was very helpful as this isn't a really touristy area and the restaurants are tucked in amongst the florists, bakeries, and local shops. This is a great neighborhood where we felt safe walking even late at night. Overall, I would absolutely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for budget conscious travellers”
Reviews.Author: loddington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porte Doree in November, in a single room. As long as you don't mind not being near the sights, this hotel is a good choice. A metro station is just yards outside the door, as are a number of local restaurants, a fine park [Vincennes], a Monoprix supermarket just down the Avenue Daumesnil, and as others have noticed a superb patisserie across the road. The hotel is not quite as grand as its website photos suggest, my single room was a little small, but perfectly adequate and reasonably priced. Clean, well maintained, and a friendly atmosphere, which suits me better than a big impersonal hotel. If you don't mind taking the metro into the city centre every morning and returning on it in the evenings, Porte Doree is a fine choice. British visitors arriving at Gare du Nord are fortunate, because there is a direct bus from the station to the Porte Doree, number 46, which stops close to the hotel. A good breakfast, optional at 7euros, includes fresh fruit, cereal, croissants and fruit juice, and you can have it in your room at no extra cost. A very nice hotel, with good public transport links and in a very pleasant part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not amazing”
Reviews.Author: joeyt28
Reviews.Content: This is a very good choice in Paris, but it is not perfect. I had a single room, which seemed small at first but was actually quite adequate. My bed seemed fine, and they had nice touches such as a desk and chair, and a nice mirror which added character. The wardrobe was also good, though I lived out of my suitcase. The bathroom was an awkward shape, and the shower was quite tiny and uncomfortable, and I'm a pretty small person. I also wasn't crazy that the windows were always left open when I returned. The room was a little worn around the edges in places, such as the walls and around the door. The location is out of the way, but then you know that when you book. They provide a great Yellow Pages in the room which was an excellent map. The staff during the weekend seemed a bit surely, but Jolie on Monday was great ... so kind and helpful. I saw Christina, which was very exciting. I probably would have preferred something a little more central, but this was a very solid choice, and the price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Smart Decision”
Reviews.Author: MustangUSMC
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week, we loved the hotel, we cherished the staff. A beautiful place, with a wonderful staff that helped us find all the places in Paris, and then some we never knew existed. Easy access to the Metro (skip the cabs, the Metro is easier and less expensive), wonderful neighborhood (must go to the bakery across the street, laundromat nearby was fun too!), just simply a warm, comfortable place to stay. All the requirements..clean, safe, comfortable, friendly. The extra's..English -speaking staff (at least two ex-patriates), amazing family-based managment (Ya gotta meet "Dad"!), free wireless internet, wicked good breakfast (DO NOT miss the hot chocolate, no matter what), and lots of other little pluses! This place made our stay in Paris great. It was our single best decision on this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: eur2005
Reviews.Content: I stay with my daughter for 4 days. The area is wonderful. The metro station in the front. So many types of restaurants. You have fast food and regular and good restaurants. Almost everyone in the area know a little english. The boulangerie in the front is perfect. I would repeat the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LW1
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay in the Porte Doree during a stay in Paris in Oct 2006 based on Trip Advisor reviews. Was not disapointed. Room was quite small but perfectly adequate, clean and nicely decorated. Staff were helpful. Situated close to metro station, taxi rank, various markets and restaurants. Excellent value for money. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RichardPritchard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Porte Dorée for two nights to go and see a rugby match in Paris. I am in love with the city anyway, so I am bound to recommend that people go there. This hotel is a good and inexpensive way of staying there and it is right outside Porte Dorée Metro station. I would agree with all the comments below (exept the guy from Folkestone, whose review refers to the Hotel Dorée not the Hotel Porte Dorée and ought to be filed there). Breakfast was good if expensive at €7. You could have as much as you wanted if you asked. The room was clean and not too small (but it was a single). The bathroom was small, but they usually are in Paris (standing up to wash does nto take up much space in the shower) and the staff were pleasant and helpful. The main drawback for me (and it is not much of one) is that the metro line it is on is close to the end of Line 8 (Direction Créteil), meaning that the nearest station with an interchange is a few stops away. I took my fully functioning Apple Mac to use with their Wi Fi system; it did not hook up properly though. All in all I would recommend this to any budget traveller or short stay traveller

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenchiksf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September. We were pleasantly surprised by its level of comfort and cleanliness. Our room was large, had a fireplace, and bathroom looked new and clean. I think it's also in the process of being renovated. Porte Doree is not located close to the center, however there is a metro station nearby, and it takes about 30-40 minutes to get to main attractions. Beware of the included breakfast though. We booked through Venere, and the breakfast was supposed to be included in the rate, however we were told that it was 7.50 EU per person when we were checking out. Overall, this hotel is a pretty good deal in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will return next year”
Reviews.Author: ozzieozzieozzie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de la Porte Doree is a great spot to spend your visit to Paris. It is small but comfortable and relatively inexpensive. Some of the best features are its location close to a Metro station, the helpful staff who know French customs and language but can also appreciate American, British, Australian etc requirements, and its great value for money. The neighbourhood is some distance from central Paris, but this does not matter as most Paris destinations are scattered all over town and you have to travel to reach them anyway. A daily or weekly Metro pass is the answer here. What you can save on hotel costs at Porte Doree you can use for a restaurant meal each night around town. And add to this the excellent French restaurant around the corner, the friendly suburban neighbourhood and the safe environment and you have a winner. The rooms are small, yes, the bathrooms are small, yes, but this is Paris and if you are looking for the Hilton then clearly this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast is good, and if you want a cheap alternative, there is a Macdonalds across the road with 1.99 euro Egg McMuffins. A nearby supermarket and hot bread shop add to the attractions. We liked it so much we will be going back in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PS79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a week this past July. We had read really good reviews about it and we were not dissapointed. It was cozy and comfortable. The rooms are not big, but they were enough for what we needed. We spent most of the days out, arriving late at night. It was nice to know we had such a nice place to go back to after walking around all day. The hotel is not in the center of Paris, but has a metro station coveniently located right at the corner. The noise didn't bother us one bit. There are plenty restaurants and places to buy food around. The patisserie in front of the hotel was simply superb, we bought our breakfast there everyday (closed on Tuesdays) and couldn't be happier with all the things we tried. Cafe Cascade, in the opposite corner has also very nice menu options and they open all day long (most restaurants in Paris have very fixed lunch and dinner hours). The staff at the hotel were very nice, and almost all of them speak English. Bear in mind that as the hotel is not in the center of Paris, they don't speak English in most of the restaurants and shops around. Overall, we had a great time in Paris and this hotel was just the perfect choice for us. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: krau0123
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything one could ask for: affordability, charm, comfort, safety, and easy access to the metro. It is not in a central area of Paris, but that definitely has its advantages. My husband and I stayed there during October 2005 based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. I would recommend HPD to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best of all worlds........”
Reviews.Author: ballymahon
Reviews.Content: This was recommended by a Francophile who has stayed in Paris dozens of times and says this is one her favorites....with the adjacent restaurant providing the best food she has ever had in France! The hosts are delightful and helpful. The location is in a lovely tree-lined neighborhood, away from the bustle of tourists, yet is only 15 minutes via Metro (1 change) to Notre Dame. I especially appreciated the local neighborhood info in the room and the washcloths, a rare commodity in European hotels. This is a great value w/ clean, well appointed rooms. Thanks for the hospitality, Christine! (from a fellow Sacramentan)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: leilagorbman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, wonderful neighborhood. We felt welcomed and safe.

Reviews.Title: “extremely small rooms & poor subway connections”
Reviews.Author: travelingquilter
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Hotel de la Porte Doree on our way back thru Paris.The rooms were clean but extremely small especially the bathrooms. There is not enough room for anything in there and you pretty much have to sit sideways on the toilet! The subway stops are also a problem because you must change lines to get to any tourist sight, so you really need to know how to use the subway! The other thing the hotel claims to have is wi/fi in your room for free. the only problem is that it dosen't work and if you ask for help no one knows anything! we ended up buying 30 minutes for 3 euros on the computer downstairs which didn't work at ALL!! We ended up spending 30 frustrating minutes sitting there waiting for this exptemely slow computer to try to work which it never did. when we asked for our money back of coures it was not possible and the man at the desk had no idea where to find an internet cafe at that time. All in all the room is clean but for 90 euro a night if your spending any time in Paris I would choose a better location, a hotel with a little more room and one that truely does have wi/fi that works. If those things are important to you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sunnytravels
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and location! I stayed at the hotel de la Porte Doree last week. There were 6 of us (3 couples), we rented 3 rooms on 3 different floors- all the rooms were similar, small, clean and a very small but adequate bathroom with shower. This charming hotel is very nicely kept and in a great neighborhood, a few steps from the Porte Doree metro stop, easy acess to all the sites of the city. There are many little patisseries, bars and cafes nearby. There is even a McDonald's on the corner- if you should need a fix from home. My only complaint was that the hotel sells time for guests to use a computer in the lobby- don't use it! It is an obsolete computer with dial-up line and they refused to give me a refund when I hadn't gotten to the main search page 30 minutes after logging on! On the upside- they do have Wi-Fi but we couldn't access it from the the hotel room only from the lobby. We stayed at another Paris hotel 2 weeks prior, that I considered to be excellent mostly for location (Ile de la Cite), it was about 30% more expensive per night- for the price, the Doree can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible luxury for the price”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyeGirl88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree for 3 nights this past June 2005. We chose this hotel solely based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! This a wonderful, charming French inn that is beautifully decorated in French provencal style with wooden floors and marble bathroom counters. At the rate of 76Euro/night, we were amazed to find a larger-than average room (containing a queen bed, walk in closet), large bathroom (by European standard), and even the smart design of a separate WC. The bathroom had a full bathtub/shower, double marble sinks, and even a bidet. NOTE: We stayed in the larger queen room and I would recommend paying extra to stay in the large Queen room versus the double. The double rooms are not as big or nice. The staff was friendly and the hotel is located literally steps from the Porte Doree metro stop. We had an outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: yves.werder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed over weekend in the Hotel. We have been all over Europe over the years and following all the good reviews we decided on the hotel. We were located on the third floor towards the street. Plus: The price. What you get is truly above average. It is not luxus, but for this price you probably will only find a handfull of comparable hotels in Paris. The Bed was very comfortable and and absolut highlight ! Also the cleaness and the service was very good for such category of hotel. Negativ: The water pressure should be enhanced in some way and the shower heads need some cleaning. TV could include (more) german/english stations (or at least possibilty to switch french films to english original audio), although the goal is not to watch TV for hours I appreciate a "good night watch". The connection to Airport Charles de Gaulles is very well reachable by the rental taxi (about 30 Euro). If you're travelling in early or late hours metro and bus lines are very limited to reach the airport. All in all a very good price for what you get, and people in hotel are very pleasant and helpfull. Yves (28) and Nicole (26) from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SpaceCity_traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from May 25th to 29th. We picked the hotel based on all the great reviews on this site and we were very happy with our choice. We had a standard double room on the 4th floor facing the street. The hotel is right next to the metro stop "Porte Doree" on line 8. It is outside of central Paris in the southeast area. We did not meet Christina the owner because she was in the US. Everyone at the desk was very nice and most of them speak English. The elevator is the smallest I have ever seen but certainly very unique. Our room is large compared to other European hotels. The bathroom was adequate size with a small shower. It wasn't a problem for us, but will be difficult for a larger person to shower. The water pressure is lower than what I prefer but not a big problem. Towels were changed daily. Room and bathroom were very clean. Extra pillows were provided. Since we were on the 4th floor, we did not feel the metro at all. There is no air conditioning, but Paris is still cool at this time of the year, we had our window opened the whole time and was fine. This may be a problem in the summer. The hotel is in a neighborhood, so it was fairly quiet at night even with the window opened. Did not try the breakfast in the hotel. We went to the bakery acrossed the street every morning which has great croissants, quiche, and desserts. Another bakery is further down the street but not very good. There is a grocery store about one metro stop away. There are several great restaurants nearby. Bistro Porte Doree around the corner has wonderful French crusine with a fixed price menu including a bottle of wine. We went there twice. La Gourmandise is right next to the hotel and is another very good French restaurant. For anyone who is craving American fast food, there is a McDonald's right across the street but I do not recommend it with so many other choices around. The hotel is not close to any tourist sights. Took us around 20-30 minutes on the metro to all the sites. This seemed long coming back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing. My only complaint is the Internet access. The hotel has one computer in the lobby but there is always a wait even at 11P. It costs 4 Euro per hour which is bit high compared to all the internet cafes we been to in Europe. Also the internet speed is very slow so it took a long time to check emails. Overall, we really liked this hotel and our stay was very comfortable. We highly recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive and clean hotel located outside of central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de la Porte Doree for a week at the end of May. It was fantastic. The rooms are moderately sized for Parisian standards, the front desk speaks some English (especially the day shift), and there are nice, local jaunts surrounding the hotel. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the avenue. With sweeping views of huge sycamores and domed churches, we felt right at home and couldnt believe how inexpensive the hotel is. The small breakfast cafe on the bottom level is a gem. Hard to believe someone would complain about paying $7 euro for a fresh croissant, baguette, home-made jam, cream cheese, fresh coffee, and juice. The service was pleasant as well which is always a bonus. And while most main attractions are far enough to need a cab or tram ride, it is well worth it. Staying at the Porte Dorre was both a help on our finances and a boost for our love for Paris. I rank my stay at this hotel as one of my top 5 hotel experiences all things considered. Tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: goldenladee
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from 3 days at the hotel primarily because of the other reviews. It really has an excellent location and travelling anywhere in Paris would not present a problem. The hotel and its surrounding areas are safe, clean and much nicer than downtown Paris. A lovely hotel but with minor changes it could be even better. A small refrigerator would be very helpful to hold chilled drinks+ cheeses! Another thing that would elevate it would be in room tea/coffee making facilities. Most importantly a safe which could be located in the wardrobe area. Breakfast perhaps we expected too much however the homemade jams were wonderful. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Still Just Average for a family”
Reviews.Author: AussieJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a second time in this so called 2 star hotel in April. Family rooms are way too small despite owners assurance the situation had been improved from our previous stay a year ago. Four people cannot stay for a week in a room with no floor space & no storage space. Breakfast @ 7 Euros is crazy go across to the bakery over the road & get a decent brekfast for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancesNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for several days in November 2004 while doing a tour of Europe. Cheap hotel rates (for Paris and Europe), small but comfortable room. Didn't try the breakfast in the hotel as there was a bakery right in front serving the most wonderful millefeuilles!!!! Located in a good neighborhood, near the cinema and very close to the metro stop. Lots of fun "untouristy" things to do in the area, although the major tourist spots are only a few metro stops away. A helpful guide is located in the room. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizasaurus
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Porte Dorée for a weekend in March, and we completely loved it! I found it on TripAdvisor, actually, so I was curious to see if it lived up to its expectations. Our room was small but cozy, and the staff was friendly and helpful. There is a booklet in each room that contains not only typical practical information that one would find in any hotel, but also a plethora of recommendations for local restaurants, sights in Paris, etc etc that is written by someone who had been to all of the places and seen all of the things that are recommended. The metro stop is right next to the hotel, and another added bonus is the bakery across the street - I've been living in France for several months now, and they have hands-down the best croissants I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: olvick
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at L'Hotel De La Porte Doree, in the 12th Arrondisement. Typically I have reservations regarding opinions I read online, about hotels. Service, convenience, facilities, and expectations can be extremely subjective. Some itinerary decisions are simply leaps of faith, based on intuition. I felt somewhat more comfortable selecting L'Hotel De La Porte Doree, because of the owners responses on trip advisor, to negative comments. It appeared the owner took seriously, any issue that would impact a stay at the hotel. I travel often to Europe, and have stayed in some absolutely wonderful small hotels. The most memorable in my experience are those in mid size communities, where unfettered tourism has not diluted the charm of the area. Hotel De La Porte Doree, was a gem. The initial welcome by the staff was genuine, and personal. The very thoughtful, and appropriately decorated common areas were a reflection of the owners pride in their business. The attention to detail, provided a warm and friendly atmosphere. The elevator was small, but convenient in sending the luggage to our 2nd story room. It allowed us to walk up the stairs, and enjoy the tasteful decor. Our room was larger than I expected, and absolutely pristine with modern ensuite facilities. In concert with the rest of the hotel it was tastfully decorated, conservative, and artfully appropriate. The free wi-fi connection was a definite plus. It allowed us to keep in contact with the folks at home. Our room also had a folder containing a list of favorite places, including suggestions for dining, sight seeing and activites, which was helpful. Hotel De La Porte Doree, is located in a very clean area of Paris, with enough activity to make it interesting, and quiet enough at times, be almost tranquil. Restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies, and public transportation are conveniently close. I sometimes enjoy the comfort food of MacDonalds, and one is located across the street. On the occasion I had difficulty in communicating with a local shopkeeper, someone would always be willing to offer assistance. My ability to speak fluent French (or English sometimes) is effected by a prominent Oklahoma accent. Bois de Vincennes, is about a five minute walk from the hotel. The park is magnificent. Even in the rain, and cool temperatiures it was a delight. Bois De Vincennes is a pleasant respite from the pushing and articulated walking, necessary in the busy areas of Paris. It has convenient boat and food concessions also. Two things added a unique spice to my stay. The sound of the subway, which apparently runs underneath the hotel and the walls which allowed a bit of insight into my neighbors television preferences was passivly noticeable. Neither prevented a good nights sleep, and neither detracted from the overall excellent service and facilities, of L'Hotel De La Porte Doree. These experiences simply add to the memories, and offer fodder for future conversation. There is a bus stop, and a metro entrance in front of the hotel. The bus #46 takes you on a pleasant ride, directly to Gare Du Nord, passing a collage of Parisian neighborhoods in about 40 minutes, for 1 Euro 40. If you are going to CDG, you do not have to tote luggage up and down the stairs of the subway system, and the bus much less crowded. A very pleasant surprise occured a few days after returning to the States, I received a personal e-mail from Christina, the owner, thanking me for my stay. This is my first time to comment on a message board, but the exceptional value and convenience of this hotel inspires me enthhusiastically recommend L'Hotel De La Porte Doree. M.Vick Colbert Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: annrosso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porte Doree for one night upon our arrival in Paris. The room was on the front of the hotel, and the traffic noise was very loud. We had booked a week at the hotel later in the month, so upon check-out, we requested a room away from the traffic. We were told by the gentleman at the desk that we already had a room assigned and he would not change it. On our return, we grew increasingly frustrated (and tired) each night, as traffic noise on the busy Avenue Daumesnil kept us awake. If we ever went to the desk with questions about finding our way in the city, we were ignored for a few moments, before the desk gentleman acknowledged us with the attitude, "What do you want?" Even when we went to check out, we had to wait while he finished reading a page on his computer. He took our money, shoved the receipt our way, and went right back to the computer screen. No, "thanks for your business." We are planning a trip to Paris this spring, and are definitely finding another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, good area, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ellequeue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute and cozy. Rooms are small, but perfect for a couple or friends and everything is spotless. The breakfast is wonderful and can be brought up to your room. The front desk staff made every possible effort to help us get around and even suggested places to visit that were nearby. I highly recommend this hotel. Even if you have more money to spend, I'd recommend satying here for the comfort and warm treatment alone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: darashukoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porte Doree in June 2004 and loved it. It is located right above the metro station and one can reach the tourist center of Paris in 15-20 minutes. There is a Boulangerie next door and numerous other restaurants including a McDonald's for those who get the craving for junk food. I had all my meals at the Cascades, the cafe facing the crossing. The hotel was clean, well managed and comfortable. I found the staff quite friendly though I did struggle a bit in my novice French with the evening manager who clearly understood English but wouldn't speak a word, but I think thats to be expected. At 50 odd euros you can't get better deal in Paris - and I was there at the peak of the tourist season. Finally, the bathroom, though a tad small, was clean - and along with clean sheets, that completed my requirements in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kilmistr
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel. No it is not downtown Paris, but only a few subway stops away. The staff were all very nice from the maids to the reception desk. If you need help finding something in Paris, just ask the front desk. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The shower was a bit small, but is typical of European hotels. The T.V. was remote control and worked fine. Plenty of hot water for the shower, although I found the bathroom to be slightly drafty. Yes you can hear the subway and it may be a problem for light sleepers, but it never bothered me. It mostly sounds like very distant thunder. The elevator is very very narrow, although you can take the stairs. If the hallways appear dark, the lights automatically turn on when you enter a hallway. I would definetly stay here again. You cannot beat the price and the attitude of the staff. I wish more hotels in europe were like this hotel. If you need to do laundry, there is a place just a short walk away. Cheap and easy to use as well. The hotel is located on a street with a McDonalds on one side and Quick Hamburger on the other. If you are arriving by subway from downtown Paris, exit the subway carriage and walk away from the direction the subway is going. Take the left exit in the hall and you should be near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Porte Doree was incredible”
Reviews.Author: Jerellin
